description:
If you're looking for a furry friend who is not only cute but also incredibly affectionate and playful, then look no further than Captain, the gorgeous 3-month-old seal point Siamese kitten. This little bundle of joy is sure to melt your heart with his tender nature and loving personality.

Captain is a playful kitten who loves to explore his surroundings and engage in interactive play. Whether it's chasing after a toy mouse or pouncing on a feather wand, this little guy is always up for some fun and games. His energy and curiosity will keep you entertained for hours on end.

One of Captain's most endearing qualities is his affectionate nature. He loves nothing more than snuggling up in your lap or being held close to your chest. His purrs are sure to make you feel warm and fuzzy inside, and his gentle nuzzles will make you feel truly loved.

Worried about the mess that comes with owning a kitten? Fear not, as Captain is already litter box trained. This means that you can enjoy all the perks of having a furry companion without having to deal with any unwanted accidents around the house.

If you have other cats or children at home, Captain will fit right in. He is friendly and sociable with both feline and human companions, making him the perfect addition to any household. His gentle demeanor and playful antics will make him a favorite among all members of the family. Captain has never been around dogs. 

For Pet's Sake Rescue is a Mississippi based rescue. All animals are currently in MS. Mississippi is overpopulated with too many animals, not enough adopters, and many high kill shelters. For Pet's Sake Rescue saves each animal from a different background. 

***Breed input is required for each platform but is not guaranteed to be accurate. We do not DNA test. We rescue animals from different situations.We discuss breed assignments with our vets to label them as accurately as possible.***

For Pet's Sake Rescue transports animals to other states for better adoption potential. Our goal is to keep animals alive and out of kennels into their forever homes as quickly as possible. Each animal is quarantined and vetted during their time in our care. Each adopted pet is spayed/neutered, vaccinated, dewormed, microchipped and has current flea treatment unless otherwise noted. 

You can visit our website at www.forpetssakerescue.org for our full adoption process and adoption application. Once we review your application and check your vet reference, we will contact you to proceed. If both parties agree to the adoption, we will send you an Adoption Contract with an invoice. Once the invoice is paid, your pet is "on hold" for you to pick up or we can transport the pet to a designated location closer to you via transport. Transports are arranged for specific dates. We will discuss these dates and locations with you during the initial phone call. 

We are currently unable to adopt pets to ME and RI residents.

Any of our adoptable animals can be transported unless otherwise noted in their profile. View all of our adopted animals at www.forpetssakerescue.org

Meet the adorable 3-month-old happy fun kitten! This little ball of fur is not only incredibly cute but also comes with a plethora of wonderful qualities that make it the perfect addition to any household.

One of the first things you'll notice about this kitten is its playful and social nature. Whether it's chasing after a feather toy, pouncing on a ball, or simply curling up in your lap for a cuddle session, this kitten is always up for some fun and interaction. Its playful antics will surely bring joy and laughter into your home.

If you already have other cats or older children in your household, fret not! This happy fun kitten is known for its friendly and sociable demeanor, making it a great companion for both feline friends and older kids. It will easily adapt to its new environment and form strong bonds with its furry and human companions.

One of the most important aspects of owning a cat is their litter training. The good news is that this kitten is already litter trained, saving you the hassle of having to teach it where to do its business. With this little one around, you can rest assured that your home will stay clean and odor-free.

Are you looking for a furry bundle of joy to bring into your home? Look no further than Fuego, the adorable 3.5-month-old kitten who is guaranteed to melt your heart with his playful antics and affectionate nature.

Fuego is the epitome of a lively kitten - always on the go and ready to play at a moment's notice. From chasing after laser pointers to pouncing on feather toys, this little guy is full of energy and will keep you entertained for hours on end. If you're looking for a companion to keep you on your toes, Fuego is the perfect match.

While Fuego is the epitome of energy, his brother Blanco is the complete opposite - calm, cool, and collected. Together, they make the perfect pair, balancing each other out with their contrasting personalities. Whether they're snuggled up together for a nap or engaging in a playful chase around the house, these two brothers are inseparable.

Not only is Fuego a joy to have around, but he also gets along well with other cats and older children. His friendly and social nature makes him a great addition to any multi-pet household, as he is always up for making new friends and spreading joy wherever he goes.

Despite his boundless energy, Fuego is also incredibly affectionate and loves nothing more than curling up in your lap for a cuddle session. His purrs are sure to warm your heart, and his gentle nuzzles will make you feel loved and appreciated. If you're looking for a furry friend who will always be by your side, Fuego is the perfect choice.

Cassidy came into the shelter alongside his sibling Butch. They are 3-months-old and very mellow young kittens. They were shy upon arrival, but now are enjoying gentle affection and treats on the regular. Cassidy is the more outgoing of the pair, but nonetheless would greatly benefit from being adopted alongside another similarly-aged kitten (hopefully Butch!) to allow for social interaction! If you are interested in Cassidy please give us a call or stop in to meet him!

Are you a cat lover looking for your daily dose of cuteness? Look no further! Let me introduce you to Blanco, a charming 3.5-month-old kitten who is stealing hearts everywhere with his chill demeanor and lovable personality.

One of Blanco's unique quirks is his love for sitting in sinks. Whether it's the bathroom sink or the kitchen sink, you can often find him perched there, looking utterly content. There's just something about the cool porcelain. It's both adorable and amusing to witness!

Despite his young age, Blanco is incredibly affectionate. He loves cuddling up to his humans, purring contentedly as he receives pets and scratches behind the ears. It's heartwarming to see how much love he has to give, making him the perfect companion for anyone in need of a furry friend.

Blanco has a brother, named Fuego, who is a bundle of energy. While Blanco may be more on the laid-back side, he enjoys watching Fuego play with his toys and explore their surroundings. It's clear that the bond between these two kittens is strong, and it's heartening to see them interact and care for each other.

If you're looking to add some joy and warmth to your days, Blanco is the perfect kitten for you. His chill personality, love for sinks, and affectionate nature make him a delightful companion who will brighten up your home in an instant.

Butch came into the shelter alongside his sibling Cassidy. They are 3-months-old and very mellow young kittens. They were shy upon arrival, but now are enjoying gentle affection and treats on the regular. Butch is the more quiet of the pair and would greatly benefit from being adopted alongside another similarly-aged kitten to help promote confidence through social interaction! If you are interested in Butch please give us a call or stop in to meet him!
Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Hello! My name is Madaline.
I am currently enjoying the comfort of my foster home. I was feeling quite nervous at the shelter but in a home, my true colors are shining though. I am a pretty laid back gal who loves to snuggle in bed. I will lay on your chest and purr you to sleep. In my foster home I have learned that dogs are a bit scary so I would be more comfortable if i found a permanent home without any. 
If you adopt me I promise to give you love and affection everyday!
Hi my name is Doodlebug. I am a fun loving lad looking to have oodles and oodles of fun. My favorite things are cuddles and playtime so come on in. Would love to meet you.

If you are looking for an extremely handsome, easy going, affectionate male cat, Big Boy is your guy. And, he has the most beautiful eyes. If you would like to meet/adopt Big Boy, text me 315-440-0902. Rita

Meet April, a sweetheart who is mother to Rowan and Liam! This beauty has the prettiest gray and fawn torti-tabby ("torbie") coat and green eyes that will mesmerize you. She is only about 1 year old and was lucky enough to be taken off the streets before having her first litter of kittens. April proved to be a good first-time mom but is now ready to be spoiled and have it be all about her. Barely more than a kitten herself, April is starting to come into her own and is looking for someone to cultivate a relationship with her. She loves attention, play and of course lots of treats. April is ready to find her forever home and bring sparkle to her new family!

April has been spayed, vaccinated, microchipped, flea treated, and has tested negative for Feline Leukemia and Feline AIDS.

To express an interest in adopting one or two or three of us, you need to fill out our adoption application, including as much detail as possible at https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/. Please be sure that your email address is correct. If your application is accepted, KittyCorner will contact you via email to set up a time for you to come and meet her.

We require a donation of $100 per cat which will contribute to the cost of veterinary care that the cat(s) received for all the above-mentioned procedures/treatments.

KittyCorner is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR0279.

*All kittycorner.org kittens/cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time, for any reason they need to be returned/rehomed, please just return them to KittyCorner. We will happily take them back as our mission is to ensure that all our adoptees will always have a safe place to stay and call home.

Fenimore came in alongside his three siblings. At first, this litter was undersocialized and struggled with confidence in the shelter environment. Luckily, a wonderful foster stepped up and the litter is spending time decompressing and learning the ropes of life in a home. Every day they make strides and are steadily transforming into exuberant kittens! If you are interested in Fenimore or any of his siblings, we encourage you to give us a call!

Double Day came in alongside his three siblings. At first, this litter was undersocialized and struggled with confidence in the shelter environment. Luckily, a wonderful foster stepped up and the litter is spending time decompressing and learning the ropes of life in a home. Every day they make strides and are steadily transforming into exuberant kittens! If you are interested in Double Day or any of his siblings, we encourage you to give us a call!

Smithy came in alongside his three siblings. At first, this litter was undersocialized and struggled with confidence in the shelter environment. Luckily, a wonderful foster stepped up and the litter is spending time decompressing and learning the ropes of life in a home. Every day they make strides and are steadily transforming into exuberant kittens! If you are interested in Smithy or any of his siblings, we encourage you to give us a call!

If you like your cats big, Big Girl is the one for you. She is so big and so sweet. Big Girl does well with other cats, dogs, people and anything else on the planet. If you would like to meet/adopt Big Girl, text me 315-440-0902. Rita

Waldo came into the shelter alongside his sister Willa. Both are 4-years-old and are used to life in a home. Waldo is a gentle soul. He enjoys attention, but likes to maintain time to be independent too. Waldo and Willa are used to living together and would do well in a home together, though this is not a rigid requirement. If you would like more information on these kitties, give us a call or stop in to meet them!

Willa came into the shelter alongside her brother Waldo. Both are 4-years-old and are used to life in a home. Willa is a chatty cat with a bold personality. She enjoys a little bit of everything, whether it be food, attention, or time alone. Willa and Waldo are used to living together and would do well in a home together, though this is not a rigid requirement. If you would like more information on these kitties, give us a call or stop in to meet them!
Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Hi!
We are Chai and Chamomile, two female sisters looking for a home together as we are the best of friends. You can tell us apart by looking for Chais white neck/chest. We love to play and wrestle with each other as we have a lot of energy! Unfortunately, our first home did not work out because of how much we like to play and how interactive we are. Our favorite things to do are play and nap with one another. We love playing with string toys, springs, and stuffed mice. We have a lot of energy and would be great in a home with a young couple/person, children, and/or other pets. We have never been around dogs, but we adapt well to any situation so likely would be no problem once we got to know them. We are bonded and want to find our forever home together! We are fixed, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, free of fleas and worms, FIV/FELV negative, and super adorable! Come meet us :)


Apply online at cnycatcoalition.org/adoption/adoption-application (say you saw the cat on Petfinder). 

Your donation of $160 per kitten (kittens are microchipped) will contribute to the cost of veterinary treatments the cat has received, such as spay/neuter, rabies and distemper vaccines, testing, deworming, and flea and ear mite treatments.

CNYCC is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR099
Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.
Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Egg Drop just turned 3 months old, he is a very affectionate boy, loves attention and being held. Egg Drop is part of a large kitten play group and should do well with most any family. He has a slender build, loves to jump, climb and wrestle with the other kittens!

If you are looking for a dynamic duo, is brother Clam Chowder is available to be adopted with him!!

Egg Drop has been introduced to dogs, and does fine with dogs that are respectful to cats.

When you adopt from us, you create space that will allow us to continue our saving efforts and help more kittens like Egg Drop in need.

PLEASE READ THIS TO ADOPT:

We only adopt kittens in pairs unless there is another young (2 years or younger) cat already in the home for the new kitten to play with. Having a feline friend can be incredibly beneficial for their social and emotional well-being, providing comfort and support throughout their lives.

There is a discount when adopting more than one pet.

Please COPY and PASTE the following URL for the adoption application:

https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/FPSL/Cat

COMPLETED APPLICATIONS TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER INQUIRIES. If you are interested in adopting, the FIRST step is to complete an application. 

Please note that our animals are rescued and transported from South Mississippi where major animal overpopulation means less homes. We only transport them if adopted, in most instances, we can be available for a video call once an application has been approved.

We are USDA certified and WE PERSONALLY TRANSPORT OUR adopted animals to meet their new families. We transport every 2-3 weeks.

Our adoption fee includes the spay/neuter, age appropriate vaccinations, Microchip, Mississippi Health Certificate, and the transport service to get the new family pet to you

Cake is a petite girl weighing only 6 lbs at 8 months old so she will stay on the small side as an adult. Cake is a TOTAL LOVEBUG! If you are looking for a very affectionate girl that wants to be where you are at, this is your girl! She loves to be held and will lay in your arms for as long as you let her. She likes to sit in the office assistant :)

She takes a little while to warm up to other cats and she does well with respectful dogs. She does stay in a room with quite a few other cats though.

She has been spayed, she is current on all vaccinations, rabies, flea prevention and microchipped and tested negative for FIV/FeLV.

PLEASE READ THIS TO ADOPT:

Please copy and paste the following URL for the adoption application:

https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/FPSL/Cat

COMPLETED APPLICATIONS TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER INQUIRIES. If you are interested in adopting, the FIRST step is to complete an application. 

Please note that our animals are rescued and transported from South Mississippi where major animal overpopulation means less homes. We only transport them if adopted, in most instances, we can be available for a video call once an application has been approved.

We are USDA certified and WE PERSONALLY TRANSPORT OUR OWN adopted animals to meet their new families. We transport every 2-3 weeks.

Our adoption fee includes the spay/neuter, age appropriate vaccinations, Microchip, Mississippi Health Certificate, and the transport service to get the new family pet to you

Hi my name is Aramis. I am one of the three musketeer. Athos and Porthos are my brothers and we are full of kitten fun. Our favorite time is romping and playing but also love the cuddle times. Although we are siblings, we would be happy for each of us to have a loving family. As we say, "All for one and one for all", so head on down to meet the awesome musketeers.

Hi my name is Porthos. I am one of the three musketeers. Athos and Aramis are my brothers and we are full of kitten fun. Our favorite time in playtime and cuddle time. Although we are siblings we would be happy for each of us to have a loving family. As we say, "All for one and one for all" so come on in.

Hi my name is Athos. I am one of the three musketeers. Porthos and Aramis are my brothers and we are full of kitten fun. We all love to romp and play. Not to mention cuddle time. Although we are siblings, we would be happy for each of us to have a loving family. As we say, "All for one and one for all" so come on in to visit.

**Meet 3 Month Old Penelope: The Curious and Spunky Kitten**

Penelope is a curious, shy, and spunky kitten ready to find her forever home with her sister Daphne. She loves to play with her sister and enjoys being up high, watching everything around her with keen interest.

Penelope gets along well with other cats and dogs. Although she’s not the biggest fan of being held, she loves pets and belly rubs, showing her affectionate side in her own unique way. Her curiosity and spunk make her an entertaining and endearing companion.

Penelope would be best suited for a home with someone who can let her be a kitten, allowing her to grow and learn. She would thrive in an environment where she has plenty of room to run and climb, satisfying her adventurous spirit.

Penelope is bonded with her sister, Daphne, so they need to be adopted together. This special bond ensures they will bring double the joy and love to their new home. If you’re looking for a pair of playful and loving kittens, Penelope and Daphne are the perfect match!


DISCLAIMER- Breed type is determined based on general appearance and behavioral characteristics and cannot be guaranteed unless DNA test results were provided at intake.

** OUR CATS ARE FOSTERED IN TEXAS, BUT AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION AND TRANSPORT OUT OF STATE. Read below for more information.

Our cats are transported to a predetermined location agreed upon by the rescue. The adoption contract and fee are finalized prior to transport. As a Pep's Pals Rescue direct adoption, the adoption interview/meet and greet occurs on video call (Skype, FB Messenger call, Facetime, etc).

Our adoption fee is $300 for the bonded pair ($150 each) plus health certificate and transport (varies by location). This fee includes all current vaccinations, deworming, microchip (additional $13 lifetime registration fee required at time of adoption per kitten), spay/neuter, and a FIV/FELV test. A health exam will be completed and a health certificate issued by a veterinarian within 10 days of transport.


If you are interested in adopting, please fill out the adoption application below:
https://petstablished.com/adoption_form/57831/generic

**Meet 3 Month Old Daphne: The Spunky, Affectionate Kitten**

Daphne is a spunky, curious, and affectionate kitten who is looking for a forever home where she can thrive and grow with her sister Penelope. She loves to play with her sister and has a special way of falling into you and snuggling into your neck, making every cuddle session delightful.

Daphne gets along well with other cats and dogs. As a kitten, she still nibbles and makes biscuits on everything, adding a touch of kitten charm to her playful antics. She loves exploring her surroundings and playing, embodying the perfect mix of energy and affection.

Daphne would be best suited for a home with someone who can let her be a kitten and support her learning and growth. She would thrive in an environment where she can run, pounce, and indulge in her playful nature. Importantly, Daphne is bonded with her sister, Penelope, so they need to be adopted together to continue their loving companionship.

Daphne's spunky and affectionate nature, combined with her bond with Penelope, makes her an ideal addition to a loving home ready to embrace the joy and energy of two playful kittens. If you're looking for a pair of loving, playful, yet different kittens to add to your family, Daphne and Penelope are the perfect match!


DISCLAIMER- Breed type is determined based on general appearance and behavioral characteristics and cannot be guaranteed unless DNA test results were provided at intake.

** OUR CATS ARE FOSTERED IN TEXAS, BUT AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION AND TRANSPORT OUT OF STATE. Read below for more information.

If you are interested in adopting, please fill out the adoption application below:
https://petstablished.com/adoption_form/57831/generic

Meet Malarkey, brother to Timothy, Limerick and Maguire. This bunch of mackerel striped tabby kittens will Riverdance their way straight into your heart! Born April 22, 2024 to a sweet tiny cat named Daisy (also posted for adoption), this bunch packs a punch. Malarkey is the character of the bunch and is sure to add some spice to your life! He is an adventurous kitten who loves to explore, chase toys and climb high. This little fur ball is ready to find his forever home where he can bring a lifetime of laughs, come meet him and his brothers today!

Malarkey has been neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, flea treated, and has tested negative for Feline Leukemia and Feline AIDS.

*All kittens need to be adopted in pairs unless going to a home with another young, playful cat or cats who would be very friendly and accepting of a new kitten. We have many options for pairing, including litter mates, other kittens and young to adult cats. We will happily help you decide on the right combo if you like!

To express an interest in adopting one or two or three of us, you need to fill out our adoption application, including as much detail as possible at https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/. Please be sure that your email address is correct. If your application is accepted, KittyCorner will contact you via email to set up a time for you to come and meet him.

We require a donation of $100 per cat which will contribute to the cost of veterinary care that the cat(s) received for all the above-mentioned procedures/treatments.

KittyCorner is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR0279.

description:
Kai (blue/gray eyes) and his sister Kinder (golden eyes) are ready to bring excitement and unconditional love to one lucky family.  This pair of kittens are outgoing, affectionate, they LOVE to be carried around and held. They are well socialized with other cats and do well with respectful dogs.

Kai & Kinder are just over 2 1/2 months old, they are available to adopt for our next transport the weekend of August 17th/18th. YOU CAN'T HELP BUT TO FALL IN LOVE WITH THESE TWO!!!

I am an affectionate little girl who is sweet, petite, and ready to meet! I have the cutest little voice to chit chat with and the softest little frame for cuddles! I love to get head and face rubs, attention is my favorite! I am also an outgoing and confident girl who likes to play and explore! My cuteness, cuddliness, and goofiness makes me the purr-fect choice for a fun and loving companion!

Meet Limerick, brother to Maguire, Timothy and Malarkey. This bunch of mackerel striped tabby kittens will RiverDance their way straight into your heart! Born April 22, 2024 to a sweet tiny cat named Daisy (also posted for adoption), this bunch packs a punch. Limerick's special talents include cuddling, purring, and posing for the camera. He is also highly skilled in chasing toys and climbing cat trees. Now Limerick is looking for his forever home where he will be given all the love and attention he deserves! In return he will give you a lifetime of laughter, love, and joy!

In the vast world of feline companionship, there are some special bonds that go beyond the ordinary. Meet Asia and Dionne, a truly inseparable bonded pair of cats whose connection runs deep. These two furry siblings not only depend on each other but also showcase a level of affection and camaraderie that is truly heartwarming.

Asia and Dionne are not your average cats. They are cuddly, shy, and have a special bond that is evident to anyone who sets eyes on them. These two feline companions love nothing more than being by each other's side, whether it's lounging in the sun together or curling up for a cozy nap.

Despite their shy nature with new humans, Asia and Dionne are incredibly affectionate cats. They enjoy being petted and cuddled, and they have a gentle and loving demeanor that makes them a joy to be around. Their quiet presence and sweet personalities make them the perfect companions for anyone looking for a little feline love in their life.

While Asia and Dionne may be a bonded pair, they are also great with other cats. They are friendly and sociable, and they have a knack for getting along with their furry counterparts. Their easygoing nature and gentle demeanor make them a welcome addition to any feline family.

While Asia and Dionne may be cat-friendly, they are not fans of dogs.

For Pet's Sake Rescue is a Mississippi based rescue. All animals are currently in MS. These girls can be transported to Albany, NY. Mississippi is overpopulated with too many animals, not enough adopters, and many high kill shelters. For Pet's Sake Rescue saves each animal from a different background. 

***Breed input is required for each platform but is not guaranteed to be accurate. We do not DNA test. We rescue animals from different situations. We discuss breed assignments with our vets to label them as accurately as possible.***

For Pet's Sake Rescue transports animals to other states for better adoption potential. Our goal is to keep animals alive and out of kennels into their forever homes as quickly as possible. Each animal is quarantined and vetted during their time in our care. Each adopted pet is spayed/neutered, vaccinated, dewormed, microchipped and has current flea treatment unless otherwise noted. 

You can visit our website at www.forpetssakerescue.org for our full adoption process and adoption application. Once we review your application and check your vet reference, we will contact you to proceed. If both parties agree to the adoption, we will send you an Adoption Contract with an invoice. Once the invoice is paid, your pet is "on hold" for you to pick up or we can transport the pet to a designated location closer to you via transport. Transports are arranged for specific dates. We will discuss these dates and locations with you during the initial phone call. 

We are currently unable to adopt pets to ME and RI residents.

Any of our adoptable animals can be transported unless otherwise noted in their profile. View all of our adopted animals at www.forpetssakerescue.org/

Meet Auggie and Amara! They are looking to be adopted as a pair. Amara is a female longhair gray female who was abandoned by her mother as a newborn and raised as a bottle baby. Auggie is a male gray shorthair with the most adorable white toes on his hind paws. He was taken in around the time that both kittens were about 2 weeks old so that Amara wouldn’t be a single kitten. 


Thankfully, all ended up well and they bonded immediately. Both kittens have very different personalities; however, they complement each other wonderfully.

Amara is more fear-free and quicker to trust. She still takes a bit to settle in but once she does she is the more outgoing of the two. She loves getting affection and is really just as sweet as can be.

Auggie is the more cautious of the two but once he settles in he is playful, goofy and loving. Amara definitely helps him come out of his shell when they are in new environments and adjusting to new people and things.
Auggie is also super sweet but not quite as cuddly as Amara is. That being said, they both play hard and rest hard and they are people loving kitties who need a home that can provide lots of love.

Because Auggie can be a bit shy at first, their foster mom thinks that while they would do well and adjust to a multitude of home environments that it would be best if the home wasn’t extremely loud and busy.
Older children would be best versus toddlers. Adopters will need some patience to let them settle in. They are used to dog sounds, smells and sights but have not had direct contact with dogs.
A calm dog without a tendency to chase should be fine so long as they are introduced appropriately.
They both should also do well with other cats and even if the other cat(s) weren’t super keen on kitten shenanigans and playing Amara and Auggie do just fine keeping each other busy and happy.

If interested in adopting Amara and Auggie, the first step is filling out an adoption application at cnycatcoalition.org/adoption/adoption-application. Just make sure that you note the app is for Auggie and Amara on Petfinder. 

Please if possible text their foster mom Laura to let her know when you have submitted an application at 315-415-7572.

Once an application is received it will be processed and if approved, we will set up a meet and greet +/- potential adoption.

*Both kittens are tested negative for Feline Aids (FIV), Feline Leukemia (FeLV) and heart worm disease. They are up to date on their FVRCP vaccine boosters and dewormed thoroughly along with being on monthly flea prevention. Their spay/neuter and rabies vaccine will be done when they are 4-5 months old and their foster mom will help orchestrate this unless you prefer to use your own vet.

Apply online at cnycatcoalition.org/adoption/adoption-application (say you saw the cat on Petfinder). 

Your donation of $140 each ($160 if the kitten is microchipped) will contribute to the cost of veterinary treatments the cat has received, such as spay/neuter, rabies and distemper vaccines, testing, deworming, and flea and ear mite treatments.

CNYCC is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR099

*All kittycorner.org kittens/cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time, for any reason they need to be returned/rehomed, please just return them to KittyCorner. We will happily take them back as our mission is to ensure that all our adoptees will always have a safe place to stay and call home.

Rowan "thanks his lucky charms" he ended up here! His beautiful mother April (also posted for adoption) was a young pregnant stray who was desperately looking for a place to have her kittens. Luckily, she ran into the right person at the right time! Now Rowan and his brothers Liam and Killian, born on April 18, 2024, are ready for adoption! All three brothers have the most whirly swirly classic tabby coats and the most brilliant green eyes. Rowan is what you would call the big brother, the leader - he is the cool one! He loves to explore and of course lead his brothers into all kinds of trouble. He has the most white in his coat and a face that just makes you smile. Consider yourself lucky for stumbling upon his post and apply to adopt him before your luck runs out and he is gone!

Rowan has been neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, flea treated, and has tested negative for Feline Leukemia and Feline AIDS.

*All kittens need to be adopted in pairs unless going to a home with another young, playful cat or cats who would be very friendly and accepting of a new kitten. We have many options for pairing, including litter mates, other kittens and young to adult cats. We will happily help you decide on the right combo if you like!

To express an interest in adopting one or two or three of us, you need to fill out our adoption application, including as much detail as possible at https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/. Please be sure that your email address is correct. If your application is accepted, KittyCorner will contact you via email to set up a time for you to come and meet him.

We require a donation of $100 per cat, which will contribute to the cost of veterinary care that the cat(s) received for all the above-mentioned procedures/treatments.

KittyCorner is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR0279.

Are you looking for a new feline companion to brighten up your home? Look no further than Apricot, a rare 14-week-old female orange tabby with a unique personality that is sure to steal your heart. Apricot is not your average orange tabby. With her striking coat and rare gender for the coloration, she is truly a gem among felines. 

One thing you'll notice about Apricot right away is her playful and vocal nature. She loves to chase after toys, climb to new heights, and engage in interactive play with her human companions. Her meows are sweet and melodic, making her a joy to be around.

Despite her initial shyness, Apricot is great with dogs, cats, and children. She is a social butterfly once she warms up to you and will quickly become the center of attention in any room. Her friendly demeanor makes her a perfect fit for households with multiple pets or young children.

Apricot is always on the lookout for new adventures. Whether it's exploring a new room in the house or investigating a mysterious noise, she approaches everything with curiosity and excitement. You'll love watching her boundless energy and zest for life.

If you're interested in adding Apricot to your family, be prepared for a playful and loving companion who will bring endless joy into your life. With her unique looks, friendly personality, and adventurous spirit, Apricot is sure to make a lasting impression on everyone she meets.



For Pet's Sake Rescue is a Mississippi based rescue. All animals are currently in MS. Apricot can be transported to Albany, NY. Mississippi is overpopulated with too many animals, not enough adopters, and many high kill shelters. For Pet's Sake Rescue saves each animal from a different background. 

***Breed input is required for each platform but is not guaranteed to be accurate. We do not DNA test. We rescue animals from different situations. We discuss breed assignments with our vets to label them as accurately as possible.***

For Pet's Sake Rescue transports animals to other states for better adoption potential. Our goal is to keep animals alive and out of kennels into their forever homes as quickly as possible. Each animal is quarantined and vetted during their time in our care. Each adopted pet is spayed/neutered, vaccinated, dewormed, microchipped and has current flea treatment unless otherwise noted. 

You can visit our website at www.forpetssakerescue.org for our full adoption process and adoption application. Once we review your application and check your vet reference, we will contact you to proceed. If both parties agree to the adoption, we will send you an Adoption Contract with an invoice. Once the invoice is paid, your pet is "on hold" for you to pick up or we can transport the pet to a designated location closer to you via transport. Transports are arranged for specific dates. We will discuss these dates and locations with you during the initial phone call. 

We are currently unable to adopt pets to ME and RI residents.

Any of our adoptable animals can be transported unless otherwise noted in their profile. View all of our adopted animals at www.forpetssakerescue.org

She is so very playful and fun, she will definitely need to be adopted with a sibling or to a home with another playful cat to truly thrive. She is spayed, microchipped, litter trained, and a purrfect, delicate, little lady!

Pearl is a petite little cuddle bug who loves playing with her toys and playing with her foster siblings. She loves head pets and when you stop petting her, she will let you know she wants more because she will take her paw to gently tap you to let you know you’re not done petting her ? Sasha is featured within the Clay PetSmart! Come meet her today!

Sasha Colby is truly a Queen who would like to be in charge of your household. Soft, stunning and affectionate, she uses her polydactyl mittens to grab your hand so she can give kisses. She will also talk to you loudly when she wants her meals. 

Sasha is curious, affectionate and very playful. Her favorite toys so far are her racetrack glitter ball and her rainbow ribbon wand. 

Though Sasha gets on well with other cats, we think Sasha would like to the leader of her cat group and therefore would do best in a home with submissive male cats or non-dominant female cats. 

Sasha is negative for FIV and FeLV and will need to remain an indoor only cat. 

She is ready to take over your heart and your home. Apply today and adopt a legend!

Meet Garland, a graceful 7-year-old cat named after the legendary Judy Garland, who's on her own yellow brick road in search of a loving home. Having overcome a challenging past, Garland is still adjusting to shelter life but shows great potential for a brighter future. She initially prefers quiet spaces to hide away, but her curiosity and gentle nature shine through when given some gentle face pets and attention.
Garland is social with other cats and has previous experience living with a dog, though their relationship remains a mystery. With patience and understanding, Garland is sure to bloom into a devoted companion. If you're ready to offer Garland the stability and love she deserves, come meet her and discover how she can bring warmth and joy into your home, just like her namesake did on stage and screen.

Introducing Elton, a distinguished 4-year-old cat named after the legendary Elton John! Despite a difficult past, Elton is adapting to shelter life and shows great promise for a loving home environment. Initially shy and fond of finding cozy hideouts, Elton quickly warms up to gentle attention and affection. His sweet nature shines through once he feels secure, making him an ideal companion for a patient and caring adopter.
Elton gets along well with other cats and has previous experience with dogs, although his relationship with them remains uncertain. With a bit of patience and understanding, Elton is sure to blossom into a cherished member of your family. If you're ready to give Elton the loving home he deserves, come meet him and see how this resilient cat can bring joy and companionship into your life!

Meet Milo, a handsome orange male cat.  Milo has found himself in the bustling environment of a shelter. At an estimated age of 3-5 years, he is no longer a kitten, but still possesses an inquisitive air as he likes to peek around to see what is going on. Despite his new surroundings, Milo’s quiet nature and adaptability allow him to observe and adjust to the unfamiliar shelter life. Milo is a mild and sweet boy.  Surrendered in May 2024, Milo’s journey may have had an uncertain beginning, but his resilient spirit carries him forward in search of a new home and family to call his own.

He has been neutered, tested negative for FeLV/FIV, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines.

Email us at info@cnysnap.org or visit the shelter if you'd like to meet our mild guy Milo.

Kathy is a delightful three-year-old domestic short-haired calico female who is ready to bring joy and companionship to her forever home. She is an adorable blend of independence and affection, embodying the best qualities of a feline companion.

While Kathy enjoys her own space and is content to explore and play on her own, she also loves to cuddle. Her soft meow and soothing purr are sure to melt your heart. Kathy is playful and curious, with a particular fondness for wand toys, scratchers, and sunny windows offering a view of the world outside.

Kathy has a gentle nature that extends to children as well. She was gentle and friendly with an 8-year-old child who visited her, demonstrating her adaptability and sociability.

Rescued as a pregnant stray, Kathy has shown her nurturing side by lovingly caring for her kittens, who have since found their own homes. Now, it's Kathy's turn to find a loving home where she can enjoy the carefree life she deserves.

If you have a warm heart and a cozy lap, Kathy could be the perfect addition to your family. Consider opening your home to this charming kitty and give her the forever home she so deserves.

Jeep is a charming young male cat who is currently looking for a loving home. He is proudly presented for adoption by the CNY Cat Coalition.

Jeep is a domestic short-haired feline with a striking black and white coat. At approximately 12-14 months old, he’s just stepping into his prime. His youthful energy is balanced by a laid-back demeanor that makes him a joy to be around.

One of Jeep’s most endearing qualities is his sweet nature. He’s a gentle soul who quickly warms up to new people. Once he’s comfortable with you, which usually doesn’t take long, he’s not shy about expressing himself. In fact, Jeep can be quite vocal, often engaging in adorable “conversations” with his human friends.

Jeep is also great with other cats, making him an excellent addition to a multi-cat household. However, his easy-going personality means he’d be equally happy as an only pet.

In short, Jeep is a delightful cat who is ready to bring joy and companionship to his forever home. If you’re looking for a sweet, sociable, and slightly chatty feline friend, Jeep could be the perfect match for you.

*Come visit Jubilee at Petsmart in Clay!

Jubilee is a cute little approximately 1yr old calico girl who was rescued after being abandoned on a strangers porch. She is a sweet baby who loves to be snuggled, she can't get enough love! 

She gets overwhelmed with emotions and gives love bites after a while of petting, so I'm learning her cues, and when her tail starts to flick about, she's done with pets until she chills a bit. I could tell as soon as she was rescued that she gets her emotions confused sometimes...like sometimes  she will be bumping your hand for attention while letting out a slight growl, but she definitely means to meow. 

Poor girl just needs time to learn. I don't think she was treated the best in her previous living situation so she is definitely still learning how to properly respond to people. She's never reacted in any way that concerns me, and she has been gentle with the kittens in the room too. She just needs a home where someone will love her and treat her with kindness and patience.

Jubilee has been spayed, fully vaccinated, dewormed, flea treated, tested negative for felv/fiv, and she is microchipped.

Vera was born outside and is learning all about inside life and humans. Her name means "faith," which she definitely embodies, as she was the last kitten trapped!

Please contact Amy at (315) 753-9227 and/or Voice4TheVoicelessAdoptions@gmail.com for more information on how to adopt Vera.

Hi everyone, I'm Matcha!

I was found outside caring for my kittens prior to foster care and not much is known about my life prior. Now that my kittens are older and weaned, I am looking for my forever home! I am a young 2-year-old cat who loves people. My favorite moments are when I'm being cuddled and petted. My favorite treat is cat nip and I would love a scratching post to stretch on! I have not been around dogs, or children however I am very gentle and likely would do fine in homes with them. I am good with other kitties and have been around my foster mom's own 3 kitties without issue. String toys, love, a comfy spot next to my human(s) and a window are some of the things I would like in my future home. I would love to meet you and be your new companion!

You can meet Matcha at the Fairmount PetSmart where she is up for adoption!

**Microchipped**

Safari and her friend Nala were surrendered to the shelter in May 2024. They had been in a loving home with children but unfortunately circumstances arose and the family couldn't keep them. They had been with the family since they were kittens. Safari is 6 years old and Nala is 5. The former owner described both as "very loveable". She can be easily approached and pet. Safari sometimes likes to hangout alone but has been bonded with Nala.  We hope they can find a new home to mend their broken hearts. We would be thrilled if they could both be adopted together but understand not everyone can take two cats.

She has been spayed, tested negative for FeLV/FIV, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines.

Email us at info@cnysnap.org or visit the shelter if you'd like to meet our sensational Safari.

MEET STANLEY AND CHARLIE
Stanley and Charlie lost their longtime human companion when he died of cancer in June. With no family in the area and the house being vacated on June 30th, Stanley and Charlie are looking for a new forever home.
 
Stanley is 13 and Charlie is 14. They are healthy but for conditions common in elderly cats.
Charlie has arthritis and gets a steroid injection every 4 months.
Stanley takes methimazole for early-stage hyperthyroidism.
 
These sweet old boys were the light of their human’s life and they miss him. Being such longtime friends, they need to be adopted together. A loving home, preferably without dogs or small children, would be ideal for them to spend their golden years in peace and contentment.
 
Apply online at cnycatcoalition.org/adoption/adoption-application (say you saw them on Petfinder).

Meet Moxie, a remarkable 5-year-old cat with a heart of gold and a story of resilience. Moxie and her kittens faced daunting challenges, yet their spirit prevailed, bringing them here to find loving homes. Moxie is gentle and affectionate, with a nurturing soul that shines through her soft fur. She loves curling up for quiet moments and delights in gentle pets and soothing whispers. Do you have room in your heart for this "odd couple"? They are a bonded pair looking for a home together!

Jake is a solid tank of a cat, probably 7-10 years old, who is extremely outgoing and social with everyone. He loves petting and treats and will meow at you until he gets attention. He's even ok with being help upside down like a baby. He needs to lose the weight he gained in foster care!

Marmalade is 1-2 years old and very playful and active. She is shy compared to Jake but loves petting and she will head butt you even after just meeting you. She loves to chase toys and wrestle with Jake.

Both cats were living as strays in Fulton and were rescued by a kind business owner who saw them in the parking lot. Marmalade was very sick and almost died from an infection in her uterus called pyometra. Thankfully she was able to get an emergency spay to save her life. Jake had many painful missing and broken teeth and recently had dental surgery to fix all of his teeth. He now has no front teeth at all and is doing great!

These two kitties love each other dearly and are always wrestling, grooming each other, and burbling. Marmalade absolutely adores Jake and he likes to be her protector (and steal her food). They both get along well with other cats.

Apply online at cnycatcoalition.org/adoption/adoption-application (say you saw her on Petfinder).

Your adoption fee of $120 each contributes to the cost of veterinary treatments the cat has received, such as spay/neuter, rabies and distemper vaccines, testing, deworming medication, microchips, and flea and ear mite treatments.

CNYCC is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR099

This poor senior lady has had a rough go lately. Her and her housemate were surrendered to the shelter when their family was moving and they could not go with them. Tris is a very shy lady who generally doesn't ask for attention. She definitely appreciates a good pet when it is given to her though. Since entering the program Tris tested positive for FIV, Although this does affect her immune system, she is perfectly okay to house with other healthy cats. Contact SHHS today if you have space in your lap for this senior sweetie pie.

This pretty lady came to us as a scared mother-to-be, giving birth to 2 healthy babies not long after entering the program. As she is still very young herself she has not had very much social interaction. People are scary! Pip is at an early enough age that if someone were willing to take baby steps with her she would make a great companion. If you move nice and slow, she really does appreciate a good chin scratch. Contact SHHS if you are interested in learning more about continuing her domestication! (this would be possible in both a home or working situation)

Meet Sassy, the 2-year-old Siamese cat who is the epitome of sassiness and laziness. She has a personality as bold as her striking blue eyes. 

Sassy is not your typical cat who enjoys the company of other animals. She has made it clear that she prefers to be the sole focus of attention in her domain. Cats and dogs beware - Sassy does not take kindly to sharing her human. She has a regal air about her, expecting to be treated like the queen she believes she is.

Sassy's daily routine consists of lounging in the sun, napping in her favorite spot, and meowing for treats on demand. She has perfected the art of relaxation and takes her role as a professional napper very seriously. Despite her lazy demeanor, Sassy always manages to find a way to make her presence known - whether it's knocking over a plant or climbing to the highest perch in the room.

Sassy craves attention like a moth to a flame. She thrives on being the center of everyone's world and will go to great lengths to ensure she gets the love and admiration she deserves. 



For Pet's Sake Rescue is a Mississippi based rescue. All animals are currently in MS. Mississippi is overpopulated with too many animals, not enough adopters, and many high kill shelters. For Pet's Sake Rescue saves each animal from a different background. 

***Breed input is required for each platform but is not guaranteed to be accurate. We do not DNA test. We rescue animals from different situations.We discuss breed assignments with our vets to label them as accurately as possible.***

For Pet's Sake Rescue transports animals to other states for better adoption potential. Our goal is to keep animals alive and out of kennels into their forever homes as quickly as possible. Each animal is quarantined and vetted during their time in our care. Each adopted pet is spayed/neutered, vaccinated, dewormed, microchipped and has current flea treatment unless otherwise noted. 

You can visit our website at www.forpetssakerescue.org for our full adoption process and adoption application. Once we review your application and check your vet reference, we will contact you to proceed. If both parties agree to the adoption, we will send you an Adoption Contract with an invoice. Once the invoice is paid, your pet is "on hold" for you to pick up or we can transport the pet to a designated location closer to you via transport. Transports are arranged for specific dates. We will discuss these dates and locations with you during the initial phone call. 

We are currently unable to adopt pets to ME and RI residents.

Any of our adoptable animals can be transported unless otherwise noted in their profile. View all of our adopted animals at www.forpetssakerescue.org

Sassy can be transported to Albany, NY

** YOU CAN MEET MATILDA NOW AT PETSMART CAMILLUS!! **

Matilda is a slim, petite, beautiful brown & black tabby cat with white spots & the cutest deep pink dot on her nose! Her foster thinks she must have Siamese in her since she has lots of ticked fur, big eyes & has s deep meow - plus she loves to chat! Matilda is very gentle - one of the sweetest things her foster loves about her (and knows YOU will too!) is she can be picked up and held like a baby on her back in your arms so you can rub her chin while she purrs :-)

Matilda and her four kittens came into foster care a couple months ago, when her babies were just 3 weeks old. Matilda, who's about 1 yr old, was a loving & patient mother and was recently spayed. Matilda gets along well with other cats but is independent enough to be an only cat. (she had to be once she was left to fend for herself by her former owner/s).  Her CNYCC foster doesn't have dogs, but Matilda is spunky & confident and likely can learn to live with a *cat-friendly* dog.

You can meet Matilda now at the CNYCC adoption center inside PetSmart Camillus. To inquire about Matilda or receive an e-application, please contact her CNYCC foster at CNYadoptCats@gmail.com. Applications can also be submitted online here: https://www.cnycatcoalition.org/adoption/adoption-application/

Your donation of $120 will contribute to the cost of Matilda's veterinary treatments such as spaying, rabies and distemper vaccines, testing, microchipping, deworming, and flea and ear mite treatments.

CNYCC is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR099

Meet Patrick Henry, an extremely playful and energetic 11-month-old kitten. When he was young, Patrick developed a feline herpes viral infection, which in cats gives them red, runny eyes and occasional nasal discharge. This is in no way related to human herpes and is not transmissible to humans. Actually, 90-95% of the feline population tests positive for feline herpes virus, but more than 50% show no symptoms. In fact, none of Patrick's littermates developed any symptoms, including his sister and companion, Abigail Adams, with whom he would like to be adopted.

At times of stress, Patrick may need to have his eyes treated with over-the-counter Artificial Tears; or if his nose gets stuffy, he might occasionally need to be put on a course of antibiotics, but even though Patrick was dealt this unlucky hand, he doesn't let it affect him in the slightest. No matter what is going on, I can assure you Patrick will be first on the scene to assess the situation. He is a very curious, cute kitten who will steal your heart as soon as you meet him. Do you have the desire to take this special kitten and his lovely, energetic sister, Abby, in open arms?

Patrick has been neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, flea treated, and has tested negative for FeLV and FIV.

To express an interest in adopting him, you need to fill out our adoption application, including as much detail as possible, at https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/. Please be sure that your email address is correct. If your application is accepted, KittyCorner will contact you via email to set up a time for you to come and meet him.

Your donation of $100 per cat will contribute to the cost of veterinary care that the cat(s) received for all the above-mentioned procedures/treatments.

KittyCorner is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR0279.

*All kittycorner.org kittens/cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time, for any reason they need to be returned/rehomed, please just return them to KittyCorner. We will happily take them back as our mission is to ensure that all our adoptees will always have a safe place to stay and call home.

Ideal emotional support cat for an introvert or someone with anxiety! Smokey is a sweet, friendly 2 year old neutered male cat. He is an American Shorthair, who gets along well with other nice cats (gets scared of territorial cats), and is also ok with nice dogs. He likes older kids if they are calm and gentle, but should not be around tiny tots as he could swat if scared or startled.

Smokey is quite vocal and loves telling you all about his opinions. He wants to be around people all the time, and will follow you around and sleep on your bed if allowed. If left alone away from people, he cries from loneliness, so an owner who does not travel a lot is preferred. Smokey can be shy with strangers at first, so please give him a chance to get used to his new environment.

Smokey is an indoor only cat that uses the litterbox and is fully vaccinated and de-wormed. He is quite allergic to fleas, so he should not be allowed outside and should have monthly flea treatments with Advantage 2, if you have other pets that go outside. Smokey also has sensitive skin, so a household that uses an air purifier is preferred.
Text Smokey's Foster Parent at 315-395-9262 if interested in adopting him. References and rehoming fee required. He comes with all vet paperwork.

If you are looking for a companion for your existing feline friend, Kristoff is the perfect match. His shy nature makes him a great companion for cats who may be more outgoing and in need of a gentle friend to keep them company. Kristoff's calming presence can help your other cat feel at ease and create a harmonious environment in your home.

While shy cats like Kristoff may require a bit more patience and understanding, the rewards of adopting them are immeasurable. Shy cats often form deep bonds with their owners and show immense gratitude for the love and care they receive. By giving a shy cat like Kristoff a chance, you are not only providing a loving home for a deserving animal but also opening your heart to a unique and special bond that will last a lifetime.

 He enjoys the simple pleasures in life, such as treats and cozy naps in the sun. He is gentle, but timid. He had a lot of changes early in life and he would appreciate a family that would let him ease into the new norm. Kristoff came to our rescue as a small kitten. His littermates were with their mom in a colony left to fend for themselves. 

For Pet's Sake Rescue is a Mississippi based rescue. All animals are currently in MS. 

***Breed input is required for each platform but is not guaranteed to be accurate. We do not DNA test. We rescue animals from different situations.We discuss breed assignments with our vets to label them as accurately as possible.***

For Pet's Sake Rescue transports animals to other states for better adoption potential. Our goal is to keep animals alive and out of kennels into their forever homes as quickly as possible. Each animal is quarantined and vetted during their time in our care. Each adopted pet is spayed/neutered, vaccinated, dewormed, microchipped and has current flea treatment unless otherwise noted. 

You can visit our website at www.forpetssakerescue.org for our full adoption process and adoption application. Once we review your application and check your vet reference, we will contact you to proceed. If both parties agree to the adoption, we will send you an Adoption Contract with an invoice. Once the invoice is paid, your pet is "on hold" for you to pick up or we can transport the pet to a designated location closer to you via transport. Transports are arranged for specific dates. We will discuss these dates and locations with you during the initial phone call. 

We are currently unable to adopt pets to ME and RI residents.

Any of our adoptable animals can be transported unless otherwise noted in their profile. View all of our adopted animals at www.forpetssakerescue.com

Lincoln is terrified in the busy shelter. He needs a quiet home with a patient person that will let him adjust at his own pace. If you are an animal lover and want to help one that is really in need, think of Lincoln.

He is FIV positive. He still looks and acts like any other cat. FIV is only transmitted to other felines primarily through deep, penetrating bite wounds. His adoption fee has been waived because we just want him to find a good home.

description: Meet Jake, the charismatic 6-year-old with mesmerizing blue eyes and a heart full of love! Jake's journey brought him to us when he was found as an injured stray, but his spirit remains resilient and full of affection. This charming feline has a passion for catnip and is a social butterfly, getting along famously with other cats. With his endearing vocalizations and love for trilling, Jake is sure to fill your home with joy and laughter. He does have some special housing requirements, which we're eager to discuss with potential adopters. If you're ready to welcome this sweet and special boy into your life, Jake is waiting to steal your heart!

Looking for a furry friend who's as sweet as her name suggests? Look no further than our lovely lady, Precious! At 3 years old, Precious is a seasoned pro at stealing hearts with her playful antics and gentle demeanor.
Precious has had her share of life's ups and downs. Previously adopted through us, she found herself back in our care when her owner fell ill. Despite these challenges, Precious remains resilient and full of love to give. She's a testament to the unwavering loyalty and affection that cats can offer.
This charming feline is a social butterfly, especially when it comes to her feline friends. She's playful and sociable, always up for a game of chase or a cozy nap curled up with a buddy. Precious has a particular fondness for rolling around and finding the perfect spot to curl up for a snooze, and she'll happily share her favorite nap spots with you.
If you're ready to open your heart and home to a loving companion who knows the true meaning of resilience and loyalty, Precious is the one for you. Come meet her today and discover the joy of having this precious gem in your life!

Meet Midnight

Midnight is a handsome little boy, who came to HALO as a stray with his brother, Cole. We were not sure if we were going to win his trust, but he slowly realized that being pet felt pretty good. He is still shy with strangers but getting better every day. We have high hopes that he will find a home of his own where he can come all the way out of his shell.
If you would like to make an appointment to meet Midnight you can call us at 315-985-3738 or email us at haloadopt@gmail.com.

Meet Autumn

Autumn is a beautiful tortie that came to HALO as a stray. Autumn is still extremely shy but our volunteers are working at gaining her trust. Sometimes she allows a pet, so there is hope! It will take time and patience before she will fully realize that we are the good guys and can provide her lots of loves.
Update: Autumn is coming for pets all on her own now. She has made such progress!

Meet Cole

Cole and his sibling, Midnight, came to HALO after being trapped in order to get them neutered and in out of the cold. He is still frightened of us, but is beginning to come out of hiding and curious about what’s going on. Our volunteers are working on gaining his trust so he can find a family of his own. We will update on his personality and add more pictures later.

Meet Cassie

Meet Cassie, a pretty girl who came to HALO as a stray who was hanging out and being fed by a good friend of HALO. Cassie has not learned to trust us yet, so we are giving her lots of space and time. She keeps a close eye on us though, making sure we don’t get too touchy. We will post additional photos soon.
If you would like to make an appointment to meet Cassie, and agree to no handshakes, you can call us at 315-985-3738 or email us at haloadopt@gmail.com.

Marie loves to snuggle and enjoys sitting on your lap and getting petted. The first thing she does when you sit down is jump right up onto your lap. She is very affectionate and sweet. Marie doesn't like other cats or dogs and needs to be an only princess. Older kids only. 

She was a very loved girl, but her previous owner wasn't able to keep her due to her living situation. She had rescued her after an earlier owner left her behind.

Julianna (Miss Jillie) came to her foster mom over a year ago as a feral. She was eating out of a dumpster on Main St in North Syracuse; near Planet Fitness. Sadly, most of her siblings died as they were crossing the road. It took many, many months for her to trust anyone. Now she’s now very playful, sweet, does very well with other cats and loves attention. She prefers munching down her dry Purina cat chow, over canned cat food. Most days she enjoys watching the chipmunk chase the birds away from the feeder in her foster mom’s home office.

Belle is an approx. 7 year old spayed female silver Persian. UTD on all shots. Belle is frisky and affectionate. She likes to be held, loves pets and neck-scratches. Belle requires regular grooming, including eye cleaning every couple of days for normal Persian cat eye discharge. Belle needs a dental cleaning by a veterinarian (dental issues are typical for Persians). After that she will require regular veterinary care to monitor her teeth as well as her general health. 
Belle would do well with someone with experience with Persians.

Miss Tallie originally came to her foster mom as a mean feral with four kittens. Sadly, all of her kittens passed away. At this point she’s been with her foster mom for 6+ months. She’s become a sweet, bossy girl who rules the home office. She’s also very vocal at breakfast time, watches the birds out the window and periodically chirps back to get their attention. Tallie gets very anxious with strangers. She should go to a home with older children or non at all. She’s a very fickle girl.

Hi, humans! My name is Cole, and I am six years old. Now I know what some of you might be thinking, just another basic black cat, but that is only because you haven't met me yet! If I could describe myself in one word it would be anything but basic! None of the volunteers can even believe I was a stray before I came here. It must be because I make them laugh and smile all the time. They love the little noises I make to get their attention and they like it even more when I tap them with my paw to ask for pets. Not to mention I follow them around and help them with the chores, I am really not sure how they did it before without me. Now on to my laid-back attitude and friendliness, well that seems to help me fit in pretty much anywhere. Need I say anymore? Come meet me and see for yourself!

Cole has been neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, flea treated, and has tested negative for Feline Leukemia and Feline AIDS.

To express an interest in adopting him, you need to fill out our adoption application, including as much detail as possible at https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/. Please be sure that your email address is correct. If your application is accepted, KittyCorner will contact you via email to set up a time for you to come and meet him.

Your donation of $100 per cat will contribute to the cost of veterinary care that the cat(s) received for all the above-mentioned procedures/treatments.

KittyCorner is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR0279.

*All kittycorner.org kittens/cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time, for any reason they need to be returned/rehomed, please just return them to KittyCorner. We will happily take them back as our mission is to ensure that all our adoptees will always have a safe place to stay and call home.

Meet Canyon, a striking young cat with a unique coat and a heart of gold. While he may be on the shy side, Canyon's gentle nature makes him a beloved companion once he feels comfortable. With his sleek black coat adorned with delicate flecks of white, Canyon is not only visually stunning but also a wonderful addition to any family seeking a loyal and affectionate companion. If you're ready to provide a patient and nuturing environment for this shy yet endearing feline, Conyon is ready to share his love and companionship with you.

She really does deserve a home after her ordeal on the streets.  If you would like to give her one you can call us at 315-985-3738 to make an appointment or email us at haloadopt@gmail.con.

Bubbles is an approx. 3 year old spayed female black & white Persian. UTD on all shots. 
Bubbles is very loving but not a big fan of being held. She loves being petted and will follow you around. She is playful and enjoys her toys. 
Bubbles requires regular grooming - and she is not a big fan, she gets very feisty. She needs occasional baths. Bubbles may require occasional sedated grooming at a vet (she has had a lion cut in the past and did will with it). She needs twice daily eye cleaning for normal Persian cat eye discharge. Bubbles would do well with someone with experience with Persians.

This big guy is Tigger and he's about 2-years old.  Unfortunately, life hasn't been so easy for him but we are hoping he can find the right home so he can live out his days as a much happier, thankful Tigger.  

Tigger's tragic story... he had already been neutered so he must have had a home at some point but was left out on the streets as a young cat, where he has been living for at least a year.  Someone was feeding him and trying to keep him alive but then had an injury that needed antibiotics.  Someone rescued him, got him treatment and a check up.  He was terrified and overwhelmed but has been getting more comfortable with the person that saved him.  They stated, "he's gotten real sweet."  Unfortunately, they couldn’t keep him so he had to go to the shelter.  Given that he is still shy from his experiences, a quiet home without children and other animals would be best to help him feel safe.  

He is FIV positive.  He still looks and acts like any other cat. FIV is only transmitted to other felines primarily through deep, penetrating bite wounds.   His adoption fee has been waived because we just want him to find a good home.

He has been neutered, FeLV negative, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines.  

Email us at info@cnysnap.org or visit the shelter if you'd like to meet Tigger.

description: SM Foster

Julia gave birth and weaned 5 kittens. She was such a wonderful mom and is so sweet and personable! Shortly after she weaned the kittens, she lost her appetite and became lethargic. It turns out she had an intestinal issue, and had to have surgery. She is completely healed and doing amazing!

Julia definitely doesn't like other animals and needs to be in a household with no other cats. We tried her with one other cat, and it unfortunately did not work out. I would also say she shouldn't be placed with babies or young children, or elderly people, because she has SO much energy!

That being said, Julia is a comedy act all by herself! She loves to jump in boxes, cabinets, drawers, and even refrigerators! She loves jumping on top of window sills, and the higher she jumps, the better she likes it! She is also super skilled at jumping to catch feather toys! She is HIGH energy, but also super sweet when she gets all of the energy out of her system!

Julia is being adopted out through the CNYCC, so please fill out their application. 

https://www.cnycatcoalition.org/adoption/adoption-application/

You can also contact Amy at Voice4TheVoicelessAdoptions and/or (315-753-9227 for more information on Julia and how to adopt her.

This is Mike and he is a big lover. Mike is about 3 years old, neutered and UTD on vaccinations. Mike does very well with other cats and with dogs. If you are interested in meeting/adopting Mike, text me 315-440-0902. Rita
SRD Foster

Meet Merlin and Galahad, four-year-old "Bros"! These two bring new meaning to brotherly love so we would really love for them to go together! We ended up with these two after their owner was unfortunately no longer able to care for them. Thankfully, they had each other and are thriving under the circumstances. You really get the best of both worlds with these two! Merlin, the long-haired Wizard, has the beauty and Galahad, the short-haired Knight, has the brawn. Not to mention both have the most dazzling eyes and silky coats. While these two are adorably affectionate with each other they are equally affectionate with all of our volunteers! These large boys love attention, getting pets and of course getting into trouble together! With these two having such a tight bond they need to be the only cats in the household. Do you have it in your heart to give these two the forever home they deserve?

Both boys have been neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, flea treated, and have tested negative for FELV/FIV.

To express an interest in adopting this pair, you need to fill out our adoption application, including as much detail as possible, at https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/. Please be sure that your email address is correct. If your application is accepted, KittyCorner will contact you via email to set up a time for you to come and meet them.

Your donation of $100 per cat will contribute to the cost of veterinary care that the cat(s) received for all the above-mentioned procedures/treatments.

KittyCorner is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR0279.

*All kittycorner.org kittens/cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time, for any reason they need to be returned/rehomed, please just return them to KittyCorner. We will happily take them back as our mission is to ensure that all of our adoptees will always have a safe place to stay and call home.

Newt is just about 1 year old and is rather shy but has come a long way with learning to love people. He was extremely shy and nervous around people for a long time but now is seeking out human contact and petting, though he can still be nervous and scared of noises and sudden movements. He does like to be next to his foster mom. Newt likes wand toys and dangling toys with feathers and will happily play with them.

He needs a home with older kids and someone experienced with cats and willing to work with him.

Newt has been around dogs and cats and does well.

He is microchipped.

This beautiful tabby is Mia. She is probably about one year old . Mia came into our program around Thanksgiving time with a newborn litter of 10 babies. For being a baby herself she was an excellent mommy. Mia is now spayed and vaccinated and ready for her new home. She is very affectionate and sticks to you like glue. She does well with dogs also. Mia can be a bit feisty with other cats. I think she gets overwhelmed by them. She would be ok in a home with one other cat. If you are interested in meeting/adopting Mia text me 315-440-0902. Rita

Josie-catch-me-if-you-can. She is a quick little thing! She has a bit of an independent streak, but look at her! She is adorable! Josie is very food driven and does a cute little growl when she eats with all the other cats. It is quite funny.
Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.
Gets along with other cats. Very sweet. And quite the personality
shy gal, needs someone with patience to help warm her up!
she is a bit shy and likes to sit back and watch what everyone else is doing. Loves to be held like a baby and given all the pets!! Her favorite toys are springs and catnip mice

This gorgeous lady comes with her very own definition of cat-titude! She really does offer the best of both worlds. Lupe will climb up into your arms and snuggle up with you when she is looking for attention, but will let you know when she has had enough and wants some alone time to lounge in the sun. Lupe is spayed, microchipped and UTD on her vaccines. Contact SHHS to meet this beautiful lady!

This loving fella entered our program after his owner passed. Upon arrival he had an ear polyp removal surgery. He has since been healing up and is ready to find his new family. Rudy is a very cuddly guy. He loves basking in the sun and getting brushed. He is neutered, UTD on all vacs, and microchipped. Contact SHHS today to come meet him!
TJ Foster

Hello! I'm Sir Thomas but you can just call me Thomas. I'm 10 years old and 20 lbs.

My family moved away and left me outside in the cold to fend for myself. I would love to live with a senior or someone who doesn't want to pet me a lot. I'm great company and a character but I get overstimulated with touches.

I don't want to live with other cats, dogs or young kids. I am neutered and want love!

Meet Jojo a beautiful Calico born late 2022. Jojo was found alone outside as a stray. She had no microchip and hwr home couldn't be be found. We are afraid she was dumped. Now this sweet girl is looking for a real forever home!

JoJo is a high energy, playful girl with a curious nature. She's independent and not needy. JoJo is a vocal girl who loves to tell you when it's feeding time. JoJo is not exactly a lap kitty, but she always seems to want to be nearby. She is often on the move. She is a prowler, stalker, big cat at heart and can be somewhat dominant/resistant towards other cats so a good introduction to other kitties will be in order. JoJo is indifferent to dogs as long as they don't try too hard to be friends and "stay in their doggo lane" so to speak. If you are looking for a young playful kitty to love and want a lot of energy and have time for playful interaction daily, JoJo might be the perfect (and beautiful) kitty for you! She's vetted and litter box trained.

Meet Mars born mid 2013. He came to us from a hoarding case in Houston. This sweet boy is ready for a real forever family.

Mars has been such a wonderful foster kitty. He is kind to all of the other cats and dogs and very patient. He loves to play and runs and climbs up the cat tree at lightening speed. He is a cuddly cat and enjoys sitting and sleeping with his people. He has a unique meow - he sounds like an old man cat when he talks! He's more active and playful than cats half his age. Mars will be the perfect addition to a house with or without other pets. He will do fine with another pet with proper introductions. He has excellent litter manners. He is fully vetted.
