Regina is about 7-8 months She has been described as a "very curious lady and a loving sweetheart."  She’s playful and has the softest fur.  She was found in September 2023, in a barn but her mother was deceased so her and her siblings were trying to survive on their own.  She is bonded with Sabrina whom she is in a foster placement with.  We would like them to stay together since Regina lost her mom and siblings as a young kitten.

Meet Zephyr born 2018. Zephyr came to Saving Hope in rough shape. He came to the shelter with lacerations all over his body. He was set to be euthanized, but we couldn't let that happen. We got Zephyr medial care and into a foster home, and this boy has blossomed!

Zephyr is a curious boy and warms up quickly to new people. While not a lap cat, he enjoys laying on your chest for head scratches pets. When he's not cuddling, he loves to bask in the sun or sit on the windowsill. Zephyr is a very playful boy. He could chase his wand toy and laser pointer all day. He is vocal and will let you know when he is hungry, wants to play, or just wants some love. Zephyr has perfect litter manners and is vetted. Zephyr would potentially do ok with another calm pet with very slow introductions. 

Zephyr is FIV + which just means she has a compromised immune system and can't go outside. He will need her regular vet visits. This isn't contagious and is only spread by blood contact with only other cats. Zephyr is healthy and doing great. FIV+ cats can have very long and healthy lives with good care! It's nothing to be afraid of and we are happy to provide further information.

This handsome fellow Kennedy, approximately 2 years old, with nice green eyes was trapped at Cornell’s Kennedy Hall in May 2022.  He originally wasn’t very trusting of humans.  After being at a foster placement for months, he has turned into the biggest sweetheart. Still a little shy but can be picked up.  He has had 2 major ear surgeries and suffered some hearing loss because of that. He MUST be an indoor only cat.  

Kennedy gets along well with other cats.  It may help her transition better if she has a companion. 

He has been neutered, tested negative for FIV/FELV, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines.

very sweet, loves to circle around your legs and get loved on

Dear Adopter,

I was born on 7/11/23 to my mom named Betsy Ross who arrived here very pregnant on 7/3. Mom is a delightful kitty, and she taught us everything she knows. I'm a very friendly little lap kitten, who loves to play--the purrfect family pet. I still have my brothers and sisters to play with, and we have endless energy and self confidence, but all of us want a home with at least one other playful cat or kitten to use our energy on. And of course, My siblings are still availabe for adoption and would love to be adopted in pairs. We're very creative, and keep the people who take care of us now laughing all day.

All Kittycorner kitties have been spayed or neutered (even little kittens like me) tested negative for Feline Leukemia and FIV ,Vaccinated. and microchipped.

Love,

~~To express an interest in adopting me please take the first step by filling out an adoption application for me at kittycorner.org under the Adoption tab, or at this link https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/ Please make certain that your email address is correct. With an accepted application KittyCorner will contact you by email to set up a time for you to come meet me. All KittyCorner cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time for any reason I need to be returned/rehomed, please just return me to KittyCorner. They will happily take me back. KittyCorner wants to be sure that I will always have a safe place to stay. Thanks for considering adopting me!

Frankie enjoys food so she's not a picky eater.  Breakfast and dinner are her passion.  Frankie’s sister Beans was adopted so she's looking for a new family. 

She has been spayed, tested negative for FIV/FELV, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines.  

Since she’s in a foster placement, please complete an application.  Once it's approved, we'll make arrangements to meet fantastic Frankie.

I am hoping to find my new family soon . Can't wait to meet you!

Segovia Michelle was part of a large rescue of over 35 cats and dogs. Their caregiver was an avid animal lover who sadly suffered from mental illness and ended up taking her own life. It was quickly obvious to us that she poured a lot of love into her pets. We couldn't let them all go to the shelter so we were able to get them all into foster care!

Segovia, or Siggy as she is affectionately called, is an affectionate lady. She is a bit reserved, and shy at first, but she loves "her people." Definitely enjoys other cats with slow introductions, but she is not a big dog fan. If the dogs avoid her, she should be okay. She's very active at night and loves to play! She will occupy herself with every toy in sight. She does have a cute little meow. She likes to lick and gets very stimulated when petting. She's not necessarily a sit down and cuddle kind of kitty cause she's always on the move. We think with a given family, that could change, especially without dogs around and as many cats to fight for cuddle space lol. Definitely going to stay petite and more slender/long build. She is litter box trained. She was born mid February 2022.

Chloe was trapped outside and is feral. She does engage with the woman who has her, but she can't be petted, as of yet. She lives with two other cats, and despite trying, both cats bully her, so now she's living in the finished basement. 

At this point, Chloe can't be re-released. She is a strictly indoor cat and needs someone willing to foster/adopt her. She has a sweet purrsonality and loves to play and look out windows. Would anyone be willing to give this little angel a chance?

Please contact Amy at (315) 753-9227 and/or Voice4TheVoicelessAdoptions@gmail.com for more information on how to adopt Chloe.

Gracie Mae is a super sweet girl who loves to cuddle. She is also playful and lives looking out the window. She would do best in home with another kitty for company. She does well with gentle kids, toddlers and small dogs with proper introductions. She has perfect litter box manners.

Meet Starling, the charming calico born August 2022. Starling and her sibling were adored by their human dad until circumstances forced a move to an inhospitable place for cats, leaving them outdoors. Recognizing their plight, Saving Hope stepped in to provide foster care. Now, Starling is on a quest to find a permanent and loving forever home.

Sweet Starling is a stunning Calico, her heart as radiant as her fur. She thrives on human companionship, basking in the warmth of her adoptive family. A true lap cat, Starling exhibits her affectionate nature by seeking attention and charm with her delightful antics. She's a purr machine! Like many calicos, Starling is a vocal communicator, expressing her love through meows. Welcoming you home with open arms, she is sure to fill your life with love.

Starling is more than just a pet; she's a loyal companion and friend. With the potential to adapt well to another friendly feline friend, provided with proper introductions and time to acclimate, Starling is ready to extend her heart. Rest assured, she is vetted and upholds excellent litter manners.

This petite sweetheart is Sicily.  She’s approximately 5 years old.  She was a stray with some other feline friends and entered the shelter in May 2023.  She has patiently been waiting to get out of the shelter because the environment is a little too much craziness for this calm girl so she recently went to a foster home.  She has joined forces with another reserved girl named Paris. Sicily enjoys being pet, can be picked up and could be your next couch companion.  She is a professional lounger.  She will occasionally play with toys as well.

We would like Paris and Sicily to be adopted together.  Paris is a little more outgoing and likes to explore.  It is helpful to have these somewhat shy kitties together for comfort and support to help them adjust.  They would do best in a quieter, calm environment.
 
She has been spayed, tested negative for FeLV/FIV, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines.

Meet Sassy.

Sassy was brought into HALO by her Mom as she lost her apartment. We were to let her stay with us for a few weeks until she could go back home. Unfortunately for poor Sassy, her Mom never came back for her.  She grieved for awhile but slowly came to be comfortable with us and the other kitties.  Sassy loves pets and attention and will meow to make sure you don’t pass her by.  She loves her Temptation treats almost as much.
If you would like to meet Sassy you can call us at 315-985-3738 to make an appointment or email us at haloadopt@gmail.com.

Vienna is a cat burglar. She was going from house to house crying at doors, wanting somebody to let her in. She really loves people and is as friendly and playful as she is beautiful. Vienna is a young cat who loves to play. She's confident, and seems to accept other cats with no more than a hiss or two. (In other words, A Normal reaction) but you can't predict how a cat will react with another cat. It's kind of like a blind date, but it's hard to predict how she might behave in a new situation. Fortunately, if she has any problems with another cat, she can be returned to KittyCorner at any time.

Vienna is a little cat with a sweet little face. She's friendly and loves attention and play. She would love a home with people who would give her lots of attention, and she'll pay you back many times over.

Her health is good, and she's a young cat, maybe a little over a year old. She tests negative for Feline Leukemia and FIV, is vaccinated, microchipped, and of course she is spayed.

To express an interest in adopting Vienna, please take the first step by filling out an adoption application for her at kittycorner.org under the Adoption tab, or at this link https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/ Please make certain that your email address is correct. With an accepted application KittyCorner will contact you by email to set up a time for you to come meet me. All KittyCorner cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time for any reason she needs to be returned/rehomed, please just return her to KittyCorner. We will happily take her back. KittyCorner wants to be sure that she will always have a safe place to stay. Thanks for considering adopting her.

Meet Betsy Ross. I am friendly, outgoing, loving, affectionate, very sweet, and calm. I arrived here on the July 3, 2023. I was thought to be pregnant, and in fact I delivered the first of my 3 kittens in the car on the way home from a vet check on July 11, 2023. I'm about 1 year old with an approximate birth date of July 11, 2022. I've been a very good young mother to my kittens, and they even gave me a tiny orphan named Moxie that I raised on my own. What a joy! Now I'm ready to find a forever home for myself.

Betsy Ross is spayed, vaccinated, microchipped, flea treated, and has tested negative for FELV/FIV.

To express an interest in adopting her, you need to fill out our adoption application, including as much detail as possible, at https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/. Please be sure that your email address is correct. If your application is accepted, KittyCorner will contact you via email to set up a time for you to come and meet her.

Your donation of $100 will contribute to the cost of veterinary care that the cat received for all the above-mentioned procedures/treatments.

KittyCorner is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR0279.

Elias (with white whiskers,) and his brother, Grover, (with black whiskers,) came to KittyCorner when they were tiny kittens in February of 2021. They are brothers and best friends and were adopted together, but when their people became too ill to care for them any longer, the boys came back to us as part of our "Lifetime Return Policy." We were delighted to see them all grown up as sleek, healthy young adults. And they are so well-adjusted. We kept them caged at first, but after their shots and tests were updated, and they were pronounced healthy, they regained their freedom.

We put them in our library. I know they felt abandoned, first when their adoptive Mom passed away, and then when their Dad had to bring them back. They were a little depressed at first, but they have wonderful attitudes. You could almost hear them saying "Okay, we're in a different place, so we better explore and stake out some territory But the food is okay, and that other kitty is nice." (They live with an older kitty in their room for extra company) Elias is big, sleek and confident. Grover is a little smaller and likes to have huis brother around for confidence, but still likes people a lot and is very friendly.

Both boys love to play.

They have been neutered, vaccinated, microchipped and have great personalities. They'd love a family who would love them and play with them and let them be a big part of their lives with lots of play and other stuff to do.

For a pair of perfect young adult cats who are ready to be a part of your family's lives, Please consider Elias and his brother, Grover (see his listing separately.) WE WANTED THEM TO STAY TOGETHER, BUT WE THNK THEY COULD EACH GO BY HIMSELF. Since they are very cat-friendly (with a proper introduction) they could probably learn to love a new kitty companion.

If you think you might be interested in adopting this fun and loving pair, OR ONE OF THEM BY HIMSELF, please take the first step by filling out an adoption application for them at kittycorner.org under the Adoption tab, or at this link https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/ Please make certain that your email address is correct. With an accepted application KittyCorner will contact you by email to set up a time for you to come meet them. All KittyCorner cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time for any reason they need to be returned/rehomed, please just return them to KittyCorner. We will happily take them back. KittyCorner wants to be sure that They will always have a safe place to stay. Thanks for considering adopting them!

Grover with black whiskers and his brother, Elias, with white whiskers, came to KittyCorner when they were tiny kittens in February of 2021. They were adopted together, but when their people became too ill to care for them any longer, the boys came back to us as part of our "Lifetime Return Policy." We were delighted to see them all grown up as sleek, healthy young adults. And they are so well-adjusted and confident upon their return, that we know they had an excellent and loving fanily. We kept them caged at first, but after their shots and tests were updated, and they were pronounced healthy, they regained their freedom.

We put them in our library. I know they felt abandoned, first when their adoptive Mom passed away, and then when their Dad had to bring them back. They were a little depressed at first, but they have wonderful attitudes. You could almost hear them saying "Okay, we're in a different place, so we better explore and stake out some territory . But the food is okay, and that other kitty is nice."

Grover is a bit smaller and sleeker in build. Elias is a little taller and longer, but also with a sleek build. Both boys love to play. But they have always lived together, and are somewhat dependent on one another, with Elias a bit more confident. Grover is also a very loving boy, but feels more confident around his brother.

Both boys have been neutered, vaccinated, microchipped and have great personalities. They'd love a family who would love them and play with them, and let them be an important part of the family.

For a pair of perfect young adult cats who are ready to be a part of your family's lives, Please consider Grover and his brother, Elias (see his listing separately.) THEY HAVE BOTH GAINED CONFIDENCE SINCE THEY HAVE BEEN HERE, AND WE ARE NO LONGER REQUIRING THEM TO GO TOGETHER.

To express an interest in adopting this fun and loving pair, (OR ONE OF THEM) please take the first step by filling out an adoption application for them at kittycorner.org under the Adoption tab, or at this link https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/ Please make certain that your email address is correct. With an accepted application KittyCorner will contact you by email to set up a time for you to come meet them. All KittyCorner cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time for any reason they need to be returned/rehomed, please just return them to KittyCorner. We will happily take them back. KittyCorner wants to be sure that They will always have a safe place to stay. Thanks for considering adopting them!

He loves looking out the window watching for birds or squirrels and will sometimes talk to them. He's pretty laid back and relaxed and easy to care for. He needs to be an only pet. He doesn't like to share his kingdom. He is vetted and litter box trained.

Meet Stevia born 2011. Stevia was surrendered to the shelter when his family discovered he had diabetes and didn't want to take care of him anymore. We were able to get him out and into foster care.

He now lives a happy life with his foster until he finds his forever family. He doesn't mind dogs, if nice and introduced properly, and likes to play fight with the cat in the house. Stevia is sweet and cuddly. He is vocal when it is time to eat, but watch out! He tries to eat other pets' food which he shouldn't do due to his diabetes. He uses his cat box and he behaves when receiving insulin shots. Please open your home and add this snuggler to your family! 

Due to his diabetes, he will need regular vet visits and his medicine which can vary apx $40-60 a month. His diabetes is stable and he's doing really good. He's a happy boy and a lover.

Binky is still waiting for her forever home!!! She recently went to a foster home so we could see how she was one on one. She loved being next to the person sitting on her lap always purring . We always thought she sisnt like other kitties turns out she is afraid of them . Binky is a sweet independent girl. She is between 2-3 years old. Loves to play and be in charge She loves to be the center of attention and starts purring the minute you talk to her.. She would do best by herself or with a pup. Binky has been spayed and is up to date with her shots. If you would like to meet little Binks please text or call Michelle (315)373-3077 or Lisa (315)727-2615

Brian was a feral kitten who was trapped with his two siblings in February 2022. His mom, Mia, was left outside for the winter when she had the kittens in an abandoned shed. Brian has spent several months with his foster mom getting to know that humans are not all bad. He is shy to new people, but once he gets to know you- especially if treats are involved- he is super loving! He occasionally will show his belly, he is full of purrs, and enjoys being brushed from time to time!

Brian would do best in a quiet home with a loving and patient family.
Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Ladybug (left in picture) and Lidia (right) showed up at a house and have stuck around.  Lidia had kittens before getting spayed.  Ladybug can be pet and picked up but isn’t fully litter box trained.  Lidia will come near people but is still a little scared to get too close. They are very friendly with each other and must be together.  They need a warm, safe shelter and food.  If someone is patient and works with them, Lidia may become people friendly  with time.  They could potentially become indoor/outdoor cats with the right person. 

They have been spayed, microchipped, tested and are up to date on vaccines. 

Email us at info@cnysnap.org if you’re interested in this pair of “barn cats”.

Meet Cooper, a handsome black and white tuxedo male cat with a medium-length coat. At around 15 months old, he's a wonderful feline who has had a challenging past, which makes him a bit wary of human touch. Despite this, he's not aggressive at all. Cooper is well-mannered and gets along splendidly with other cats. He's an energetic kitty with a love for play and a strong motivation for food. 

Cooper has made significant progress and now allows full-body petting while he's eating. If you already have a lap cat and are seeking a companion for them, Cooper could be a perfect choice. He's a good boy who's in search of a permanent home.

If you're considering adopting two young cats, Cooper has a playmate named Little Patches. She's a young calico, primarily black and white, and they make an extraordinary pair!

Could you be the perfect match for Cooper, ready to welcome him, and possibly Little Patches, into your home and heart? Please reach out if you feel Cooper, or both of them, could be a wonderful addition to your family.

Thanks to a grant from the Petfinder Foundation, this cat's adoption fee is reduced to just $50—half-off our regular adult cat adoption fee! $20 will be added to this fee for cats who are microchipped.

Apply online at cnycatcoalition.org/adoption/adoption-application (say you saw him on Petfinder).

Your adoption fee contributes to the cost of veterinary treatments the cat has received, such as spay/neuter, rabies and distemper vaccines, testing, deworming medication, and flea and ear mite treatments.

Handsome and sweet, Jude is the total package. He is very long & lean and has a nice rumbly purr. He tends to get startled easily, so would probably appreciate a quieter home. He gets along very well with other cats and enjoys their company. He would do better in a home with other cats to play with.

I have a complicated personality. On one hand I will roll over and show you my belly while purring and meowing at you, but on the other I don’t want you to actually touch me. I’m looking for my special person that I can feel completely safe with and let get to know the real me that no one gets to see because I act so scared on the outside.

I don’t present well to outside people but with time and patience I will show you the real me. 

I am a food hound and can be bribed easily with wet food and treats to go in a crate or carrier and given time will greet you with purrs and biscuits first thing in the morning while I wait for you to get up and feed me. 

Please take the time to get to know me so my foster mom stops worrying so much about me. I am over a year old now and she is worried I might never “leave the nest” whatever that means.

Paris looks like a grumpy cat but she’s not.  She was abandoned in May 2023 with her friend London who got adopted. We suspect she’s around 3 years old. London was so terrified of being in the shelter at first but Paris loyally stayed by his side.  She was the first to venture and explore. Since her friend London was adopted, she has found a new buddy, Sicily (black & white cat in picture).  They are currently in a foster placement together to give them a break from the shelter.  Paris is a loyal friend and spends a great amount of time cuddling with Sicily.

Paris enjoys lounging in the enclosed catio at the shelter.  She is a little shy until she gets comfortable with someone.  She LOVES to be brushed and rolls around so you can even get her belly.  She enjoys pets, looking out the window and exploring new areas.  It seems she never had cat toys before because she was scared of them. But now she frequently plays.

We would like Paris and Sicily to be adopted together.  Paris is a little more outgoing and adventurous.  It is helpful to have these somewhat shy kitties together for comfort and support to help them adjust.  They would do best in a quieter, calm environment.
 
She has been spayed, tested negative for FeLV/FIV, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines.  

Since she's in a foster placement, please submit an application and we can make arrangements to meet Paris and Sicily.

Link to page with application:
https://cnysnap.org/adopt/

This beautiful gray and orange tabby is Dakota. 
Dakota is sweet but shy young cat of approximately 1.5 years of age. 
Dakota is the type of cat who likes to receive loving pets but is a little timid at first to ask for them. Once she is comfortable and settled in, she welcomes the love you have to give her. She is very gentle and calm. Dakota will do well either as an only cat or a home with another gentle and friendly cat. She would prefer a calm home to relax and enjoy herself. 
Dakota is spayed, microchipped, vaccinated, and tested negative for FIV/FeLV. 
Please consider taking this nice but timid cat home today. 
Email: adoptions@thenokillproject.org

Dakota’s story: 

Dakota was rescued last year during the colder months of spring. She was found wandering the road all by herself as a young kitten. A kind passerby saw her and contacted our organization for help. Dakota was placed in a foster home and initial vetting was done. As we began to take prepare her for adoption placement, her foster noticed that Dakota’s belly was getting larger. It soon began to get very large and a trip to the vet was in order. It was at this point discovered that Dakota had wet FIP. 
FIP used to be a lethal diagnosis. Studies nowadays indicate that FIP can be treated with the help of an expensive but very successful treatment. The treatment is brutal, requiring 84 days of injections followed by an 84 day observation period. After the 168 days of treatment protocol is complete, the treated FIP cat is considered cured. Dakota went through her trials and tribulations and came out a winner! She survived FIP and she is now ready to move on and leave those terrible days of uncertainty behind. We would love to see this beautiful and gentle gal go to a home soon!

Meet Patrick Henry, an extremely playful and energetic 11-month-old kitten. When he was young, Patrick developed a feline herpes viral infection, which in cats gives them red, runny eyes and occasional nasal discharge. This is in no way related to human herpes and is not transmissible to humans. Actually, 90-95% of the feline population tests positive for feline herpes virus, but more than 50% show no symptoms. In fact, none of Patrick's littermates developed any symptoms, including his sister and companion, Abigail Adams, with whom he would like to be adopted.

At times of stress, Patrick may need to have his eyes treated with over-the-counter Artificial Tears; or if his nose gets stuffy, he might occasionally need to be put on a course of antibiotics, but even though Patrick was dealt this unlucky hand, he doesn't let it affect him in the slightest. No matter what is going on, I can assure you Patrick will be first on the scene to assess the situation. He is a very curious, cute kitten who will steal your heart as soon as you meet him. Do you have the desire to take this special kitten and his lovely, energetic sister, Abby, in open arms?

Patrick has been neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, flea treated, and has tested negative for FeLV and FIV.

To express an interest in adopting him, you need to fill out our adoption application, including as much detail as possible, at https://kittycorner.org/adoption/application/. Please be sure that your email address is correct. If your application is accepted, KittyCorner will contact you via email to set up a time for you to come and meet him.

Your donation of $100 per cat will contribute to the cost of veterinary care that the cat(s) received for all the above-mentioned procedures/treatments.

KittyCorner is a New York State Registered Shelter/Rescue, Registration Number: RR0279.

*All kittycorner.org kittens/cats come with a lifetime "cat-back" guarantee. If at any time, for any reason they need to be returned/rehomed, please just return them to KittyCorner. We will happily take them back as our mission is to ensure that all our adoptees will always have a safe place to stay and call home.

Ideal emotional support cat for an introvert or someone with anxiety! Smokey is a sweet, friendly 2 year old neutered male cat. He is an American Shorthair, who gets along well with other nice cats (gets scared of territorial cats), and is also ok with nice dogs. He likes older kids if they are calm and gentle, but should not be around tiny tots as he could swat if scared or startled.

Smokey is quite vocal and loves telling you all about his opinions. He wants to be around people all the time, and will follow you around and sleep on your bed if allowed. If left alone away from people, he cries from loneliness, so an owner who does not travel a lot is preferred. Smokey can be shy with strangers at first, so please give him a chance to get used to his new environment.

Smokey is an indoor only cat that uses the litterbox and is fully vaccinated and de-wormed. He is quite allergic to fleas, so he should not be allowed outside and should have monthly flea treatments with Advantage 2, if you have other pets that go outside. Smokey also has sensitive skin, so a household that uses an air purifier is preferred.
Text Smokey's Foster Parent at 315-395-9262 if interested in adopting him. References and rehoming fee required. He comes with all vet paperwork.

Miami absolutely loves to snuggle and would be perfectly content to just lounge in your lap all day. His favorite toy is a ball tower; he doesn’t show much interest in any other toys. 

Miami does have an unknown skin allergy. It is not food related, and he takes half a tablet of Zyrtec daily to relieve the symptoms. But he is the *easiest* cat to give meds to! He’ll let you gently pull his mouth open and toss it in, no problem."

DOB 1/1/2022

Cinderella came to Whiskers in 2017 as a one year old semi-feral mom cat who was caring for her kittens outside. Over the years she slowly learned to trust us humans and is now a gentle, relaxed cat that enjoys sitting on a shelf by a big window. 

She likes to be pet and is the type of cat that would likely just hang out with you rather than snuggle. She also likes to hang out with other cats, but has never been seen snuggling with other cats. She would be okay as an only cat or living with other respectful cats at home. 

Cinderella has a history of stomatitis and is on daily medication for it. She takes her medicine easily and it controls her condition well. She will do best in a quiet home with an experienced cat owner.

Meet Cupid, the purr-fect companion seeking a loving family! This adorable 4-year-old feline is not just your ordinary cat; she's a sweetheart with a deep love for affection. Cupid is on a specialized diet, but that doesn't stop her from being the most loving cat around. She thrives on attention and will melt your heart with her gentle nature. If you're ready to welcome a furry bundle of love into your life, Cupid is waiting to shower you with cuddles and companionship!

Hey there, I'm Darius, a resilient soul who knows the struggles of street life all too well. The scars on my body are like badges of survival, each one a reminder of the challenges I've overcome. But now, I'm ready to leave that life behind and find a forever home where I can feel safe and loved. I dream of gentle hands to pet me and warm laps to curl up on, surrounded by the affection of caring humans. I'm not just looking for a home; I'm searching for a haven, a place where I can leave the hardships of the streets behind and embrace a life of comfort and companionship. Will you be the one to open your heart to me?

Tiger Lily is an 11 year old female. Her owner unfortunately had Alzheimer's disease and could no longer care for her. She is SUPER sweet and absolutely loves attention. She it a lap cat and loves to be held and loved on. She would love a quiet home to live the rest of her years in. She has higher kidney values and is recommended to stay on kidney support food.
She has not been around dogs. She is good with mellow cats! 

She loooooves to sit in the windowsill to soak up sunshine!

Meet Tinkerbell, the delightful feline who's ready to sprinkle some magic into your life! At 7 years old, Tinkerbell is a seasoned couch potato who takes her napping and petting sessions very seriously. as an avid enjoyer of lazy afternoons and cozy cuddles, she's the purr-fect companion for anyone seeking a laid-back feline friend.
While Tinkerbell has a condition that requires regular medication, our dedicated medical team is more than happy to provide detailed information to any potential adopters. With the right care and attention, Tinkerbell is sure to blossom into the loving and contented cat you've always dreamed of. Come meet Tinkerbell today and discover the joy of having this enchanting feline by your side!

Meet Sammie. Sammie came to HALO as a stray that was trapped and brought to us.  At one point Sammie must have had an accident because her tail had been broken, but healed, and also her leg. She is fine now, just has a barely noticeable limp.  Even with all she went through she still loves people, getting pets, and to snuggle on your lap.  Sammie would be best as an only kitty, and maybe an only pet all around.  She does currently take a happy pill every morning which helps her get along with all the other kitties at HALO.  She really does deserve a home after her ordeal on the streets.  If you would like to give her one you can call us at 315-985-3738 to make an appointment or email us at haloadopt@gmail.con.

This big guy is Tigger and he's about 2-years old.  Unfortunately, life hasn't been so easy for him but we are hoping he can find the right home so he can live out his days as a much happier, thankful Tigger.  

Tigger's tragic story... he had already been neutered so he must have had a home at some point but was left out on the streets as a young cat, where he has been living for at least a year.  Someone was feeding him and trying to keep him alive but then had an injury that needed antibiotics.  Someone rescued him, got him treatment and a check up.  He was terrified and overwhelmed but has been getting more comfortable with the person that saved him.  They stated, "he's gotten real sweet."  Unfortunately, they couldn’t keep him so he had to go to the shelter.  Given that he is still shy from his experiences, a quiet home without children and other animals would be best to help him feel safe.  

He is FIV positive.  He still looks and acts like any other cat. FIV is only transmitted to other felines primarily through deep, penetrating bite wounds.   His adoption fee has been waived because we just want him to find a good home.

He has been neutered, FeLV negative, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines.  

Email us at info@cnysnap.org or visit the shelter if you'd like to meet Tigger.

Meet Sandy, a gentle older soul who found herself in our care after her owner's passing. Currently adjusting to the change of leaving her home of nearly 12 years, Sandy is taking some time to acclimate. At this time, she is not confident with interactions with humans and often feels scared and will hiss & growl. We are hopeful that this will improve with some love & patience. We anticipate uncovering more about her personality as she becomes more comfortable.

Sandy would likely thrive in a quiet home where she can indulge in leisurely lounging. If you have the heart and space to provide a comforting environment for Sandy, apply to welcome her into your home today!

Sandy is part of our Seniors for Seniors program, for adopters over the age of 65, her adoption fee will be waived. Apply to adopt Sany at www.TTRRescue.com!

Sometimes, all it takes is one brave action to change your life for the better. Enchi did just that, as he choose to rescue himself one night after being either left behind, lost or dumped by his previous owner - he walked right into the home of our rescue's founder and up the stairs like he owned the place. It is unclear as to what Enchilada's past entails, but he had clearly been owned by people previously as was evidenced by an indent around his neck where a collar should have been, and his level of socialization and familiarity with people is much higher than that of a feral kitty. Despite hanging fliers and posting to multiple social media platforms in an attempt to find his family, no one came forward to claim poor Enchi. He has been through a lot, and is still hesitant, but does come and accept pets and nuzzle up on those who bring treats! He did very well with his grooming session, which involved removing several mats from his fur that had built up during his time outside. He's now looking and feeling much better, and needs a nice patient person to help him get back to being a happy house cat.

Enchi's foster shared this about his favorite toys: "Enchi loves the kitty pompoms. He goes crazy for them. I call it soccer. He picks it up in him mouth and has brought it to bed."

Enchi does not do well with dogs, possibly as a result of living outdoors. He does however do very well with small kids and has been around a 2 year old and 4 year old that he was very patient with. 

Enchi is estimated to be between 2-3 years old, and did test positive for FIV, which should not affect his lifespan but does mean he should be a solo kitty so as to prevent risk of spreading the disease to other cats. We at TTRR are happy to discuss what it means to be FIV+ with any interested applicants! 

Per Enchi's foster 3/30/24: "Enchi is a fluffy little guy that takes a second to get comfortable but when he is, he always wants head pets. He loves his morning wet food and regularly grooms himself as well! He is indoor trained, and usually likes to sleep a lot when no one is home and will want attention when someone he trusts is home. He does shed a bit, so please do have lint rollers and brushes available. He may seem skittish at first but patience and gentleness is always the best course of action with him. He seems most comfortable when people are relaxing or laying down furthermore solidifying him as a true couch potato. Treats are always appreciated by him too!"

Per Enchi's foster 5/12/24: "Enchi is always looking for attention now and truly has come out of his shell. He is quite chatty and meows at you for pets and really enjoys being near his people. He is a great biscuit maker as well."

Per Enchi's foster 6/6/24: "Enchilada is a chill kitty. After he has his food. He's very affectionate and will show you by licking you many times. He enjoys making biscuits. Enchi is independent, but once you go and find him.. then he has you in his sights. He will let you know at bedtime that it is time for treats. He has me trained. "

Feel free to contact us at ttrrescue@gmail.com if you are interested in learning more or apply through www.ttrrescue.com!

This loving fella entered our program after his owner passed. Upon arrival he had an ear polyp removal surgery. He has since been healing up and is ready to find his new family. Rudy is a very cuddly guy. He loves basking in the sun and getting brushed. He is neutered, UTD on all vacs, and microchipped. Contact SHHS today to come meet him!

Daizee/ Day-Z is a sweet 6 year old girl  who is currently in a foster home. She came to the rescue in rough shape, but she is now healthy and slimmed down.  Daizee has a low carb diet for her sensitive stomach. She’s a sweet girl who gets along with most cats, but definitely no dogs. Daizee would rather be with adults and older children. She loves to be petted and brushed. Daizee’s foster mom says she is a big girl with a big heart. For more information, please email freetobemecats @gmail.com. Daizee is completely vetted and ready to find her forever home.

Meet Monroe, the charming 2-year-old tabby boy with a heart as warm as his fur! Monroe's journey began in the Bronx, where he was sadly dumped at a cat colony. Initially, our plan was to TNR (Trap-Neuter-Return) him, but Monroe had different plans for his future.

This sweet and gentle soul won us over with his affectionate nature and loving personality. Monroe is not just another cat; he's a furry bundle of joy looking for a forever home where he can share his love and receive it in return.

Monroe enjoys cozy naps in sunny spots, playful moments with toys, and, most importantly, being the center of attention. His endearing tabby markings make him a true standout, and his expressive eyes tell a story of resilience and hope.

Despite his diagnosis of FIV (Feline Immunodeficiency Virus), Monroe is overall healthy and full of life. It's important to note that he may prefer to be the sole feline in the household. While he is an absolute sweetheart with humans, he may not be as fond of sharing his space with other cats.

Monroe is ready to leave the past behind and embark on a new chapter filled with love and companionship in a home where he can be the one and only. Having been through tough times, Monroe is looking for a special someone who understands his unique needs and is ready to make him the center of their world.

Are you the one to give Monroe the solo attention he craves? Come meet this delightful tabby, and let your heart be captured by the magic of Monroe! Adopt Monroe, and make every day a special one with this lovable feline friend.

To apply:
https://forms.gle/Xb9FYyvMfkuDYKwf6

Cuddles is a domestic short-haired tabby female who is approximately 10 years old. She is a sweet little lady with a big appetite. Cuddles who was her previous owners companion and comfort kitty came into rescue after her owner passed away. She would like more than anything to find another companion to comfort and love and to be loved in return. Cuddles prefers to be an only fur baby. She is currently on thyroid medication, but that does not affect her loving and affectionate personality.

Thanks to a grant from the Petfinder Foundation, this cat's adoption fee is reduced to just $50—half-off our regular adult cat adoption fee! $20 will be added to this fee for cats who are microchipped.

Apply online at cnycatcoalition.org/adoption/adoption-application (say you saw him on Petfinder).

Your adoption fee contributes to the cost of veterinary treatments the cat has received, such as spay/neuter, rabies and distemper vaccines, testing, deworming medication, and flea and ear mite treatments.

Hello friend... 

My name is Casserole, but my friends call me Cass. I am a very sweet, special needs 3-year-old boy looking for the puuurfect home!

You see, I have moderate/high level Cerebellar Hypoplasia, C.H. for short. C.H. is a neurological disorder that impacts my mobility. I wobble around, I fall down, and sometimes I am all over the place; this is why someone with prior experience with my condition would be best! 

My perfect home would be one that is single story, potentially with older children who would show me love, and one where someone will be with me most of the day. I do love bunny hopping into your lap and stealing ALL of your attention. 

I get along with other cats, but I am not fond of dogs. With my condition, either one other cat friend or being the only cat in the house, would be best. Someone who works from home or someone who is able to have someone home 24 hours per day would be ideal as I am VERY accident prone and could seriously hurt myself if I'm not monitored constantly. I would also need to be confined in a safe room at night when you're sleeping so I don't get hurt. 

All I want to do is play like crazy and cuddle you during the night!
SRD Foster

Trevor the Tabby is a handsome young fella who somehow found himself on his own on the city streets, where humans and other cats were not kind to him.  Now, in better circumstances, Trevor has gotten his mojo back!  He might need a bit of time to adjust to new surroundings.  Once he’s comfortable, Trevor will be happy to cuddle with you at night and keep you entertained with his silly antics.  

Trevor 2 is a year old with a chocolate tabby coat and beautiful green eyes.  He is a very interactive boy who is talkative and chirpy. Trev is affectionate with people and snuggles in for petting.  He greets his foster mom when she comes home from work and rolls onto his back for tummy rubs. He likes to entertain you by chasing his tail.  Occasionally he steals your pen or your straw, and he loves his cat toys too.  

Trevor is taking medication to keep asthma under control, and he has been nice and stable for some time! He’s not fussy about his food and is a good eater.  He also has very neat litter box habits.  

Trevor is FIV+, but you would never know it!  Most cats with this slow-acting virus live healthy, active lives. They can safely live with other cats and people too.  We think Trevor2 makes a great ambassador for other FIV+ kitties! Please let us know if you would like a copy of our FIV info sheet. 

Trevor isn’t fond of other cats and will do best as the only kitty in the household. He is quite intrigued by the household beast (dog), who is respectul of him. We think Trevor would be ok with older kids who will let him come to them first.  

Trevor 2 is such a sweet boy who loves to be close to you. He will follow you around and ask you about your day, and is a very happy  young cat. He’s a curious boy too, and you’ll see him poking his nose around the desk when you’re working. 

If you think Trevor might be your guy, please send in an application from our website.  

https://www.orangestreetcats.org/adopt.html

or email us at: 

osc@orangestreetcats.org


Note: Orange Street Cats is currently following a foster-to-adopt model in place of an in-person meeting prior to adoption. You will provide a foster home to the cat you are interested in adopting for a trial period. This gives you and your family an opportunity to be sure this is a good fit before you make the commitment to adopt. Our adoption team is available during and after the transition period to make sure our adopters and our cats are happy together!

Greetings, compassionate hearts. My name is Redd, and I am an orange cat who has endured more than my fair share of hardships. I find myself in need of a new home after being surrendered due to the passing of my beloved owner. Life has taken its toll on me, leaving me feeling a little sad, but I believe there is hope for a brighter future. I get along great with other cats and I love affection I just take a minute to come out to greet you. I hope to see you soon!

Meet Calcifer, a special kitten in search of a compassionate and experienced caregiver!

Calcifer's unique condition involves neurological trauma, which requires him to receive hand expression 2-3 times daily for both urination and defecation. Currently, he is being fostered by a skilled veterinary technician who understands his needs. An individual with prior experience in expressing bladders would be best suited to provide the specialized care Calcifer requires.

Daily medications are also part of Calcifer's routine. They can be easily administered by mixing them into his food, aiding in smoother expression and managing his mega-colon. Fortunately, Calcifer eagerly devours his wet food, making medication a breeze. Despite his condition, Calcifer is an active little kitty who can run, jump, and play just like any other feline companion.

While Calcifer may be a bit shy initially, he quickly adjusts to people and forms strong bonds once he feels comfortable in his home. Other animals do not seem to bother him once he settles in. If you have a nurturing heart and the experience to meet Calcifer's special needs, he will be forever grateful for a loving and understanding forever home.

Approx.  DOB:  11/3/2022

These two are the most loving cats! Sweet, affectionate and gorgeous. Very curious, playful amazing little personalities! Great with other kitties.
They both have seizure disorder that is easily controlled with a half pill 2 times a day, and have not had a seizure in over 4 months. 

Kittens are preferred to go in pairs, triplets, or to a home with an existing pet to be their friend. Our cats are rescued from Florida, where major animal overpopulation means less homes.

Neutered/Spayed, vaccinated, fiv/felv negative, and parasite free!

Buddy Boy's paw prints may be soft-spoken, but they leave an indelible mark on the hearts of those who know him. In his unassuming presence, we find a reminder to embrace the understated beauty that surrounds us and to cherish the quiet, genuine connections that enrich our lives.

Buddy Boy would be the perfect addition to anyone that needs a friend, one that does not talk back, or disagree with any of your opinions. Get your brush ready, because he sure loves to be brushed. 

Buddy Boy has FeLV and FIV, two viruses that affect his immune system. Do you have a friend that has a poor immune system? Buddy Boy is like that friend that can get sick easier then another cat with a better immune system. With good vet care, and the know to take him in for a cold is all he really needs. 

Please open your hearts to him.

Samson is a big cat with a big personality!  His personality is so big, it needs to be contained with a daily dose of Prozac, but he's good about taking his meds. We suspect that when he was younger he was handled roughly and he learned that the way to communicate with people is to give them a swat when he wants more attention or a nip when he doesn't want you to stop petting him.  He absolutely loves people and will follow you around like a dog.  He has great confidence and is not the type of cat to hide when you have guests over.  In fact, he will likely inspect any and all guests and look for pets from them too.  The more pets the better in Samson's mind!

Samson needs a cat-savvy person who will have the patience to work with him on behavior modification.  He would like to be the only cat in the home because he demands all of the attention from the humans, but with his personality you will only need one cat.  His ideal home will be adult-only since he himself is the size of a small child and his personality would not mix well with children.  

He is a volunteer favorite and they say they've never met a cat quite like him before.  Come meet him and see for yourself!

The day is finally here! We are now accepting adoption applications for Presley! If you aren’t aware, Presley came to us by way of the Binghamton Police Department back in January after being found injured in the middle of a street unable to move. Presley had suffered a diaphragmatic hernia as a result of his injuries, but is now all healed up and ready to find his purrfect forever home! Presley does have some very minor mobility issues with his back legs after suffering severe trauma from being struck by a vehicle, but trust us when we say that in no way stops him from being your everyday cat! Presley can easily walk, RUN, drift around corners with ease, and can even manage to jump up onto surfaces that are lower to the ground. Presley will have to go to a special home that can accommodate his special needs, while also keeping in mind he is still your typical rambunctious young kitty boy who will need to have his energy drained appropriately so as to avoid any unwanted mischief. 
If you are interested in potentially adopting Presley, please complete and send in our adoption application for our sanctuary staff to review. Applications can be found on our website here: www.speakanimalhospital.org/forms. Completed applications may be submitted to our email at speakoffice@aol.com. Please keep in mind we are still conducting all adoptions by appointment only. Thank you!

Alexander and Matilda are still looking for their forever home! They've been with us for over a year!

These kitties are not related, but have become best feline friends in foster care!
Alexander is a handsome and sweet cream-colored boy who is about 1.5 years old. He is a wobbly cat and a bit clumsy, but he has a great attitude and doesn't let this hold him down! He is good at getting himself onto furniture, and is also good about getting into and the litter box. Stairs could be challenging for him, unless they are carpeted. He is so funny and lovable and will make a great companion!

Matilda is his friend and cuddle buddy. She is about 6 years old and FIV positive. She is healthy and has had a recent dental cleaning. With regular vet care, she should have a long and healthy life. She is shy around people, but she can be pet. She doesn't have a mean bone in her body! With time and attention she will continue to enjoy attention more and more, but for now she is happy to just snuggle with Alexander! She loves mealtime and she has an adorable meow when she is hoping for food!

They are both spayed/neutered and up-to-date on vaccines. Alexander is FeLV/FIV negative, and Matilda is FeLV negative and FIV positive.

Callie was found outside and slowly coaxed indoors. She is still learning what being an indoor cat looks like and will be happiest with a family who understands her preference for love on her own terms. She is curious and she enjoys exploring at night while I read on the couch. She will occasionally jump next to me for a moment -but just a moment, for now.

Callie absolutely adores her companion cat here and needs a home with a companion for her that will make her feel safer and help show her how to live a domesticated life. 

Callie (DOB 01/01/2019) is spayed, has had all her age appropriate vaccinations, and is litter trained. 

Callie has also tested positive for FIV+, and so Kitten angels recommend that this cat be adopted as an only pet or as a companion for another FIV + kitty.

Have questions about FIV+ Kitten Angels recommends these resources:

S-S-Smokin’ Queen Sheba is looking for a special forever-after home. 

Sheba is a pretty 10 year old dilute tortoiseshell who was recently diagnosed with diabetes at her annual vet visit. While we are hoping for someone who already has experience with this disease, TASP is also willing to train someone. Both her shots and the blood level tests are relatively easy tasks, but it is important to have a schedule where you will be able to feed her grain-free food and then administer the shots twice a day, 12 hours apart.

Sheba has adapted very well to her new regimen, and actually initiates it as part of her meal routine now, along with some lovin’ of course. She is eating her new food like a champ and also enjoys a few freeze-dried treats at bedtime.

Now let me tell you a little about her sparkling personality. She is a smart and quirky cat, downright hilarious at times. Unlike many cats who will just give you a blank stare, Sheba actually responds to “no” and “back” commands. She has a snowman bed, but she chooses to sleep on top of it, rather than inside. When she puts her paws up on your leg, it means, she has designated this as your cuddle time. Like most cats, she enjoys sleeping during both the day and night, but also enjoys her playtime. While Sheba does like to chase balls or wrestle with some toys, she also amuses herself with cardboard juice or milk cartons, paper and aluminum foil. She hasn’t yet shared with us who or what these imaginary friends are, but she sure has a great time socializing with them. As a matter of fact, these are the only playmates she desires; she does not want to share even larger common areas with another pet. She loves the attention of humans though, known or new. She really misses having the company of her own human to rub against and purr to, and who could dote on her with some good conversation and pets in return. 

Are you the kind soul this pretty girl is waiting for? If so, please fill out our application http://www.theanimalsupportproject.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Adoption-Application_TASP_PDF.pdf

Sprinkles is a special kitty in search of a special home. Sprinkles is a 5 year-old gal who is looking for a quiet home with someone who is patient and understands her. You see, Sprinkles came to us as a very unhappy kitty with trauma to her hind end; upon exam, our wonderful vet believed she may have been kicked or stomped by a previous owner. As a result, she has difficulty grooming around her tail and back legs, so she sometimes develops matting there. But besides daily glucosamine, she is able to run and jump like any other kitty. Sprinkles also takes a bit to warm up to new people and is understandably anxious around loud noise and fast movements - so a quiet home without small children would probably be best for her. She has lived around a small dog who she ignores as well as cats; however, she does get picked on by more confident kitties. Sprinkles is very smart though and can use a cat door. Once comfortable, she just wants to be around her people, and is very chatty and loves to rub noses with her humans. So if you are looking for a best friend and believe you can provide this pretty girl with the safe and loving home she deserves, please send an email to schedule a visit and come meet her!

Evee came to Logan’s Rescue in October 2018 and gave birth a day later. She has weaned her kittens, is spayed and ready for her forever family. Evee does have grade III-IV/VI Heart Murmur that will need to be monitored. If you are interested in adopting please visit our website at www.LogansRescue.org to read over our adoption information and fill out an application.

Baby Boy has it all. He's beautiful, mellow, gets along well with other cats and is super-duper friendly. You can pick him up and hold him and he will try to climb on your shoulders to get as close as he can to you. The only thing is this sweet boy has asthma and also requires prescription food. He takes medication to keep asthma under control. We hope someone will allow this sweet boy into their heart and their home. We would provide all the necessary medical background before he is adopted. 

DOB: 2/25/2011

Apply at www.ewhiskers.com/apply
Please do not email
Please do not click on "Start Your Inquiry" on PetFinder.

All of Whiskers cats and kittens are spayed or neutered, age appropriately vaccinated and tested for FELV/FIV prior to adoption. Go to www.ewhiskers.com/apply to fill out our online adoption application.

Little is a stunning 2 year old boxer who is deaf.  She is crate trained, housebroken, loves to ride in the car and stick her head out the window, and loves playing in running water. The hose and the shower are two of her favorite things. Additionally, she loves to sunbathe on the deck. 
Little would do best with a person, couple or family who is active and likes to be outside with a fenced yard. She prefers to be the only dog who can get all of your attention. Due to her size, she would do best with older children and an experienced owner who will take the time to work with her and understand her cues. She doesn’t communicate like a normal dog but she does tell you what she wants / needs if you pay attention. She is incredibly intelligent and loyal. She will stick by your side wherever you go. Visit our website to give this special girl a home www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Name: Murphy
Breed: Collie Pyrenees Mix
Age: 1 year
Disposition: Working breed

About Murphy:
Murphy is a one-year-old Collie Pyrenees mix who is looking for a home where he can put his working breed instincts to use. He is an active and intelligent dog who thrives on having a job and purpose in life.

Personality:
Murphy is a dedicated and hardworking dog with a strong work ethic. He is known for his intelligence and is quick to learn and follow commands. He is an alert and attentive companion who is always ready for a task. While he may be serious and focused during work, he can also be affectionate and loyal to his human companions.

Work and Job Requirements:
As a working breed, Murphy requires a home where he can have a job or specific tasks to engage his mind and energy. This could include activities such as herding, agility training, or participating in dog sports. Murphy will excel in an environment where he is given the opportunity to work and use his natural instincts. Regular mental and physical stimulation is essential for his overall well-being.

Training:
Murphy is a highly trainable dog due to his intelligence and eagerness to work. He will benefit from consistent and positive reinforcement training methods. With the right guidance and training, he can become a well-behaved and reliable companion. Engaging in activities that challenge his mind and provide structure will help fulfill his working breed needs.

Activity Level:
Murphy has a high activity level and requires regular exercise to stay happy and content. Daily walks, runs, or engaging in activities that simulate his working instincts will help burn off his excess energy. Providing him with sufficient physical exercise and mental stimulation will contribute to his overall happiness and prevent behavioral issues that may arise from boredom.

Ideal Home:
Murphy would thrive in a home where his working abilities can be utilized. Owners who have experience with working breeds or have a background in dog training would be well-suited for him. A home with a large securely fenced yard or access to open spaces would be ideal. Murphy needs an owner who understands his needs for mental and physical stimulation and is committed to providing him with a purposeful life.

If you are looking for a dedicated and active companion who thrives on having a job, Murphy might be the perfect match for you. Prepare to embark on a fulfilling journey with this intelligent and hardworking dog!

******Please note, once completing the initial screen you will be connected with the placement for a video chat. Transports run every few weeks and we will have the dog on the next available transport once approved. If you are not able to accept a dog until a specific time period, please apply at that time************

We are a volunteer run rescue and donate our time to these dogs. IF you are not serious about moving forward in our adoption process, please do not apply. If someone other than yourself is part of the decision making process, please make sure you have spoken with them and they are on board. We really do not want to waste anyone's time if you are not serious about adopting this dog.

Buttercup, 2yr old, spayed female, pitbull mix, 51 pounds. Buttercup resides in Houston, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Buttercup was saved from the county shelter and was housed with another dog, and went into a foster home with other pups. She was able to do integrate well but, because of her hearing impairment, she gets startled easily and becomes very defensive when surprised. It is not that she cannot be around other dogs but she needs time to feel comfortable and secure before letting her guard down. To alleviate this, we have found putting up a fence/x-pen and allowing her to see/"meet" the dogs before being let loose with them works best for Buttercup. 

Buttercup has learned some basic obedience using hand signals and tactile marks, and has learned to connect seeing other dogs with a long tap on her right shoulder. Her ideal home would be one who sees her hearing challenges as an opportunity to connect on a deeper level with her and will take the time to train Buttercup, whether on their own or through professional courses.

Buttercup is very human friendly and affectionate. She's a gentle lovebug working to navigate her way through this world with the guidance of her human. She would do best with kids 10 years or older due to her size and hearing issues, which may result in her being startled by young kids. 

Buttercup is a solid 4/10 level dog - she can be playful and excited but her default is to sit back and watch, assess. She is well mannered and doesn't beg, and is overall easy to handle on the leash, with minimal reactivity on walks. She is fully house and crate trained, and enjoys snoozing in bed or riding in a car for adventures.

***Listed BREED and AGE - We are taking our best guess & recommendations from our veterinarian on age, breed and size when fully grown. We rarely know a dog's exact age nor are we able to tell the true or full breed mix of dogs as our information is limited most of the time. ***

Interested in applying to adopt her? Fill out an adoption application at the link below!

https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/DDAR/Dog

Meet Ella: The Three-Legged Wonder Dog (Looking for a Forever Adventure Buddy!)

Howdy there! My name's Ella, and let me tell you, I'm a firecracker of a pup!  Life started out a little ruff – me and my best bud, Ava, were found all alone at an abandoned house. We then landed at a shelter, but let's just say country livin' wasn't quite the life for energetic pups like us. Especially since space was tight, and you know, the whole "risk of euthanasia" thing wasn't ideal. Thankfully, we were then moved over to Saving Grace until a home comes along.

But hey, that's all in the past! Now I'm on the hunt for my forever home, and let me tell you, it's gotta be full of fun and adventure.  I may be missing a leg (don't worry, it doesn't slow me down one bit!), but my spirit is bigger than life! I may be three-legged, but I have the energy of four!  Walks in the park or just cuddling on the couch - I am down for all!

While I adore my pal Ava (who also needs a home), we also enjoy time apart.  I am happy to shower a new family with all the love I've got.  

So, if you're looking for a vibrant, fun-loving pup who's ready to conquer every walk and cuddle session with enthusiasm, then look no further!  Don't be discouraged by my missing leg – my heart and spirit are full, and I'm ready to fill your life with endless joy.  Please contact Saving Grace and tell them you want to meet Ella, the three-legged wonder dog, and let's start our forever adventure together!

********************************************************************************************************

Watch these videos of Ella playing (copy and paste into your browser):

https://youtu.be/g_BA-p4VrS8

https://youtu.be/rIf50FjgiRs

Please consider adopting a special needs pet.  Ella’s life is priceless!

Note to adopter: Three-legged dogs can live long, happy and healthy lives with minimal adjustment to their lifestyle and yours!

Medical information for Ella:
-40 pounds
-heartworm negative
-vaccinated
-spayed 
-up-to-date on all preventatives
-microchipped

Families with cats: Local Texas adoptions only so we can cat test in your home environment.

************************************************************************************************

TO BE CONSIDERED, PLEASE COMPLETE AN APPLICATION!
https://form.jotform.com/220199338769066

Local Texas adoption fee: $225

If adopting outside of Texas:
PROJECT FREEDOM RIDE ADOPTION FEE:
$600 (includes transport)

Ella is currently located with our rescue in the Texas Panhandle. We are one the partner rescues with Project Freedom Ride and do monthly transports to the PNW and NE.

All directly adopted dogs come vaccinated, microchipped, spayed/neutered, if 6 months or older require a negative heartworm test, and up to date on flea & tick preventative and heartworm preventative if applicable and a negative fecal. Your adoption allows us to continue our mission. Thank you for opting to adopt!

Project Freedom Ride Drop Off Locations **DROP-OFF LOCATIONS CHANGE WITH EACH TRANSPORT AND WILL BE DISCUSSED ON VIDEO CALL**:

Northwest Route: Salt Lake City, UT - Meridian, ID - Kennewick, WA - Mt. Vernon, WA - Seattle, WA – Portland, OR - Stanwood, WA - Oregon City, OR - Richland, WA

Northeast Route: Des Moines, IA - Chicago, IL - Springfield, IL - Indianapolis, IN - Grand Rapids, MI - Lansing, MI - Kansas City, MO - Minneapolis, MN - Cleveland, OH - Columbus, OH - Baltimore, MD - Bedminster, NJ - Buffalo, NY - Syracuse, NY - Castleton on Hudson, NY - Newburgh, NY - Pembroke, NY - Syracuse, NY - Bedminster, NJ - Chester, PA - Philadelphia, PA - Pittsburgh, PA - Halethorpe, MD - Springfield, VA - Richmond, VA - Stevens Point, WI

As a Project Freedom Ride direct adoption, the adoption interview/meet and greet would take place on video call (FB Messenger Call, Whats App, or Google Duo). The adoption application and fee would be finalized prior to transport.
