Prin was originally found wandering as a stray. She is a sweet older female cattle dog. Prin loves everyone including kids and doesn't seem to mind kitties. She has gotten used to other dogs over time, but she is blind so she enjoys having her personal space with other dogs, too! Prin is housetrained as well! She does have diabetes, so her adopter would need to do injections for her to keep her happy and healthy! Prin is currently resting comfortably in a foster home, but give us a call to find out more!

RC is a 5-year-old male Chow Chow that is blind. He would do best in a home that has both Chow and blind dog experience.

For more information about CCRCNY's policies or to find the application, please visit our website: https://www.chowrescuecny.org/adoption-process/

Do they get any cuter than Miss Kate?! 

This sweet little girl is in a foster home, but she's ready to meet her new family soon! She's about 25 weeks old (May 2024). 

Kate is good with dogs. Loves people and could live with a cat. 

Kate is deaf. She'd need someone willing to train her and work with her.

Luna is a sweet, silly senior girl who's found a new zest for life! 
She loves people and really enjoys adventures. But probably not as much as she likes treats! This sweet lady was a whopping 104 pounds when she came in! She is now down to about 75 and boy does she feel good! 

Luna is good with some male dogs. But she really needs a kitty free home. She also only prefers the company of teenages/adults. Luna does require daily medication to control her cushing's disease.

Nugget is a chihuahua Jack Russell mix that came to us needing a little help with his training since he was acting out with some very negative attention seeking behaviors. We weren't going to give up on him as his previous owners did when they took him to a shelter to be euthanized at just 10 months old when he was showing signs of a high play drive and becoming nippy to elicit attention the only way he knew how.  It has been a long process including a 2 week stay and train program at click to zen to lay down a foundation for him of positive reinforcement training and basic manners. He has been responding very well to his training but it needs to continue once he is placed into a new foster to adopt home. This little 10# Jack Russel terrier mix is super smart and he learns very quickly so we think he can continue to be taught new tricks and manners as he continues to grow into such a good boy. His foster mom wrote the following bio in hopes that we can find Nugget a great new foster to adopt home. Please be sure to read all about him before applying since he is needing a specific type of forever home?
Nugget has been hard at work after his two week long board and train. He has been getting consistent, daily (and usually nightly during the work week) brief training sessions from his foster mom. 
Nugget has come a long way and is working hard along side his foster mom to learn all the world has to offer. From living in a rural area, to learning all of the scary sounds in the city. Nugget’s foster mom is working on desensitizing him with many different sounds every day. He has learned to not be scared of the hair dryer, food processor, kitchen Aid mixer, and now and working on the vacuum. 
They have been working every night, refreshing on the basics he learned at his board and train like place, settle (lay down), come, and leave it. 
As well as slowly teaching him to sit, heal, and to be more tolerable towards the cats, and to be respectful towards his larger foster dog sister. Nugget enjoys playing with other dogs he knows and is comfortable with, but does not like to share his toys. So he may be best in an only dog home, or at least separated/crated when left by himself as to not be overstimulated, and have time to himself to decompress.
Nugget has a high prey drive, and will chase anything running fast. So he would do best in a home without any cats, a fenced in yard, or if no fenced in yard, to have him securely leashed when walked. Due to his past history with children, and his tendency towards hyperactivity, he would do best in a home with older children, and adults.
He is very well crate trained and does not mess in his crate, and is working very well at potty training. 
In the beginning, Nugget had had difficulty socializing with new humans and animal. It takes him a little extra time to meet someone in order to start to feel comfortable with them. When staying with his foster family, Nugget has slowly been able to be introduced to some new people inside and outside of the home, and is improving his social skills.
He does love to play with his toys with his humans, but does not like to share with other animals. He likes to keep his bones to himself, and may feel intimidated if someone tried taking it from him, but is working on “leave it” means it’s okay to give up our bone and we will be rewarded.
Nugget loves to cuddle next to his human, or on top of them if he can. He truly loves and clings to his one human and looks to them for reassurance, as well as may become a little protective over them, so his human will have to keep up with consistent training to reinforce his positive behaviors.  
Nugget will need continued training following his adoption to be successful and continue positively moving forward. Nugget would love to learn with you!

An adoption donation of $450 is being asked to cover a small portion of his veterinary, training and care fees. For more information, go to allcreaturesbigandsmall.org and email a completed adoption application to meowchatz@hotmail.com.

Please copy and paste a completed adoption application from our homepage with your inquiry if you would like a response back. We get dozens of emails and phone calls each day with only an hour of "free time" to volunteer and answer them around our full-time jobs and family life...don't let your inquiry get passed by because of an incomplete application. Thanks in advance for your help!

Help our rescue by donating to our "Spay the momma fund". When adopting one of our babies, if each new family would contribute an extra $10 we can help out that babies mother by assisting with the cost of her spay. Help turn the momma into a pet rather than a breeding factory, donate today! 

Adoptions limited to a 500 mile radius of Pulaski, NY and pets must be viewed in person by all family members prior to adoption; animals will not be shipped to their new homes. Veterinary reference check and adoption donation also required. Check out our homepage for a full list of our adoption requirements.

This is a courtesy posting - Please contact shellzny2@gmail.com if you are interested in Missy.

Meet Miss Sophie! This lovely girl is well mannered  & sweet! Although Miss Sophie is a little timid at first, once she meets you she turns on the charm!
A little trust goes a long way with this lovely lady.  Older children would be preferable to her especially if they are willing to throw a ball for her.
Please email shellzny2@gmail.com for more info on this beauty! 

This is a courtesy posting - Please contact shellzny2@gmail.com if you are interested in Missy.

Arnold is a GREAT DOG about 3 years old and was found as a stray. He is currently in foster care and his foster mom LOVES him! Don't let his serious looking pictures fool you - he does smile A LOT (just not for the camera!) and he is a very happy, friendly guy who is house trained and well behaved. Arnold is a very energetic and active dog, who is eager to learn, listens well and is extremely smart and sensitive, which makes him a dream to work with. He needs guidance and leadership, but with a soft touch. Arnold could excel at almost anything (dog sports, tracking, agility) and needs an adult only home with someone who will take the time to keep his mind and physical needs busy, in return he will be the most amazing companion ever. He has been introduced to a few female dogs and has done very well with them and would need a meet and greet if you have another dog.

THIS IS A COURTESY POSTING AND PRINCESS IS NOT AT OUR SHELTER. SHE IS IN A RESCUE. IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MORE INFORMATION, PLEASE EMAIL TARNISOAPS1@AOL.COM.

Princess is 3 years old, healthy, medium-sized for the breed, white pit bull. 

From what our rescue knows, she was found abandoned and tied up on Harlem’s streets. At some point she went through to a second initial owner and she was either abused there or originally (or both). She was surrendered for being snippy at people and exhibiting fearful behavior. At the same time, she has shown affection toward people, is very interested in play, and walks, and has a lot of youthful energy. She was pulled into our because of that potential. 

She walks on lead but requires good lead skills and treats or toys to help guide her through the walk. She takes treats and toys from human hands especially in a less stressful situation than she is in now. She rode in cars and interacted with toys and people positively. Her behavior was better initially but is naturally increasingly compromised by crating and current stress of foster home. She should ideally be having more 1 on 1 attention / training with a breed experienced person and less resident pets near her to react to. 

She is not good with cats and small dogs and she needs to be in an adult only, experienced and dog savvy home. 

Please note that this is a courtesy posting and Princess is not at our shelter but is in a rescue. If you are interested in more information about her, please contact tarnisoaps1@aol.com

SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY. LAYLA NEEDS AN ADULT ONLY HOME WITH SOMEONE WHO IS AN EXPERIENCED DOG HANDLER. SHE ALSO NEEDS TO BE THE ONLY PET IN YOUR HOME. SHE REQUIRES SOMEONE WHO IS ABLE TO VISIT THE SHELTER IN DELHI, NY MULTIPLE TIMES TO MEET & GAIN HER TRUST PRIOR TO ADOPTING HER. SHE WOULD DO BEST IN A COUNTRY SETTING THAT IS QUIET AND WITH SOMEONE WHO HAS A QUIET LIFESTYLE

***Serious inquiries only please from those who are experienced dog handlers with no children and no other pets***

Layla’s Foster Mom describes her as the classic “Huge-Personality-in-a-Small-Package” kind of dog, and she is a tiny bundle of bustling energy. She is about 35 – 40 pounds and is about 6 years old. 

Layla is very SWEET, AFFECTIONATE and FUNNY with people she knows and trusts, but it will take many visits and lots of patience with her as she is very wary and nervous when it comes to meeting new people. When she is around people who she doesn't know, she can get very anxious and overly excited, and it takes quite a bit of time for her to be able to settle down so she is not stressed. 

Anyone who wants to meet her will need to be committed to setting up appointments to come to the shelter many times to gain her trust slowly. She needs to be in a quiet and low traffic, adult-only home with no children. Her adopters will also need to be experienced dog handlers and know how to manage her behavior when she is outside her comfort zone, as she will need ongoing help navigating new environments and situations. Her adopter(s) will also always need to closely manage her interactions with anyone new. 

Layla’s Foster Mom enjoys Layla’s weekly overnight home visits and says she is house-trained and crate-trained and knows basic commands (come, sit, down, wait). She likes to go for walks and does well on the leash, and she is great in the car. She loves chewy toys, bones and playing fetch (although she's still working on the bringing it back part of fetch ?), and she is also capable of just hanging out and relaxing. She is extremely food motivated so training her will be easy, and she is eager to learn and please you - most of all, she wants YOUR attention and being petted is her favorite reward!  

While we feel that she would be best in a home as the only pet, we think it is possible that she might get along with a very mellow large male given time and proper introductions. We know the list of requirements is long and Layla is not the dog for everyone, but we are hoping to find the right home that sets her up for success and helps her thrive. In return this QUIRKY and LOVING girl promises to become your BEST FRIEND FOREVER!!!

***Serious inquiries only please from those who are experienced dog handlers, no children and no other pets and be willing to visit the shelter in Delhi, NY multiple times to meet and gain her trust prior to adopting her.***

SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY. LAYLA NEEDS AN ADULT ONLY HOME WITH SOMEONE WHO IS AN EXPERIENCED DOG HANDLER. SHE ALSO NEEDS TO BE THE ONLY PET IN YOUR HOME. SHE REQUIRES SOMEONE WHO IS ABLE TO VISIT THE SHELTER MULTIPLE TIMES TO MEET & GAIN HER TRUST PRIOR TO ADOPTING HER. SHE WOULD DO BEST IN A COUNTRY SETTING THAT IS QUIET AND WITH SOMEONE WHO HAS A QUIET LIFESTYLE. PLEASE SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY

Sadie has become the surrogate dogmom of the foster home - she just wants to give and get all the love.  Saved from the ACC last SEPTEMBER - she is still seeking a perfect forever life with some special people. 
Good with dogs, kids and cats - Sadie is short, sleek,  cute and everything inbetween. Currently with a foster near Binghamton, NY - she is now around 11 months old - we have noticed Sadie is a little selective in her hearing - if on purpose or not she gets along just fine, but  definitely something to be aware of.  She loves to snuggle and play - full of your typical puppy personality!

All of our animals are examined by a veterinarian, given age-appropriate vaccinations, de-wormed, microchipped, spayed or neutered, heart-worm tested, and treated if necessary.

Vet references and a home/family visit are required, and an adoption fee applies.

Transport options are available within our area of operation, including Pennsylvania, the tri-state area, and New England. Please note we do not adopt animals into Canada.

Visit www.pmarinc.org for more information, and to fill out an application.

Maria is a 9 year old hound. She hasn’t had the best life and arrived to us covered in masses and had horrible ear infections. Despite this, she has been the sweetest girl that just absolutely loves attention. Her masses were removed and biopsied and we were ecstatic to find out they were benign. We are still working on her ears, but our vet believes she will have chronic ear infections. Maria is housebroken, great on a leash, good with dogs, and would be fine in a home with kids. She will need a home with no small animals.

TASHA was a throwaway mom.. her pups were all adopted and she languished in the shelter until she was rescued and joined our family. She is only 3 yrs old but has experienced things well beyond her years. She has a bit of separation anxiety so someone who works from home or is retired and home most of the time would be the the best dog parent for her. She is very loving and friendly,  although sometimes it takes her a few minutes to warm up you. She is spayed, utd with her vaccines,  heartworm negative and on monthly preventative. She is good with other dogs but we don't know about cats. She would do best in a home with older children - at least 10, A fenced yard, an approved application and a home visit are required.

ZYLO is a lovable, friendly pup who needs a family to love him.. He is a coonhound mix and does have the typical hound bay when he does decide to use it. He needs to be the only dog at this point but he loves cats. He will be a wonderful family dog but right now he is still learning how to behave, so a home without small children would be best. A fenced yard is a requirement. He loves his stuffies, is 99% housetrained, is crate trained, is vaccinated and on monthly heartworm prevention. He needs a family who will be will to continue his obedience training. He LOVES car rides (but a car harness is definitely required) and he does very well out in public places. He loves all people and is very social. He is learning it is not appropriate to jump up. We are working on leash walking with a head halter and he is doing well, just needs continued practice.
He knows his name and comes when called,, he knows sit and down, paw, and is working on mastering stay, leave it and off.  He loves to cuddle with you!! If you are thinking ZYLO might be a good fit for your family please contact us at jacksonslegacy170@gmail.com, we will be happy to send you an application and answer any other questions you may have.

Evee, a delightful 2-3-year-old mini Aussie, truly shines once she's had the chance to settle into her new environment. Despite being 100% deaf, she has mastered hand signals for her basic manners. Having come from a hoarding situation, Evee is still in the process of learning a consistent potty routine, showing gradual improvement each day! Her affection for kids knows no bounds, and she eagerly seeks a little human companion to shower love upon

Daisy, the 2-year-old Pit mix, is 100% DEAF but is doing an amazing job learning hand signals for basic commands. She enjoys the company of other dogs, especially puppies, but sometimes misses social cues due to her deafness. With ongoing socialization and training, she will grasp these interactions better. Daisy's favorite things include soft beds, cuddling, and zooming around the yard – she's either all in or all out, no in-between!

breeds_label: Catahoula Leopard Dog & Labrador Retriever Mix
description:
Meet Bridgette! 

Bridgette recently became a tripod, though we suspect the dead leg was an older untreated injury. And unfortunately she ended up with a torn CCL in a back leg while in a foster home. She is currently in a medical foster home in NY where she is recovering from her CCL surgery done on 10/16. 

Yes, a tripod in the front and CCL injury in the back!! This girl is a survivor. 

Bridgette will soon be ready for her furever home. We are hoping to find a calm, stress free furever home, probably with someone who is home alot! This precious soul has been through so much and she's pulled through, only to be hit with set back after set back more recently. She had overcome all her obstacles but definitely showed signs of shutting down as her confidence was shaken to the core while in another foster home where she tore a CCL. 
********************* 
Sweet Bridgette found herself in a high kill shelter in NC through no fault of their own. A stray, emaciated and with a non-functioning leg, the shelter put her on the euthanasia list, along with another sweet pup Ellie, who had been hit by a car. 

These girls had survived horror and they were still here, yet they found themselves fighting for their lives in the shelter - we could not let them down. Our rescue partnered with a medical rescue group to save these girls from euthanasia and get them to hospital for their treatment and surgeries. 

Just check out their 'freedom' ride together the day we got them out of the shelter!! Even with their injuries, tails are wagging and ears flopping, they knew they were free and now in good hands! Bridgette is at a healthy weight, had an amputation, and as you can see from her video, she is a very happy fully functioning tripod! 

The hospital at the time also suspected she also had chronic CCL disease in her knees. 

Link to album, showing before and after surgery photos and videos: https://photos.app.goo.gl/dY1wQhJtciJJUUye9 
Wagging tails and happy to accept pupperonis as sympathy gifts! 

Bridgette is still a young pup, very loving and just look at her stunning coat and ooooooh, those eyes!! If you are interested in loving this precious girl, please contact Aly on 732 604 0625 ASAP!

Rambo is currently the longest shelter resident at Dog Control. He was found as a stray in the City of Watertown in December of 2022 and has been with us ever since. He's a great dog with many quirks: Rambo is selective about people. He's not a fan of other dogs, but totally loves cats! Occasionally, DCO Hess brings in Pippin who he adores and he's recently met BeeBee, Pippin's newest cat-sister. 

Rambo loves the outdoors and is looking for a family that would go on adventures with him. He loves attention, he loves to play ball, and LOVES to chase the water hose. Are you interested in adding this handsome ginger to your life?? Reach out to us at 315-779-5900 and ask us more about Rambo.

Lou is about 8 1/2 years old, and he weighs 55 pounds. This stocky little meatball loves to play with rope toys, and can sit and shake for treats. Lou will do best in a home without cats or small children. He must meet any resident dog(s) in a potential new home, to make sure they get along.

*special needs* Lou is currently eating a prescription hydrolized protein food, due to chronic skin allergies.

* Lou qualifies for the shelter's Adult Companion Program, for adopters aged 50+

Lily is about 2 years old, and she weighs about 55 pounds. This sweet girl loves people, and gets attached to her human friends very quickly. Lily knows how to sit for treats, and she enjoys going for walks with our staff. Lily can be grabby with her food and treats, so we recommend caution around small children while she's eating. Lily must meet any resident dog(s) in a potential new home, to make sure they get along. Here at the shelter, Lily seems to enjoy being around the other dogs.

* Lily has chronic skin allergies, and is currently taking an allergy medication as well as eating a prescription diet.

This absolute sweetheart is looking for his forever home!  Bradley can be best described as a velcro dog. He does have quite a bit of separation anxiety, which he will need your help working through.  Due to this, we are currently looking for a home where someone will be with him all the time.  Bradley is one of our special cases here at the shelter, and we have quite a bit more information we would like to share with any potential adopters.  If you are interested in Bradley, please fill out a dog adopter survey, linked below, and we will share more information with you if we feel your home may be a good fit.

https://www.yateshumane.org/dog-adopter-survey

Meet Atlas! 
He has been here since October 2023.
Atlas is a 5-1/2-year-old Pit Bull Terrier, weighing around 64 lbs. Atlas is working on his basic commands, leash walking and house training and he is very treat motivated. He loves playing fetch in the yard and spending time with his people. Atlas can be scared of things at first but gains confidence very quickly. He is very high energy and would do best in a home with older teens & adults. Unfortunately, Atlas is not good with small or large dogs and he is also not good with cats, he would need to be your one and only. Atlas would also do best in a home that can spend lots of time with him and work with him, as he does have severe separation anxiety.

Roomba is around 2 years old and is a deaf bull terrier mix who is full of energy! Roomba loves to run and play! He gets along wonderful with other dogs and people. He is still young so he would benefit from a high energy home. 

Being deaf, Roomba would do best in a home who is familiar with his needs and can dedicate the time to help train him into being the best little man, but it is not necessary. He has started to pick up on some hand signals. He is just the sweetest boy around who sadly is overlooked due to his special needs. Roomba is microchipped, UTD on vaccines, and neutered.

Mack-aroni! 

Mack is a 7-1/2 year old shepherd mix. He came to the shelter in September of 2021 as a stray but has received little interest. While Mack initially takes a little cozying up with new people he eventually warms up and loves to show off his toys and give you all of his attention. He has a thyroid issue that makes him a little on the chunky side, but he is now on medication which has helped him lose a lot of his extra weight (and that is just more to love)! He is just a happy, goofy guy who loves to play fetch, and can often be seen carrying around a big stuffed animal! Name: Murphy
Breed: Collie Pyrenees Mix
Age: 1 year
Disposition: Working breed

About Murphy:
Murphy is a one-year-old Collie Pyrenees mix who is looking for a home where he can put his working breed instincts to use. He is an active and intelligent dog who thrives on having a job and purpose in life.

Personality:
Murphy is a dedicated and hardworking dog with a strong work ethic. He is known for his intelligence and is quick to learn and follow commands. He is an alert and attentive companion who is always ready for a task. While he may be serious and focused during work, he can also be affectionate and loyal to his human companions.

Work and Job Requirements:
As a working breed, Murphy requires a home where he can have a job or specific tasks to engage his mind and energy. This could include activities such as herding, agility training, or participating in dog sports. Murphy will excel in an environment where he is given the opportunity to work and use his natural instincts. Regular mental and physical stimulation is essential for his overall well-being.

Training:
Murphy is a highly trainable dog due to his intelligence and eagerness to work. He will benefit from consistent and positive reinforcement training methods. With the right guidance and training, he can become a well-behaved and reliable companion. Engaging in activities that challenge his mind and provide structure will help fulfill his working breed needs.

Activity Level:
Murphy has a high activity level and requires regular exercise to stay happy and content. Daily walks, runs, or engaging in activities that simulate his working instincts will help burn off his excess energy. Providing him with sufficient physical exercise and mental stimulation will contribute to his overall happiness and prevent behavioral issues that may arise from boredom.

Ideal Home:
Murphy would thrive in a home where his working abilities can be utilized. Owners who have experience with working breeds or have a background in dog training would be well-suited for him. A home with a large securely fenced yard or access to open spaces would be ideal. Murphy needs an owner who understands his needs for mental and physical stimulation and is committed to providing him with a purposeful life.

If you are looking for a dedicated and active companion who thrives on having a job, Murphy might be the perfect match for you. Prepare to embark on a fulfilling journey with this intelligent and hardworking dog!

Meet Casper, our pup who was brought to the gates of the shelter at the age of approximately 2 months old in October of last year. Our volunteer took him to the vet and learned that he had a hernia and broken rear legs. 

Casper has since gotten all necessary treatments and rehabilitation, but due to his young age, vets could not perform surgery on him, and unfortunately, he won't be able to walk. Our hope is that he' be able to get better treatment once in the U.S.

Our resilient close-to-one-year-old pup has a heart of gold and a spirit that inspires everyone he meets. Despite facing challenges with mobility in his rear legs, Casper approaches life with boundless enthusiasm and an unwavering love for those around him.

From a young age, Casper has shown an incredible ability to adapt and thrive. His gentle demeanor and playful nature make him a joy to be around, whether he's charming his way into a snuggle session or delighting in a game with his favorite toys. Casper's love for cats is unmatched; he's known for his gentle curiosity and respectful interactions with his feline friends.

Casper's ideal family is one who understands the importance of patience, love, and the value of every moment shared together. With the right support and care, Casper is ready to blossom into a beloved companion, bringing endless happiness and warmth into a loving home.

Are you ready to open your heart and home to Casper? Come meet this special soul who proves every day that love knows no bounds. 

Adopt Casper and witness firsthand the extraordinary joy and resilience that defines his remarkable spirit. Together, let's give our little guy the loving family he so rightfully deserves.

Casper is neutered, microchipped, and fully vaccinated.

Please apply for Casper at www.gwarp.org and text Gabi after to follow up: 1-646-919-5461.

Chardonnay is a spayed female all white shepherd mix weighing 50lbs.  

She does not appear to be completely deaf but does have hearing deficits at certain frequencies.  
She is house trained and crate trained.  

She loves to play and has been happy to play with any dog, male or female, that she has met. She seems to be super dog friendly with all dogs of all sizes. 
She sleeps quietly in her crate at night and rides well in a car with no anxiety.
A home with school age children would be best due to her size and energy.  She is an active girl and not suited as an apartment dog.  
She needs a fenced yard and is not yet off leash trained.  Chardonnay is up to date on all vaccines including rabies and is heartworm negative she receives monthly prevention for heartworm disease and fleas/ticks. 

Her ideal home either has to be active and take her on walks and play times or have a doggie buddy for her to play with and run around the yard.  She is an active gal and likes to run, play chase, or play keep-away with sticks.  

She is extremely sweet and loving to her humans and loves to accompany them on new adventures.   
While she loves snuggle time , she’s not a couch potato and would do best in an active family with children and a dog buddy that she can play with.

She is not highly food motivated but thrives on love and attention.
She likes to be with her people and be included in family activities.
She is a great dog with an incredible personality.  She knows sit and heel for walking on a leash and off for jumping on her humans.  
She needs a loving committed forever home. Could that be you???

Chardonnay is currently being fostered in Texas but available to transport to approved adopter in the Midwest, Northeast and Canada. 

Adoption fee includes vaccinations, Spay/Neuter,  microchip, deworming, heartworm test, transport and vet/documentation requirements in preparation for transport. 

You can find my form "AJC Rescue & Transport Adoption Application" at: https://form.jotform.com/230167351175149

Meet Tula
Tula was found as a stray by a good Samaritan who took her into their home. She was very thin and was a bit apprehensive of people. After many months, they realized that Tula needed a family of her own. Tula is an amazing dog. She loves people and loves to give hugs. She likes dogs and some cats. She is housebroken and a very smart girl. Although she looks to be black/white in pics, she is really chocolate color like a  miniature choc lab. She would do well in any home situation, whether you are an active family or comfortable sharing the sofa with her while watching your favorite show. She has no problem issues and really wants to get on with her new life.

She is currently in the Houston area but transportation is available and easy. A portion of her adoption fee will be for transportation.

I would love to talk with you about Tula. Please text me first to let me know you will be calling 281-608-2368.

breeds_label: Beagle & Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler Mix
description:
**WE ARE ALWAYS IN NEED OF FOSTER HOMES** Homeward Bound Dog Rescue is an all volunteer rescue organization and all our dogs and puppies are in foster homes - we are not a shelter and do NOT have a facility where we house our dogs. For adoption information go to: www.homewardbounddogrescue.com. You must fill out an application online as we do NOT accept applications at our clinics.

This is Kena. She is a Beagle/Aussie mix around 2 yrs. old and 30 lbs. Kena was surrendered because her owner was moving. She’s very sweet and gets along with the resident dog and cat. She’s fully house trained and is able to be out of the crate overnight with no issues. She would probably love a fenced yard where she can run full speed (she’s fast!) and burn off energy, and then come cuddle up next to you on the couch and snooze. She walks well on the leash, although she tends to bark at/react to other dogs. It seems to be more out of excitement than aggression. This is one behavior she will need to continue to work on. Her foster mom works from home, but she does have some separation anxiety when left alone. She would love a family with someone who is home most of the day, though her anxiety may improve if she has more experience being alone. She hasn’t been destructive at all, so she may not even need to be crated while alone, though her foster has not fully tested this yet! She’s great in the car and happily jumps in to go for a ride. She would love a playful canine sibling to pal around with, though not required. She’s very smart and aims to please. She just needs someone willing to give her the exercise and guidance she needs. She will gladly pay you back with the cutest head tilt and a hundred kisses! Overall, she’s a wonderful dog and full of love to give her new family!

Our adoption clinics are held one Saturday a month at our facility in Schenectady on John Street, located directly behind Boulevard Bowl (Erie Boulevard) from 10 am to 12 pm (directions are on our website).  We require an approved application before we consider anyone for an adoption - so filling out the application is your first step.  Once your application has been reviewed you will receive an email invitation to attend an adoption event. Different dogs and puppies go up for adoption EVERY WEEK so please feel free to visit the site and click on the Petfinder link for updates as we are adopting dogs out in between adoption events. Puppies and dogs up to 2 years old are $350. Dogs over 2 years old are $250. 100% of the adoption fees go to help us save more dogs.

breeds_label: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler Mix
description: Hi there! My name is Sunshine, and I'm a 2 year old female dog with lots of love to give. I am an intelligent, friendly, affectionate, and playful dog who loves to be around people. I was born with only 3 legs, but it really doesn't affect me much. I still love to play and go for walks and I'm a really fast runner.  I love to snuggle up on the couch and soak up as much affection as I can get. I am a great listener and will always be there for you on your worst days.  If you're looking for a furry friend who will stick by your side through thick and thin, I am the one for you! I can't wait to meet you and start this new chapter in my life.

Manny is a friendly, affectionate adult dog looking for a loving home. Manny is a very sweet dog, who is always eager to please his owners. He gets along with other dogs. Manny is a very intelligent dog who is always curious about the world around him. He is an ideal companion for long walks in the park and will be sure to keep you company on all your adventures in life. Manny, like a lot of small dogs, has a big personality and has gone through training. 

If you're looking for a new best friend, come meet Manny today!

Meet Ella: The Three-Legged Wonder Dog (Looking for a Forever Adventure Buddy!)

Howdy there! My name's Ella, and let me tell you, I'm a firecracker of a pup!  Life started out a little ruff – me and my best bud, Ava, were found all alone at an abandoned house. We then landed at a shelter, but let's just say country livin' wasn't quite the life for energetic pups like us. Especially since space was tight, and you know, the whole "risk of euthanasia" thing wasn't ideal. Thankfully, we were then moved over to Saving Grace until a home comes along.

But hey, that's all in the past! Now I'm on the hunt for my forever home, and let me tell you, it's gotta be full of fun and adventure.  I may be missing a leg (don't worry, it doesn't slow me down one bit!), but my spirit is bigger than life! I may be three-legged, but I have the energy of four!  Walks in the park or just cuddling on the couch - I am down for all!

While I adore my pal Ava (who also needs a home), we also enjoy time apart.  I am happy to shower a new family with all the love I've got.  

So, if you're looking for a vibrant, fun-loving pup who's ready to conquer every walk and cuddle session with enthusiasm, then look no further!  Don't be discouraged by my missing leg – my heart and spirit are full, and I'm ready to fill your life with endless joy.  Please contact Saving Grace and tell them you want to meet Ella, the three-legged wonder dog, and let's start our forever adventure together!

********************************************************************************************************

Watch these videos of Ella playing (copy and paste into your browser):

https://youtu.be/g_BA-p4VrS8

https://youtu.be/rIf50FjgiRs

Please consider adopting a special needs pet.  Ella’s life is priceless!

Note to adopter: Three-legged dogs can live long, happy and healthy lives with minimal adjustment to their lifestyle and yours!

Mabel is looking for a very unique home. We realize her demands are high and finding her the perfect fit is a needle in a haystack. Her foster family is committed to her fully and prepared to keep her if a better home cannot be found. Mabel is an adolescent female mixed breed (see photos for her DNA results). She is up to date on vaccines, microchipped, heartworm negative and will soon be spayed. 
The Good
Mabel has a wonderful temperament and is good with other dogs of all sizes, cats and kids!  She has wirey, long hair that needs routine brushing but isn’t a dog that needs professional grooming every six weeks. She knows some basic manners such as “sit” and “down” and has pretty good leash manners. She is fantastic on car rides and loves outdoor activities such as hiking.
The Bad
Despite her wirey coat, she does shed and is not hypoallergenic. She is a typical adolescent dog that needs work on her impulse control and basic house etiquette. She will counter surf and get into things if given the opportunity. 
The Ugly
Mabel has some of the worst separation anxiety we have ever seen. She absolutely panics when left alone. She cannot be contained and will jump tall pens, fences and enclosures. She can easily escape out of a traditional folding crate and will attempt to escape out of “escape proof” crates until she is successful or seriously injures herself. She immediately urinates and defecates out of sheer terror when her people leave. SHE CANNOT BE LEFT ALONE. There is a chance she will eventually be able to be left for short periods of time but this is years down the road with continued behavior modification. She is receiving anxiety meds and has made very small improvements in the six weeks she has been with us. We will require she follows up with both a veterinary behavior expert and trainer of our choosing if she is adopted. 

We have had a few people comment that we should make her a service dog so she can go everywhere with her people. She is not a stable enough dog to do service work and trying to pass her off as one is a disservice to actual service dogs. 

If you have read this far and still think Mabel may fit your lifestyle, please visit our website at www.LogansRescue.org to read over our adoption information and fill out an application.

breeds_label: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler Mix
description:
Are you in search of a one-of-a-kind serial kisser? Well, look no further, because I, Mandy, am the dog you've been waiting for! I come with a mix of awesomeness and a charming personality that's sure to steal your heart.

I can be delightfully laid-back, enjoying those calm moments, or I can transform into a bouncing ball of joy when the mood strikes. Walks and jogs? Count me in, especially if you're by my side. But here's the thing-I love playing with other dogs so much that I often choose their company over toys.

Let's talk sunbathing. If your couch has that perfect spot for catching rays, you can bet I'll be there, soaking it all in. I'm a big fan of lounging, whether it's under tables, during dinner time, while you're working at your desk, or even when you're cuddled up in bed. I'm all about being close to my people, and if you choose to adopt me, I'll be all about you!

I'm a sociable girl, getting along well with other dogs and kids (especially with submissive/non-dominant dogs). My crate training and potty training with a doggy door are top-notch. I'm a pro at commands like going to my crate and sitting patiently.

Now, about my diet-here's the deal: I have EPI (Exocrine Pancreatic Insufficiency), which means my pancreas doesn't produce the enzymes I need to digest food properly. Thanks to some attentive rescuers and veterinary care, we've got it all figured out. I'll need a specific diet and a pancreatic enzyme replacement supplement to keep me feeling great. Think of it as a special appetizer and entree at every meal. EPI won't slow me down, and I'm ready to trade serial kisses for a loving forever home day in and day out. So, how about it?

Local adoption fee is $200 (in TX)
Out of state adoption fee is $400 (includes transport to your area - $50 Temporary Fuel 
Charge will be added)

breeds_label: English Bulldog & Staffordshire Bull Terrier Mix
description:
Gidget is a 35 lb, squishy American Bully. Gidget has allergies and has been through extensive testing. She currently needs allergy therapy injections and will need to continue them throughout her life. She is good with other dogs and enjoys running with kids. She is not a couch potato, has plenty of energy, but will settle down and cuddle while watching TV with you. She LOVES squeaky toys, tennis balls, and treat puzzles. She loves nothing more than hanging out with her humans but does well in a kennel or alone in the house while gone. She couldn't care less about thunderstorms or fireworks. 

If you are considering adoption please submit an application at www.hhfrescue.org

Our Snickers would love a home of his own. He loves his people more than anything. At first he can be a little wary of new people and new places and he needs time to warm up. His foster family is working on increasing his confidence and exposing him to new things.

Snickers is good with other dogs and dog-savvy cats. He will need a patient home with a family who can help him through his nervousness but after that initial short period you will have a dedicated and loving life long companion.

Snickers - 21 pounds of love wrapped in a super cute little body. He is neutered, housebroken, up to date on all his shots, heartworm negative and on monthly heartworm medication, and crate trained.

Snickers was born in a foster home on March 28, 2023.

Interested in learning more about fostering to adopt Snickers? Simply fill out an application at www.helporphanpuppies.org and tell them you want to meet Snickers.

Please note that our adoption requirements are noted on our website.

Help Orphan Puppies is registered with the New York State Department of Agriculture and our registration number is RR047.

breeds_label: Labrador Retriever & Black Mouth Cur Mix
description:
Meet our special little girl Jackie!  Jackie came to us after being caught in a trap.  She clearly did not have the best start in life.  Jackie is a shy girl who loves her person and all other dogs.  She is a hesitant with new people but with time (and treats!) she comes out of her shell. 

Jackie would do best in a quiet home without many people coming and going.  She would do best in a home with other dogs as this is how she learns to trust her people.  

Jackie is crate trained and house broken. She is up to date on vaccines, spayed, heartworm negative, on monthly heartworm medication, and microchipped.

Jackie is about a year old.  

Jackie is considered special needs due to her fear / shyness. Given this, we will only place Jackie in a home with another confident dog or a home without another dog but an adopter who has extensive time to spend with her and continue to help her develop and gain confidence. Jackie would not do well in a busy home or a home with younger children.

If you are interested in meeting Jackie, the first step is to complete an application at our website, www.helporphanpuppies.org. Please note that our adoption requirements are noted on our website.

Help Orphan Puppies is registered with the New York State Department of Agriculture and our registration number is RR047.

good_with.other_animals: Cats and other animals can be assessed at the home visit.

description:
Meet our Kennedy!  Kennedy is a beautiful lab mix who appears almost purebred.  Like most labs, Kennedy loves balls, water and other dogs.  Our Kennedy is a shy girl and will need a special home.

Kennedy is crate trained, housebroken, spayed, and up to date on vaccines.

Kennedy is special needs given her shyness.  Given this, we will only place Kennedy in a home with another confident dog or an adopter that has time to continue to work with her.  

If you are interested in meeting Kennedy, the first step is to complete an application at our website, www.helporphanpuppies.org. Please note that our adoption requirements are noted on our website.

NOTE:  given her special needs, Kennedy is seeking a home within 30 minutes of Ballston Spa, New York.  This is so that her foster mom can work with Kennedy’s adopter. 

Help Orphan Puppies is registered with the New York State Department of Agriculture and our registration number is RR047.

good_with.other_animals: Can be assessed at the home visit.

description:
Our super handsome Charlie is the spitting image of his mom, Ella. We believe we can watch the freckles develop on his beautiful face.

Charlie is an extremely shy boy, almost feral, who will need a home that has the time to dedicate to him. He will need another confident dog in the home so that he can learn how to be more confident. He loves his people but needs time to adjust. Given this, Charlie will do best in a quieter home that has the time to dedicate to his continued exposure and training. In turn, you will be rewarded with the sweetest most loving puppy. Charlie would do best with no children or older children.

Charlie is housebroken, crate trained, neutered and up to date on vaccines.

Charlie's date of birth is 8/24/19.

If you are interested in meeting Charlie, the first step is to complete an application at our website, www.helporphanpuppies.org. Please note that our adoption requirements are noted on our website.

Help Orphan Puppies is registered with the New York State Department of Agriculture and our registration number is RR047

good_with.other_animals: Can be assessed at home visit.

description:
Meet our Dani!  This sweet girl was rescued locally.  Dani is an abuse case and has several injuries, including multiple upper and lower jaw fractures as well as a fracture to one of the bones in her left ear that assists with hearing.  Dani underwent weekly procedures for about 6 months and several surgeries and is now healed.  Unfortunately given the severity of the abuse, Dani will never appear normal but don't tell her that!  

Due to the abuse, Dani suffers from Microcephaly.  Dani also has severe separation anxiety/stress induced anxiety.  We have seen numerous specialists for this and Dani has been on multiple prescription medication but unfortunately none of these have assisted.  We believe that much of this is due to her brain injury.  

Despite all that she has been through, Dani is simply the happiest dog!  She does not know a stranger, 2 legged or 4 legged!  In typical lab fashion, she is an active girl but not overly active!   

Dani has earned her CGC, TDI, and CGCA titles.  

Dani cannot be crated.  She is about 90% housebroken but will have accidents once she is stressed and she will spin in her accidents.   

If you are interested in meeting Dani, please complete an application at our website, www.helporphanpuppies.org.  Please note our adoption requirements and feel free to contact us with any questions.  Thank you.

Please note:  All of our dogs are fostered locally a minimum of 2 weeks.  Adopting a dog that has been fostered locally is a very important consideration. Animals that are fostered locally in private homes allow the fosters to learn more about the dogs personality and allows for making the best match possible.  Also, animals that are transported into our area and placed directly often carry diseases, including parvo and distemper.  Animals can also become ill on transports to the northeast, as they are exposed to other animals in route.  If you have any questions regarding these diseases and the risks of not adopting locally, please contact your vet.  

Also consider any group that does not require a home visit.  If they are not conducting a home visit consider if they are vested in where their animals go.  As an organization, we invest a significant amount of time into all of our dogs, including crate training, house breaking, obedience training, and determining each dog's personality to consider making the best match possible.

Help Orphan Puppies is registered with the New York State Department of Agriculture and Markets. Our Rescue Registration Number is RR047.

Please note that Petfinder requires us to identify a breed/breeds.  We do our best to determine a puppy's breed but without both parents present, we are unable to guarantee a puppy's breed.

Min Pin,
male,
8 years,
17 lbs.
Pirate is a very endearing dog. Just do not call him cute, he has the spirit of a Doberman packed into a Min Pin body and wants you to respect his authority. His life work is to keep his home safe. Pirate loves to let you know when someone rings the doorbell, even if the doorbell is on the TV, and even if he is not always the first dog to notice, he is always the most enthusiastic. Pirate enjoys quick patrols of the yard to see what has changed, and do some sniffing, then it is back in the house to see if the food dishes got magically refilled while he was out, and then do some serious napping. Pirate loves a routine, and he loves his bed. He will sometimes join you on the couch and nestle near you. He is not a big snuggler but he does like gentle scratches on his chin and ear rubs, as long as he is in the mood. At night he prefers sleeping on the couch and keeping the house safe while you sleep. Pirate is a unique dog with some unique behaviors. He had a stroke when he was younger which left him with some ataxia and vision differences, along with sensory issues, and some anxiety. Touch can be overwhelming, new surfaces take some figuring out, and a lot of sound or activity will really overwhelm him. He does not like being jostled or bumped into, and being picked up is too much for him, we do not suggest it. This means you have to make some accommodations, like transporting him in his carrier, and letting him decide when it is time for affection. Pirate cannot do stairs but can navigate ramps and can jump on the couch like a pro as long as he has solid footing. Pirate does not do well on walks because you can never be sure when he will be overloaded by his environment, so a fenced yard is necessary. Pirate can handle a quiet visitor or two, as long as they respect his rules and boundaries, and he will quickly make friends with people who know that you should ask before you pet, especially if you bring treats. Pirate is house trained but he tends to go on a schedule, and if he needs to go he needs to go. He does his best to use the pee pad if no one is around to let him out but no one is perfect. Pirate lives with other dogs and cats, and is always polite but not looking to play or really interact with them. He likes to be left out of their games, although he is a champion at the Kong Wobbler.

*************************************************************************
 
Due to Massachusetts State Regulations we are unable to adopt to residents of Massachusetts at this time. We apologize for any inconvenience.
 
 ** If you are interested in adopting this dog, you must first complete an adoption application at https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/PEP/Dog/. Or visit our site (http://peppertree.org/category/available-for-adoption/) and learn about other Peppertree dogs. *Note: visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of the dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each dog as an individual and will do our best to describe each of our dogs based on personality, not by breed label.

URGENT - Need Adopter ASAP! 

Meet Uncle Jesse! 

This stunningly handsome German Shepherd found himself in an overcrowded shelter in TX, through no fault of his own.  

Uncle Jesse is a senior boy, who should never have been dumped at all, let alone for being older.  And he only has one eye, why do you need two anyway?!!  

Who wants an old guy with one seeing eye, right?!!  So of course, he was put on the euthanasia list ........ 
We could not let that happen to him.  Our rescue saved this senior boy minutes from being euthanised in order to free up kennel space. 

He is in a loving foster home just now but it's a busy house, with too many people, kids, dogs etc, he isn't getting the peace, quiet, and attention he really needs.

This precious guy just needs to live in a warm, loving home, with grass to romp around in from time to time, to feel the sun on his face and watch all nature around him.

And of course, in true GSD style, to be with his people.  

Uncle Jesse is fine with other dogs but we feel at this time in his life, he deserves to have all the attention in a home.  Unless there's another older quiet pup whom he could snuggle with if he so desires.

If you are interested in loving this precious boy or the rest of his days, please contact Anne-Marie on 919 608 9314 ASAP.

CB

description: Bishop came to Dessin, very undersocialized and fearful. He continues to improve  with staff and volunteers who spend quality time with him.  He easily wears a harness, and is getting used to walking on a leash. He still needs more training and confidence but seems to be an eager student!
age 1 1/2

Here is Bodine’s bio for cross posting

Howl-dy-ho folks! Bodacious Bodine here letting you know I am officially looking for my own home, sweet, home.

Just over a year ago, I was found hiding, sick with infections, loaded with parasites and autoimmune issues. My handsome face was raw, as were my feet, elbows and back end. Everyone thought my days were numbered, but that didn’t matter to The Animal Support Project. Even while I was in pain, they could tell I was a loving boy with a strong will to live, and they were determined to give me the best days they could before I moved on to the happy hunting ground in the sky. But yeehaw! Instead we discovered the root cause of my health problems was just allergies, and they are now under control. I hear modesty is an affliction some dogs suffer from, but not this joyful, gregarious “life-is-a-party” hound. Can you believe how great I look now? Those days are just a distant memory because I am doing fantastic - living large and lovin’ life!

I am a sincere, intelligent, eager-to-please kind of guy, but like all pups I blossom with a kind but firm, consistent human partner. I can show you how hard a dog will try to learn and do his best with positive reenforcement. In fact, as proof, I recently passed my Canine Good Citizen exam!

I have been told I have an endearing personality, and continuously win people over with my charm! I do adore attention and don’t always grasp the concept of personal space, but a gentle reminder, maybe with a bonus butt scratch, brings me right back to being a gentleman. I am definitely not a subdued city boy and need a country home where I promise to excel at fenced perimeter patrol. I am a scent hound so will be happy to alert, chase and tree any marauding varmints. If you stroll over to take a look and tell me what a “good job” I’ve done protecting my homestead, I will be so proud to have completed my mission, I will just want to hang out with you again.

Pack breeds like me are very social. I do not enjoy being separated from the rest of the household. I love all people, whether friend or stranger. I am young and still excitable though, and can occasionally be jumpy or mouthy, so I need a home with older children. I also am an exuberant player so would do best with another uninhibited dog, although I have done well adapting my play style to suit the smaller, older dogs in my foster home. I do not do well in a crate but I do respect gates and am also fine being left loose in the house. I will just enjoy a well-deserved siesta loyally waiting until my family comes back home.

I am quite a speedy fellow and can run like the wind if tempted by the right scent. I also am not road savvy because my head is usually down - due to my nose insisting on some serious ground sniffing. Therefore, I require a 4-6 foot sturdy fence because like most hounds, I also have wanderlust. That could be how I got lost in the first place and I never want to be that sore and sick again.

Do you savor in nature's glory like me? Like long walks or hikes? Like to play outside or snuggle on the couch? Do you have allergies or know someone who does and understand their significance? Want to love this good, ol’ hound boy forever? Contact The Animal Support Project to see if we would be a good match. http://www.theanimalsupportproject.com/contact-forms/ Thanks for listening y’all!

Bubbles is looking for a forever home where she can be the center of her family’s attention and get lots of love.

Bubbles needs to have strong, durable chew toys. Bubbles will tear plush toys apart within minutes.

Bubbles is currently being treated for skin issues with medicated baths. Bubbles will be scheduled for mammary mass removal and spay surgery. Simple surgery that the rescue pays for.

Bubbles is a compact snuggle bug who loves attention. Her history is unknown, as she was found tied to a tree in a park in NYC. Bubbles then found herself on the euthanasia list, and became my foster. She will “smile” and wiggle when she is happy. Bubbles loves a warm bath and a peanut butter filled kong. Bubbles loves to wander around her fenced in yard, however, she does well on a leash as well. 

Bubbles knows the command “sit”, and is currently working on “down”, “shake”, and heeling. Bubbles loves all snackies including Dunkin munchkins. Bubbles loves to ride in the car. Bubbles does well in a crate, however, she may tear blankets up. 

While Bubbles has never had an issue with any people she has met, Bubbles does not appear to be a fan of other dogs.

breeds_label: German Shepherd Dog & Black Mouth Cur Mix
description:
3 year old Lobo is SO beautiful (pictures truly don't do him justice) and weighs about 60-70 pounds. He is well-behaved, very affectionate, and loves attention! He rarely barks and is house & crate trained, displaying good behavior both indoors and outdoors. He stops 2 feet from his crate and will sit and wait for his person to pet, kiss, hug him, and then he goes in his crate while he waits for his goodie! Such a sweetheart and loves his people! He sleeps peacefully in his crate at night and travels well in the car. Lobo does well with other dogs of different sizes and is very friendly with people! 

With a moderate activity level, Lobo enjoys walks of varying lengths. A fenced yard or active lifestyle is ideal for Lobo and he is not trained to be off-leash. Lobo responds to basic commands like sit, stay, come, heel (for leash walking), and off (for not jumping on people). Lobo is ready for a loving home to cherish and support him throughout his life. Could you give him a lifetime of love?

DISCLAIMER- Breed type is determined based on general appearance and behavioral characteristics and cannot be guaranteed unless DNA test results or AKC registration were provided at intake.

***LOBO IS IN NORTH TEXAS, BUT AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION AND TRANSPORT OUT OF STATE. Read below for more information.

breeds_label: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler & Carolina Dog Mix
description:
Meet Lindy, a charming 4-month-old female puppy with beautiful facial markings and adorable ears. Lindy is an absolute love bug who is currently in the process of house and crate training. She will bark to let you know when she needs to go out and is not destructive inside or outside. While she does bark because she’s a puppy, it’s not excessive and she can be easily redirected.

Lindy sleeps in her crate with her brother at night and is dog-friendly. We think she could be cat-friendly and would likely do well with kids, although she can be a bit jumpy, as puppies often are. Lindy loves to run and play, and she enjoys being held and snuggled.

We’re working on her leash training, and we believe she could make a great running or hiking partner as she gets older. Although she’s only been in the car once, she did great. Lindy is learning the commands “sit” and “stay,” and she loves treats, toys of all kinds, playing with her brother, and snuggles.

Lindy’s ideal home would be with an active family that has a fenced yard and someone to play with her. She likes to have someone around and enjoys cuddling, being allowed on the furniture, and showing her affectionate side. With her unique looks and loving personality, Lindy is ready to become a cherished member of a loving family.

Rowdy is in the process of house and crate training and already barks to let you know when he needs to go out. He's not destructive inside or outside, and while he does bark because he’s a puppy, it's not excessive and he can be easily redirected.

Rowdy sleeps in his crate with his sister Lindy at night and is dog-friendly. We think he could be cat-friendly and would likely do well with kids, although he can be a bit jumpy, as puppies often are. Rowdy loves to run and play, but he also enjoys being held and snuggled. 

We're currently working on his leash training, and we believe he’d make a great running or hiking partner as he gets older. Although he's only been in the car once, he did great. Rowdy is learning the commands “sit” and “stay,” and he loves treats, toys of all kinds, playing with his sister, and snuggles.

Rowdy's ideal home would have a fenced yard and someone to play with. He likes to have someone around a lot and enjoys cuddling, hanging out on the furniture, and showing his affectionate side. Rowdy is ready to become a cherished member of a loving family.

Meet Charlie, a 2-year-old American Staffordshire mix with a heart full of love and a spirit that remains unbroken. Weighing in at a perfect 43 pounds, Charlie is the ideal companion for someone looking for a loyal and affectionate friend.
Charlie’s story is one of resilience and unwavering sweetness. Left behind by his previous owners for a month when they moved, he never lost his gentle nature or his hope for a loving home. Despite his rough start, Charlie has shown nothing but pure love and trust to everyone he meets.

With a beautiful, soft white coat and big, soulful eyes, Charlie is not just a sight to behold but a joy to be around. His adorable demeanor and sweet personality make him the perfect cuddle buddy. He thrives on human interaction and is always ready to give and receive affection.

Charlie’s ideal home would be one where he can receive plenty of love and attention. Whether it's a game of fetch in the yard or a quiet evening snuggled on the couch, Charlie is happiest when he’s with his people. He’s great with kids and would make a wonderful addition to any family.

If you're looking for a loyal companion who will shower you with unconditional love, look no further than Charlie.

breeds_label: Labrador Retriever & Black Mouth Cur Mix
description:
Meet Zeke, a 3-year-old, 60 pound bundle of affection who will capture your heart. His joy comes from being close to his human, displaying both exuberant and cuddly moments. Zeke is house and crate trained, responsive to commands like sit & down, and a quick learner eager for treats. While well-behaved, he tends to jump when overly excited and requires ongoing guidance for manners. His favorite place is the couch with his head in your lap, all he wants is to be near his humans! 

Zeke gets along with other dogs and people, and we are unsure of how he does with cats. While likely good with kids, a home with kids over 10 is advised due to his size, as he enjoys running and jumping, potentially knocking over small children. He loves eating from his big Kong slow feeder bowl. We have worked on his manners and he is going great, but needs reminders. He is very smart, loves his kennel, toys, and treats. He is not food aggressive with his food toward humans or other dogs.

This playful pup loves chew toys. Harvey sleeps in his kennel at night and when home alone to prevent mischief. Enthusiastic about car rides, he remains curious and adventurous. He even enjoys days at doggy daycare! Rescued from a high-kill shelter in East Texas after his owner died & he was living on a chain 24/7, Zeke has transformed into a confident, happy, and sweet companion. An active household with another dog for him to play with, ideally a fenced yard, and perhaps someone to accompany him on runs, walks, and hikes would be amazing for Zeke. Apartment living would not suit his energetic nature. Zeke is ready for his furever home! 

DISCLAIMER- Breed type is determined based on general appearance and behavioral characteristics and cannot be guaranteed unless DNA test results or AKC registration were provided at intake.

breeds_label: Labrador Retriever & American Staffordshire Terrier Mix
description:
Meet Presley, an approximately 3-year-old companion who epitomizes the term "Velcro dog." Presley is in search of a warm and caring forever home where she can relish in moments of play, affectionate cuddles with her human or furry siblings, and rest easy without the fear of ever being let go, a fate she once experienced with her previous family.

Presley is a devotee of quality time with her human companions, and she adores her walks, exhibiting excellent behavior on the leash with people and not pulling much. She is house and crate trained, and knows the commands "sit," "stay," and "come."

In her foster home, she is cat friendly and displays a friendly attitude towards other dogs, even plays with the other dogs in the yard! She is not good with chickens, but she is good with tortoises lol! She is dominant, so her ideal future home would be with submissive dogs, as she thrives in an environment where she can take on the alpha role without conflict. Slow, proper introductions to other dogs and cats are crucial! She does constantly yearn to be by her human's side, but she has grown to truly enjoy being a part of the pack in her foster home and would do so in her forever home as well. While on a leash, Presley exhibits reactivity towards other dogs and animals; however, she responds well to redirection and can be easily guided.

We rescued Presley from a high-risk shelter in Texas just in the nick of time. She was on the brink of being euthanized due to space constraints, especially being the shelter's longest-standing resident. Her previous owners were contacted, but they showed no interest in reclaiming her or her Husky friend.

Presley's tale is one of resilience and unwavering loyalty. She longs for her forever family, a loving home where she can be cherished unconditionally. Is there anyone out there willing to provide Presley with the love and care she so rightfully deserves?

breeds_label: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler & Cattle Dog Mix
description:
Introducing Zara, a delightful one-year-old bundle of affection and unwavering devotion. Zara's journey began when we saved her from a high-kill shelter in Texas, narrowly escaping a grim fate. It's evident that someone may have treated her unkindly, as she initially displays timidity (cowers) around unfamiliar people, but she will also get on her back for belly rubs. With time, love, and a reassuring touch, Zara will blossom into the best version of herself. She has the prettiest coat and if you brush it the opposite way, you can see that her roots are red! 

In her nurturing foster home, Zara is flourishing, thanks to her work-at-home foster parents who provide ample human interaction and the attention she craves. She's a snuggling pro, always seeking reassurance and showering you with boundless love. While Zara prefers not to be confined in a kennel at any time, she is house trained and we think she will get used to a crate with some patience & positive reinforcement. She is very food motivated and eager to please. She's very well-mannered on leash and loves walks so much.. Those are her favorite! She dislikes being alone, so ideally her family will spend a lot of time at home or bring her places.

Zara would thrive in a home with submissive dogs or as the only dog, and slow introductions are crucial when meeting new dogs & settling into a new environment. She is NOT good with cats or other small animals due to her high prey drive, so her future home must not have any. It's important to note that she's best suited for a home with children over the age of 10 as she doesn't always realize her size. She will playfully nibble on you when she wants someone to pet her, which is a typical cattle dog trait. 

Zara needs to be in an environment where those around her understand and respect her boundaries as she continues to heal and learns to trust that she'll never experience harm again. When Zara knows and trusts you, she'll eagerly leap onto you, expressing her love through her endearing, expressive eyes and a hug.

Zara delights in a balanced blend of indoor and outdoor play and finds pure joy in basking in the warm sun. If you're in search of an affectionate and loyal companion perfectly suited to a work-from-home /retirement lifestyle or an active one where you’ll bring your dog with you all over, Zara is the ideal addition to your life.

Meet Ringo, the 1 year old Great Dane mix with a unique personality. He was found playing with kids at a school in Texas, but wound up on the euthanasia list for space at the local tiny high kill shelter that is chronically over capacity. He's mastered house training, but doesn't signal when he needs to go out, preferring a set routine. While he's getting used to crate training and enjoys relaxing in it during the day, he'd rather not be crated at night (needs it though).

Ringo isn't destructive as long as he's entertained and crated when alone. He alerts his people by barking when people come by, but he doesn’t bark much. He’s a good fit for households with other big dogs (or none) and older children as he doesn’t realize his size and can knock smaller kids over by accident. He truly does love kids and would love to be a part of a family with some. His energy level makes him an excellent companion for running, hiking, and long walks.

In terms of training, Ringo knows basic commands like Sit, Stay, No, and Release (when he’s allowed to start eating his food), & he is very food motivated. He's a very curious boy and needs mental stimulation, while preferring to be included rather than left alone.

He’s not a fan of cuddling yet (he may have never known that life)! He loves rubbing his head against people he likes. Sometimes when he gives you a head rub, his shoulder follows along with his back and it turns into a whole body rub from Ringo. While he doesn't require another dog at home, he does need a fenced yard as he enjoys wandering. Overall, Ringo thrives with human companionship and an active lifestyle.

breeds_label: Black and Tan Coonhound & Labrador Retriever Mix
description:
Tex, approximately 1 year old and 45-50 pounds, is a people-friendly pup who enjoys the company of kids, even as young as 9. He plays harmoniously with dogs of various ages and sizes, ranging from 1 to 11 years old and 30 to 125 pounds. While not particularly interested in the barn cat, his compatibility with household cats is uncertain. Accustomed to cattle and horses, he generally ignores them.

Overnight, he comfortably sleeps in his crate, displaying affection for it. Together with his brother, Ranger, they relish porch swing evenings, engaging in activities like chasing balls and wrestling. Tex understands basic commands but requires some leash and recall training, typical of a puppy. He is pretty motivated by treats, and he's a resilient survivor, rescued in Texas after being abandoned. Ideally, he and his brother find a home together, but separate adoptions are also possible. He’s anxiously awaiting transport from Texas to his furever or foster home up north!

breeds_label: Pit Bull Terrier & American Staffordshire Terrier Mix
description:
Meet Poe, a charming, smiley pup born around 1/25/22, rescued at 2 months from a Louisiana junkyard. Sadly, his family faced hardship, leading to homelessness. To avoid a high-kill shelter, a Texas foster stepped in as we seek his forever home. He is SO sweet, he just wants to cuddle with his people and give kisses! He is perfectly happy as long as he's next to his humans! 

Poe is both house and crate trained, though he pulls a bit on the leash due to his eagerness to explore (easy to fix). He's fantastic with dogs (even cuddles with them in the same dog bed), curious about cats, and adaptable as a single pet or with dog siblings. While good with children, we suggest kids ages 10 or older due to his playful nature and tendency to jump on you out of excitement. Poe is an active, sweet boy who adores bones, snuggling, and knows the command "sit." Plus, he's not bothered by a rumba vacuum—quite the lively and lovable companion! 

I mean... do you see that SMILE? Someone give this adorable, smiley boy his furever home, he so deserves it!

breeds_label: Labrador Retriever & Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler Mix
description:
Piper, an approximately 1 year old girl weighing 41 pounds, boasts adorable ears and a sweet, snuggly, and submissive demeanor. Despite some nervousness around vehicles and other animals during walks, she loves people, often crawling over to you and rolling over to reveal her belly. Piper is in the process of learning fetch, enjoys playing with other dogs, and doesn’t pay any mind to cats. We require Piper’s future home to have another dog as she learns from them and they help boost her confidence since she is shy at first. Adopter must have a fenced yard as well. She’s a bit more cautious around the cows at her foster home, lol!

She’s a bundle of fun energy, yet she equally enjoys climbing onto the couch to snuggle and watch TV with the family in the evenings. Piper is both kennel and potty trained and very smart with a desire to please! Her positive interactions with seven kids in her foster home ranging from ages 6 to 17 along with all of their friends without problems further highlight her suitability for family life. She’s an amazing addition to any home!!

Piper was rescued from a high kill shelter in rural north Texas along with her 2 sisters after their other 3 littermates were tragically euthanized for space the week before. She is so deserving of her forever home and we know her siblings that have passed will be so happy for her once she finds it!
