Chloe is an easy breezy beautiful cover girl.

Chloe is such a go with the flow kind of dog. She's just as content sitting on the sofa with you as she is going on walks, running  errands or meeting new fur friends. She has a very even-keeled personality. She is never too energetic or too lazy. She is really just a perfect balance of all the fun things that make up a dog!

Chloe is:
3 years old
40lbs (but definitely needs to gain some weight - probably about 5 lbs)
Healthy (spayed, HW-, up to date on vaccines)
Loves all people, including kids!
Dog friendly - loves to pal around with other playful dogs
Potty trained
Wonderful in her crate
Great on leash
Excellent in the car

Martini brings tini time all the time! When you are with her, you are guaranteed a good time.  This 35lb girl is so wiggly, friendly and affectionate. She can read the room really well and be calm when she needs to be calm and cuddly, or can be very playful, do zoomies around the yard and romp around with a fur pal, when it's time to play. 

Martini has never been upset a day in her life - she is such a happy go lucky girl who makes everyone fall in love with her the second that they meet her.

She was at the shelter for 30 days before we saved her and she was always a volunteer and staff favorite.

Her foster mama absolutely adores her and came to her at a tough time. She says Martini is exactly what she needed to get through. She is a true joy to have around and brings love and light everywhere she goes.

Martini is:
1 year old
35lbs
Friendly, cuddly, silly, playful
Very dog friendly
Kid friendly
Wonderful in her crate
Good on leash

Adopt Martini if you want to love, be loved, and laugh, every single day that you are with her. 

*Please note:
Our dogs are fostered and vetted in Houston before going on transport. If we don't have an adoption lined up in one of our transport cities within 4 weeks of rescue, we transport to our team in Vermont, where our dogs have a higher chance of finding their perfect forever home. Once you fill out an adoption application, it will be screened by our team. From there, if your application is a good fit, our team will arrange a call and schedule a meet and greet or we will arrange transport.

Sprout is ready to be your sidekick through life! This 35lb, 1 year old pocket staffie is the definition of fun! Sprout is sure to give you lots of laughs with his hilariously playful and absolutely adorable personality. He loves being around people and other dogs. He is playful and knows how to take cues from other dogs. He is very submissive upon first meeting dogs, regardless of size - from a 9lb poodle to a 95lb Great Dane. Sprout is just a tiny, fun loving guy. 

Sprout is :
1 year old 
35lbs
Dog and people friendly
Playful, silly
Loves giving kisses
Great in the car
Not cat or kid tested
Potty trained
Neutered and up to date on all vaccines

Meet Pearl aka Miss Perfect.

This girl is not only incredibly good looking but she is fiercely loyal, very smart, athletic and affectionate.

Pearl loves everyone and everything. There is not a mean bone in her body. She is just so happy to be here and wants to tag along all of your adventures. She would love to be your sidekick from hanging on the sofa to going on a hike to swimming in a lake. 


Pearl is:
1.5 years old
50lbs
Dog and people friendly
Good with dog savvy cats
Loyal, Affectionate, Playful, Smart, Athletic
Good on leash
Sleeps in her crate without a peep through the night
Good in the car
Potty trained and knows how to use a dog door

Col. Potter Cairn Terrier Rescue
www.cairnrescue.comMeet Ruffian. He is a very friendly, happy, loving, cuddly boy. He loves to chew so he needs lots of chewy toys. He sleeps in bed with his person and loves to curl up right behind your knees. He wants to be with his person as much as possible but when you go out if he gets a treat or a chewy with a little peanut butter, he will be happy. He will sometimes even go in his crate on his own. He loves to go for walks, but likes to pull on leash. He is dog friendly when around resident dogs, but gets overly excited when he sees another dog while on leash. He needs to be trained and needs someone who is willing to spend time and effort to train him. He is currently wearing a belly band; he keeps it dry at night and when crated. I feel this sweet loveable boy will make someone a wonderful pet if they are willing to take the time needed for training. In other words, ruffian has great potential.FOR LOTS MORE INFORMATION ON RUFFIAN ENTER OR COPY THIS LINK ONTO YOUR WEB BROWSER:https://www.cairnrescue.com/store/dogs/

**** FOSTER HOMES NEEDED! ****
YOU can make a huge difference by fostering just one dog. ONE dog, ONE time a year = ONE life that could be saved! Each and everyday we have the opportunity to save more Cairns in need, but we can't do it if we don't have the Foster Homes to place them in. Would you like to learn more on how you can help? 'Saving just one dog won't change the world, but it surely will change the world for that one dog.' 6/8/24 12:45 PM

Scarlett is a rescued husky mix from Southern California and has traveled to upstate New York looking to find her forever home! She is playful, energetic and loving towards new people and dogs. Scarlett is crate trained, walks well on a leash, rides well in a car and loves to explore on new adventures. Scarlett is very petite and small for her breed. She has adjusted to the rescue's routine easily and is anxious to find her forever home! Please consider adopting little Scarlett!

Sonny is a rescued Doberman Pinscher from a high kill shelter in southern California and has traveled to upstate New York to find his forever loving home! Sonny is house trained and crate trained, he know basic commands and walks well on a leash! Sonny does well meeting new people and playing with the other dogs at the rescue. Sonny loves to play outside, go for walks and play with his toys. He would do best in a home with a routine and active environment. Sonny is a smart boy and has a great temperament! Please consider adopting Sonny!

Carson is a beautiful white German Shepherd dog looking for his forever home. He has been rescued from a high kill shelter in southern California and traveled to upstate New York to find his forever home. He has a calm demeanor and very sweet. Carson walks very well on a leash, loves to go swimming, enjoys car rides and going to pet friendly stores. He plays very well with other dogs. He is crate trained and house broken. Carson needs an owner who is patient with him and introducing him to new people or new situations. Carson likes to relax and have the same routine, he would do very well in a home with stability. Carson has been through a lot of changes this past year and he still is very calm, kind mannerisms. Please consider adopting Carson and giving him his forever loving home!

Nikita is a beautiful husky looking to find a loving home. Nikita is a rescue dog from California and has traveled to upstate NY.  Nikita is playful, sweet and sociable with new people and dogs. She loves running, playing with her toys and being by your  side. She has an affectionate personality and is  a great family dog. Nikita is house trained, and good with children. Nikita also Does not mind baths and loves to talk while brushing her beautiful coat. Please consider adopting Nikita as this will be her first winter in 2024- 2025 and will absolutely love it as she is a husky. We are excited for Nikita to find the right home for here in NY!

Cassidy is a young energetic sweet girl. She is a rescue dog from California and has travelled to upstate New York in hopes to find her forever home! Cassidy plays well with other dogs, loves to meet new people and loves car rides. Cassidy's demeanor is calm but when she is around other dogs or new people she loves to play! She loves her toys and will even bring them on all her walks. Cassidy is interested in everything new she is introduced to, but with treats and consistent commands she is redirected easily. Cassidy is versatile, she loves being inside relaxing but also loves her playtime and walks. Please consider adding Cassidy as a new family member if she sounds like a good fit!

Charlie is a rescue boxer mix from California. Charlie has travelled to upstate New York looking for his forever home! Charlie was an owner surrender in California as they stated "they did not have time for him" New York is very new to Charlie, he takes everything in slowly and warms up to each situation at his pace. Charlie is very calm in a calm environment. Charlie would prefer a quiet environment, a lot of noise will make him nervous. Charlie blooms when he does get attention and lots of love, he needs slow introductions to new people and new dogs after proper introductions he is sociable. He is noted to love his relaxing time in his home and be by your side on walks or at home.  Charlie is a shelter boy that has overcame many fears. Charlie will be a great companion to any individual willing to provide love and patience. 
Update; 6/27/2024
Charlie is still at the rescue and waits patiently for his forever home, He has been at Jack's Dog Haven since February 2024. Please consider giving Charlie a forever home!
Update;7/23/2024
Charlie is doing great with socializing with all the new dogs, he is familiar with his routine at the rescue and is loving his walks everyday. Charlie also loves to relax in the sun! Charlie is truly a great boy and still is a calm boy with all the changes and new faces around him at the rescue. He is also getting excited when new people come to visit at the rescue for meet and greets for other dogs, Charlie begs to get attention and pets with all new faces now! This is a big step for Charlie as he once needed slow introductions!
He still waits patiently to find his forever home!

Remi is a sweet Belgian, heeler mix! Remi was rescued from a high kill shelter in Lancaster CA and transported to NY with her litter in January 2024. She has been waiting for her forever home since January! Remi has a very loving, playful, sweet and confident personality. Remi plays very well with all the dogs at the rescue and loves to meet new people! Remi loves to go for walks, swim and play with all her toys! Remi would make a great hiking or running buddy, she loves to go on adventures and run through the woods! Remi is also a very obedient girl, she has picked up on all her basic commands and is crate trained and potty trained. Remi is also trained on and off leash, she knows her recall. Remi is a wonderful playful young girl looking for a home environment that could match her boisterous personality. 
Please consider adopting sweet Remi as she has been growing up at the rescue!

breeds_label: German Shepherd Dog & Black Labrador Retriever Mix
description:
Natalia is a rescue dog from a high kill shelter out of southern California and was rescued by Jack's Dog Haven. She has travelled to upstate New York to find her forever home! She is estimated to be between four and five years old. She is a very calm dog. Natalia walks well on a leash. She is sociable meeting new people and needs to be introduced to other dogs slowly. Natalia would do very well in a home without other dogs but does tolerate sharing the attention. Natalia currently plays well with all other dogs at the rescue but loves one on one attention. She does well with a bath and rides well in a car. Natalia is a very quiet dog and listens to basic commands. Please consider giving her a forever home!
Update 6/27/2024; Natalia still waits patiently for her forever home, she is so kind to everyone she meets. Natalia has been waiting since March 2024, Please consider adopting Miss Natalia as she would make an excellent companion.
Update 7/23/2024; Natalia still awaits her forever home. Please consider adopting Miss Natalia, she is truly a sweet girl!

Hi! My name is Luna! I'm about 1.5 years old and I'm a total mix of different dogs plus I'm part Kangaroo. I love to hop all the time! I'm a super sweet girl who loves to play and go for walks. I'm still young so I have a bit to learn! Interested in meeting me? Put in an application!

Hi! My name is Kiara! I'm a 2 year old Pitbull mix but some people like to say that I'm part Hippo! I am a gentle giant who loves to go for walks, and play with my best friend Amara! I would love to be able to find a home with her as we are bonded. Interested in meeting me? Put in an application!

Hi! My name is Amara! I am a big 1 year old Pitbull mix! I am a strong girl who loves to play tug of war as you can tell by my picture! I am young so I am currently still learning things but let me tell you I am super smart and catch on relatively quick! I do like other dogs especially my best friend Kiara, I would love to be able to go into a home with her because we are bonded! Interested in meeting me? Put in an application!
I am bonded with my brother Rolley!
I am bonded with my Brother Polley!

Hi! My name is Hank! I'm a 5-year-old Pitbull Mix! I love going for walks! I am a bit strong but that's alright because I am a huge goof ball on top of it! I love to run around and play outside in the nice warm sun and grass! I really like tug of war and fetch as well! Interested in me? Put in an application!

Hi! My name is Cleo! I'm a beautiful 2-year-old Pitbull mix! I love when all the attention is on me! I love to go for walks, be pampered, lounge in the warm summer sun, and play. I am looking for my own home to call my own! Interested in me? Put in an application!

Hi! My name is Rosie! I'm a sweet 2yr old pitbull mix! I absolutely love going outside to play and lounge about in the warm sun! Getting attention from people is one of my favorite things to do! I am a loving girl who is just looking for her own furever home.

Hi! My name is Checkers! I am a 3 year old Pitbull mix. I am a sweet girl who just loves to get attention and go for walks. I have a few scars on me from my time as a stray but don't let that deter you from me! I am very sweet and need my own furever home! Interested in me? Put in an application!

Pepper has vision. He would prefer to be the only dog. Loves people and cuddling, velcro and will follow you everywhere.

Meet Pepper!

Pepper was surrendered to a shelter at 13 years old. His history prior to that is unknown. He was saved from the shelter by a local organization who also started his vetting, and he came to us about two weeks later. In spite of all this, Pepper is quite a character! He has a lot of personality, definitely knows what he wants and doesn't want, and will let you know.

And what he wants is this ...

Pepper feels he has one very important job, and more than anything, he wants to do his job well. That job is to be. with. you. No matter where you are, day or night, Pepper wants to be with you, and he will love you with everything he has in his little 8 pound body. If he is not with you, he will not hesitate to let you know how upset he is. He's a great cuddler and would spend the entire day cuddling in my lap if he could. He would love to keep you warm on those cool fall and winter days!

Shortly after arriving at his foster home, Pepper had an urgent dental (20 teeth were extracted, he has six bottom teeth remaining and will need to eat soft food for the rest of his life), was neutered, saw the ophthalmologist (he has nuclear sclerosis in both eyes and a healed corneal ulcer in his right eye), and was diagnosed with hypothyroidism (underactive thyroid), for which he takes Levothyroxine twice a day. He will need to have regular blood work to monitor his thyroid. Two lumps removed from his forehead were apocrine gland cysts and completely benign. He is nicely managed on pain medication and a joint supplement for arthritis and bilateral luxating patellas, and even runs everywhere! He's also attempted, with some success, to climb over baby gates. Pepper goes through phases where he drinks and urinates quite a bit more than usual, but testing so far has not shown a cause. Housebreaking continues to be a slow work in progress and he is unable to go through the night without urinating.

Pepper is fine with the other three dogs in his foster home, but is jealous and upset if he is not getting all of the attention. The other three dogs here are timid and small like he is, and if one is where Pepper wants to be, he will just lay down on top of that dog.

Pepper would prefer a home where someone is home most of the time and where he could be your only dog, or with only one other quiet small dog. Due to his size, a home without young children is recommended, and he will also require an understanding owner who is able to carefully monitor any changes in his appetite, behavior, or pottying.

Pepper reminds me of a used car. He's a bit banged up, scratched, and is missing paint in some areas, but with lots of love and good maintenance, he'll keep going and going and going! :)
BDRA has voted against the use of electrical fencing effective immediately.

Hello! My name is Loki! I came into the City of Rome Dog Control along with my brother as a stray. Our previous owner doesn't want us back unfortunately so we were never reclaimed. I am very playful, and love my brother Loki, but I can go into a home with or without him. I am about 6 months old, and not neutered, but will be vaccinated. If you are interested in meeting me, call (315) 337-6260!

Hello! My name is Thor! I came into the City of Rome Dog Control along with my brother as a stray. Our previous owner doesn't want us back unfortunately so we were never reclaimed. I am very playful, and love my brother Loki, but I can go into a home with or without him. I am about 6 months old, and not neutered, but will be vaccinated. If you are interested in meeting me, call (315) 337-6260!

Meet Scrappy, a sweet boy with a big heart and a love for life! Scrappy is a friendly and playful pooch. He loves to play, run around, and explore, but he also knows when it's time to settle down and cuddle up. Scrappy is an affectionate pup who loves to shower his human friends with kisses and snuggles. If you're looking for a fun-loving and affectionate companion, Scrappy is the perfect fit! Scrappy is a dog with a lot of love to give, and he is just waiting for the right person to come along and give him a chance. Could that person be you? Give our office a call! (315) 337-6260

Hello, my name is Kendrick!
I came to Dog Control as a stray much like the other dogs at their facility. I was never reclaimed, and I desperately want a home with a couch to snuggle my new human on! I know sit, and shake. I don't seem interested in toys/I don't know what to do with them really! Except some nylon toys. If you would like to meet me, please call (315) 337-6260

Bindie is a friendly and affectionate girl. She is athletic, playful and smart. Bindie is an incredibly sweet girl who loves to be around people and receive lots of affection and attention. She can be a little shy at first, but quickly warms up to people once she gets to know them. Unfortunately, Bindie has come in as a stray and was never reclaimed. We are unsure if she is friendly with other dogs, so a meet and greet will be required. She is an absolute sweetie who would love to meet you, so give our office a call! (315) 337-6260

Hi there! My name is Tank, and I am a very affectionate, smart and playful boy. Tank came to us because his owner could no longer care for him. I am an active boy who loves to play, and would be the perfect companion for someone who is looking for an adventurous friend, or even a couch potato! I am great with other dogs, cats, and children! If you're looking for a fun and loving furry friend, I'm the perfect boy for you!

Hello, my name is Brownie! I was turned in by my owner as a stray unfortunately.  I have been at the City of Rome Dog Control now for 7 months now! I am so very sweet and love to cuddle. I am dog selective and currently unspayed.  I am house trained and know my basic commands.  I would love a permanent home and a comfy couch to lay on! If you would be interested in meeting me, please call (315) 337-6260

Mona Lisa has a sad past, but her smile still shines through.  

She was picked up as a stray along the Texas / Mexico border where she was found defeated and laying in the grass.  She was brought into the shelter system only to be just another sad pittie, lost in the mix.   It took a special person who shared her story which allowed us to rescue her. 

Fast forward, Mona Lisa is adoption ready.   She is a petite pittie, around 45lbs, 4 years old and extremely affectionate and gentle.  Mona Lisa was temporarily fostered by a family who had small children and she was very gentle with them;  after all pit bulls are known to be "the nanny dog".  They have the reputation for being a guardian angel of children. 

Mona Lisa is healthy, up to date on vaccines, walks well on leash, has good manners in the home - housebroken, crate trained and does not chew - and loves to cuddle and give kisses.   

As soft and affectionate she is with people, Mona Lisa does not enjoy the company of other dogs and we have no been able to cat test her.  We recommend she be your one and only pet.  She has enough love to go around! 

She would benefit from a home with a yard to run, play and enjoy the sunshine!   

If you are interested in giving Mona Lisa her second chance at an amazing life, please complete an adoption application on our website: www.RTHRS.com

If ever a dog couldn't catch a break it's poor Chase.  In his short life, Chase has been bounced around so many times now we have lost count, and through no fault of his own.  Chase was adopted out to an older couple a few months ago who fell in love with him and now that he has gotten comfortable with them they have decided he is too strong for them and due to medical issues cannot handle him.

Chase is about 1 1/2 years old, Male, Neutered, UTD, and about 50-55 lbs.  He had to have one of his eyes removed due to being scratched by a cat and it got infected but that doesn't stop this sweet boy or impair him in any way.  Chase is loving , sweet, affectionate, and playful.  And albeit he is fine with kids because he is still young and has a lot of energy we would recommend kids over 12.  Also, because he is a hound mix he has a high prey drive so no cats and if you have another dog we are recommending a dog of the same size or larger since he doesn't know his own strength and a meet and greet would be required.  

Poor Chase deserves a chance at a real home and real love and someone who will not give up on him because he is young and energetic.  To give this sweet boy the forever home he longs for please go to our site at www.rthrs.com to complete an application.

Chase is currently in Oswego, NY and is available in NY/NJ/PA.

It takes a special kind of person to adopt 2 rescued pups at once. 2 dogs who've been shuffled around in homes, shelters and boarding all because they became inconvenient.
It takes a big heart to see past their age and unknown circumstances or breeds and to say yes to giving them a home because they need one and they deserve one.
Caesar and Pierce are a bonded pair. We don't know why, we don't know how, but we know that when one has to go to a vet visit, the other waits for their return home. We know that Pierce can be away from Caesar for an hour but when he gets home, he greets him like he's been away for weeks. 
There's no reason to separate these 2, to do so wouldn't be fair for all the unfairness they've already lived.
Caesar is a 9-year-old, old man. He loves sunbathing and scratches. He'll weave in and out of your legs with his big ol' 67lb frame like a cat trying to get pets at all angles. He's definitely a Pittie mix and he loves his people and his dogs. He is a surrogate big brother to 27lb Pierce who compliments his big buddy so well with his playful energy and love of all toys -squeaky or not. 
2-year-old Pierce looks to Caesar for a boost of confidence. He's on the shyer side of the 2 and although he loves his people, he appreciates a slow introduction so he can take time to sniff and process. Pierce is a Heinz 57 and as much as we'd like to guess his breeds, we'd be lying to you if we did. 
Caesar is described as confident, obedient, sensitive and kind. He loves his car rides and naps on the couch. He's king of chill and doesn't let much ruffle his feathers other than cats.... for this reason, we look forward to a feline-free zone where both of these boys can live out their days without a care in the world and the security of knowing that this is forever.
Both of these boys will fill your home with love, loyalty and warmth. They sleep soundly (together) in their crates at night and appreciate a game of fetch in the grass or a leashed walk.

Pierce and Caesar are currently living in San Antonio but are available to adopt to the Northeast. For more information about these 2 and to speak with their foster, please fill out an application here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdlci8BVgANrWAlqe9wb2WjsDzcQyK0Jag0Sb-ZFSmFtWMy8A/viewform

Tucker is a hilarious, friendly, and very affectionate young dog who loves to play, but is also good at taking time to relax and chew on a bone. He is Shy at first but warms up and is the best listener and loves to be included in all the fun - whether it's playing with other dogs, going on walks, or just hanging out with his human friends. If you're looking for a funny, loyal, and playful new companion, look no further than Tucker!  Tucker is a young dog and does not have any known allergies or medical issues. He is up to date on all of his shots and is ready to find his forever home!


All of our animals are examined by a veterinarian, given age-appropriate vaccinations, de-wormed, microchipped, spayed or neutered, heart-worm tested, and treated if necessary. 

Vet references and a home/family visit are required, and an adoption fee applies. 

Transport options are available within our area of operation, including Pennsylvania, the tri-state area, and New England. Please note we do not adopt animals into Canada.

Visit www.pmarinc.org for more information, and to fill out an application.

He is a sweet and goofy boy, whose idea of a perfect day is one where he can patrol the backyard, get pet, brushed, and take a long nap. True to the nature of his breed, he likes to protect his people on walks from trucks, buses, motorcycles, bicycles, and other dogs when he’s on the leash. When off leash he does well with other dogs, though he’s more often interested in observing than interacting. 

He adores meeting new people (more people equals more pets) and although he tolerates children, they tend to be too energetic for him so he prefers to avoid them. 

While not particularly food-motivated, he still loves treats, peanut butter, and cheese. Though laid back and napping for 95% of the day, he can get riled up when he notices something to bark at, and if he’s let out into the yard, tries to avoid coming inside by running around and trying to play with you. He thinks it is a fun game!  He would do best in a calmer home where he gets all of the attention as the only pet to get all your love!

Meet lap-puppy Piper! Piper is an amazingly sweet puppy who absolutely loves to be held like a baby! She is incredibly mild tempered and playful. She loves to run around and play but then likes her downtime by settling down and cuddling with her favorite people, which is just about everyone! Piper is searching for a family to call her own. Piper has been fully vetted: she has been spayed, fully vaccinated, dewormed, microchipped, and up to date on preventatives. Piper is completely ready to find her family just in time for the holidays. If you'd like to meet Piper and/or find out more information about the adoption process, please send an email to adoptions@thenokillproject.org.

Please give me a chance.  Attention All you Pittie lovers! This handsome pooch is Mac very sweet & gentle, he’s a big softy /marshmallow is looking for a new home. Mac is 2 years old, 70 pounds of companionship and a good friend. Every ounce filled with sweetness!!

Mac's adoption fee is sponsored his adoption fee will be paid as a generous gesture by a rescue group.

His breed is a best guess, Terrier mix. He's a wonderful, well-mannered affectionate dog who has known only love in his life with a sweet personality loves everyone he meets, outgoing, playful, lots of energy. He gets along well with other dogs. Mac is crate trained, he enjoys the company of older children, sits for treats. He is on his way to mastering the potty-training concept.

Mac was a stray looking for a friendly face, thirsty & hungry. He is now in foster care with a loving family waiting for you. Mac loves a good serious belly rub. He loves his humans.

Mac’s adoption donation is Sponsored! He is current on vaccinations; monthly flea and tick and heartworm preventative. He has been microchipped and neutered. All this sweet boy needs are a kind, caring home where he can hang his leash forever. If you love the pittie breeds, you will fall in love with Mac. He's waiting for you his doggy bags are packed and ready to make the journey home! Please email rubsch@sbcglobal.net for an application.

Vera is the sweetest girl With her gentle, calm, and loving nature, Vera is the perfect companion for cozy nights in. But don't let her mellow side fool you—Vera loves her walks and playful moments too! 
Come meet Vera, and let her sweet personality steal your heart. She's ready to find her forever home! 
Visit our website for an application www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Nuni is around 8 months old and adores people of all ages. He's a social butterfly, always ready for a game of fetch or a snuggle session. He gets along very well with other dogs and can even live happily with cats! If you're looking for a sweet and playful companion to brighten your days, Nuni is the perfect match for you. Visit our website for an application to meet him! www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Meet Panda!  This adorable 10 month old pup is the epitome of friendliness! Panda loves nothing more than making new friends - whether they walk on two legs or four! This cutie is always excited to meet new humans and dogs. She’s a playful little girl with a heart full of love. Panda even knows how to have a good time with our feline friends! This cutie also loves to play with toys. If you're looking for a furry companion who will bring endless joy and laughter into your life, look no further than Panda! If you are interested in meeting this sweetie, please head to our website www.jamesvillesecondchance.com to fill out an application. You can also email us with any questions at friendsofsecondchance@gmail.com.

Agatha is only around 1-2 years old. She loves to play and meet new friends! She will roll over for belly rubs, give you kisses and be a loyal companion. Agatha does well with other dogs and even enjoys playing in the kiddie pool! Visit our website for an application to meet this beautiful girl! www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Bailey is a 3 year old, very sweet girl who is looking for her forever home. She is very smart, affectionate, and loves her pets and cuddles. Bailey is eager to learn. Nothing makes her happier than being told she is a good girl!  She is getting better on a leash, but does get excited when she sees a squirrel or other dogs. She is excellent with kids but does need to be in a home where she is the one and only pet. She listens very well when asked to do things as she only wants to please her humans. She will roll over for a belly rub and you will have a friend for life.  If you are looking for a true loyal companion, you have found your girl! Visit our website for an application to meet her www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Dulce graduated from basic manners class! She can’t wait to show her new family all her awesome tricks and manners she knows! She loves everyone she meets including dogs and kids. She would make a great family companion! She is looking for a home without cats. To meet this sweet smart girl visit our website for an application www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Meet Romeo! This sweet & loving boy enjoys being with his people pals. Romeo is around 7 years old. He likes going for walks and will sit for treats. He will also give you his paw, but he especially loves showing off his trick where he high fives you with both paws! Romeo is an absolute love! He’s great in the car & loves having his head out the window to get all the good sights & smells. This adorable boy is not a fan of cats and will need a home without them. 

If you’re interested in meeting Romeo, please visit our website www.jamesvillesecondchance.com to fill out an adoption or foster application. You can also email us with any questions at friendsofsecondchance@gmail.com. 

His adoption fee is sponsored!!

Maizy is a spunky, energetic lovebug, looking for a very special friend. She is always ready to play, highly motivated by treats, and knows lots of tricks. She is very smart. Her favorite pastimes include rolling in warm sunny grass, snuggling on the couch, shredding old basketballs, and her all-time favorite; swimming! 
She is potty trained and crate experienced!
She is apprehensive about small children and men. She gets along with her older dog sister and cat brother but must be introduced slowly to other dogs. Prospective adopters must be tolerant, confident, patient, and strong. 
Visit our website to meet this sweet girl. 
www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Meet Walnut who at only 10 months old was let down by humans and found hurt and alone in the woods.

How anyone could do that to such a sweet pup we will never understand. She loves everyone she meets and greet them with her puppy energy and tail wagging. She is so smart and eager to please. She knows sit, paw, spin and down! 
She hasn’t shown any food aggression and is gentle at taking treats and is VERY food motivated. she does ok on leash, she pulls here and there but with consistency and training she is getting better each day! She loves to give kisses and snuggles! She is a cuddle bug and snores when she’s in a deep sleep. She loves to be cuddled up next to you or under all the blankets.  
Walnut would thrive in a home with no dogs or children and with a fenced in yard as she is a puppy and loves to run!
To meet his happy girl visit our website an application www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Meet Sonny! This beefy boy can’t wait to meet you! Sonny is around 3 years old and he is an absolute love bug! He is an active boy that likes to run and play. Sonny will sit for treats and would love to learn more! He will sit right in your lap for affection and pets, and when he’s really happy you might be lucky enough to get a big smooch from this big boy! Sonny has been playful when meeting other dogs, especially female pups. He is looking for a cat free home. Visit our website for an application to meet him! www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Archie was found roaming around the city of Syracuse & luckily some nice people found him and gave him a warm place to stay until he could be brought to the city shelter. Now he’s ready for a family of his own to love! Archie is around 1 year old and enjoys play time with other dogs. He’s a smart, affectionate boy who will quickly steal your heart. He is looking for a cat feee home. Visit our website for an application to meet Archie! www.jamesvillesecondchance.com
His adoption fee has been sponsored by Michael C. Graham & Son Construction!

Dawson has a story to tell at only the young age of 2 years old he was found stuck in water in a creek in the city. He was so grateful to his rescuers and the shelter staff for caring for him but he is ready to find the loving home he deserves! Dawson likes to play with other dogs, loves a good bell rub and is absolutely stunning in person! To make this deserving boy part of your family visit our website for an application www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Say hello to the handsome Chase who is around 1 year old. What does Chase love to do the most? You guessed it chase tennis balls!! He also loves going for walks, playing with female dogs, getting belly rubs and being by your side. Chase is up for any adventure and is ready to be a loyal companion to his family. To visit this Handsome guy visit our website for an application www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Say hello the sweet Coco who was found as a stray and is only around a year old. This sweet girl keeps everyone laughing with her tail that never stops wagging and she loves rolling over for belly rubs! Coco likes to play with other dogs, and walks well on a leash. Visit our website for an application to meet Coco and make her part of your family!
www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

Looking for some puppy love Tilly is your girl! This cutie is only around 10 months old. She has lived with cats and kids and was turned in when her owner could no longer care for her. Tilly is a shy girl at first who will need time to feel comfortable around you but once she warms up she will be right by your side. She adores the works we that care for her everyday. Since she is shy she can be selective on her canine friends so a meet and greet is required. To meet Tilly complete an application from our website and email it back to us.
www.jamesvillesecondchance.con

Say hello to Pixie! Pixie is a sweet, smart, spunky, and snuggly, soon to be three year old pit mix. She is the perfect blend of couch potato and adventure partner. Miss Pix will cuddle with you under the covers, go for a long walk, run, or hike, and spend an afternoon lounging in the sun. She has so much love to give - I hope you like kisses! - and just wants to be loved in return. 

She is crate trained, walks well on leash, gets along with cats and kids who respect her space, and is a food motivated and quick learner. 

Pixie needs to be the only dog, but she's truly the only dog you need. 

Likes: electric blankets, squeaker toys, pork chomps, belly rubs
Dislikes: the vacuum, when the belly rubs stop, the mailman 

If you’d like to meet this adorable pup, please head to our website www.jamesvillesecondchance.com to fill out an application.

Say hello to Rosalie!? This beautiful 1 year old pup is an absolute sweetheart! Rosalie adores her human friends and loves to play with toys. She is a great walking buddy and has been playful when meeting other dogs, but will need a home without cats. If you’re interested in meeting this playful pup, you can find our application by visiting our website www.jamesvillesecondchance.com. 
Her adoption fee has been sponsored!

This handsome boy is estimated to be between 1-2 years of age. Wandering alone in November of 2022, cold, miserable and very hungry as a stray, he just so happened across the right house because a nice lady took him in. He is potty-trained, crate-trained, knows basic commands, hand signals, and is practicing his loose leash walking and heel command.
BONUS: Ollie has graduated from Mind Your Manners Level 1 Training at CNY Pet Training and is learning new things each day. 
He’d truly excel with an active family and a fenced yard where he can run and fetch to his heart’s content. He LOVES head rubs, butt scratches, playing with other dogs, going for car rides, going on longer hikes or runs, and curling up on the couch with you. This food-motivated, intelligent guy aims to please and learns quickly. 
Visit our website for an application to meet this week boy! www.jamesvillesecondchance.com

It's easy to fall in love with this little girl, she's very sweet and smart.

Buffy is a Carolina Dog/Lab mix and is 2 years old and weighs 39 lbs.   She is spayed, microchipped and up to date on vaccines.   She is a SWEETHEART is ready to find her new home!   Please use the link below to complete an online app:

pet_name: Tulip is  Gorgeous, Smart, & Affectionate Girl!!!
description:
Tulip and her sister, Petunia, were picked up as strays and ended up in a high-kill shelter south of Houston.  We are not sure how they came to be strays.  It is possible that a "backyard breeder" was discarding the "not quite perfect" puppies that they were unable to sell.  We couldn't leave them there, so they were saved in early July.   The day after they arrived at the foster home, she figured out that Tulip is deaf.

Tulip is a Gorgeous puppy.  She is white with black / blue merle markings and just a tiny bit of brown on one hind leg.  She has two striking BLUE eyes.  Unfortunately, due to her genetics, she was born deaf.  She is great with other dogs!  She is friendly with everyone she meets!

Tulip is very Smart and loves to explore and investigate everything!  She has already learned to “sit” for treats and is learning not to jump on her kennel gate when it is time to go out.  She is kennel / house trained.  She walks good on leash.  Tulip also really likes water and has been known to lie down in her water dish, but she isn't a fan of playing in water coming out of a hose.

Tulip is very Affectionate and also does a good job of checking in with her person frequently.  She will be an awesome, Loving family member!

Tulip is 27 pounds, 5 months old and is a Catahoula mix.  We estimate her adult weight at 50 pounds.  She is spayed, microchipped and up to date on her puppy vaccines.   She is ready to find her forever home!   Please use the link below to complete an online app:

https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/FSR-A-1294

Petunia and her sister, Tulip, were picked up as strays and ended up in a high-kill shelter south of Houston.  We are not sure how they came to be strays.  It is possible that a "backyard breeder" was discarding the "not quite perfect" puppies that they were unable to sell.  We couldn't leave them there, so they were saved in early July.  

Petunia is a beautiful puppy.  She is light brown with unique white markings on her neck in addition to white on her face, chest, feet and tail tip.  She has one hazel eye and one BLUE eye.   She is great with other dogs!  She is friendly with everyone she meets!

Petunia (nicknamed Tunia) is a Smart and Affectionate girl.  She LOVES attention.  She has already learned to “sit” for treats and is learning not to jump on her kennel gate when it is time to go out.  She is kennel and house trained.  She walks good on leash.  She is Brave and was quite happy to jump out of the back of an SUV the first time she was in it.  With the Houston summer heat, Tunia will stand in her large outdoor water dish when drinking and actually sat in it a few times.  She is not a fan of water coming out of a hose.

Petunia will be an awesome family member!  She is looking forward to giving and receiving LOVE!!

Petunia is 29 pounds,  5 months old and is a Catahoula mix  We estimate her adult weight to be 50 pounds.  She is spayed, microchipped and up to date on her puppy vaccines.   She is ready to find a Loving home!   Please use the link below to complete an online app:

https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/FSR-A-1295

pet_name: Joey a Loving & Friendly Boy!!!  He weighs 30 lbs!!!
description:
Joey is the cutest boy and is doing great in his foster home!  He is fostering with 2 large dogs, 3 boys ages 17, 16 and 13 and their dad!   He is good with everyone and likes to be near a person!   He will be a LOYAL companion to his new person(s)!   When he hears is fosters car get home, he is out the doggie door to greet him at the gate!

Joey is so LOVING and Friendly!  He likes to play with the dogs in his foster home!   He is not a barker!  He enjoys chewing on a bone.   His foster will take him to work at an Art Gallery and he will lay around or crate and does not bark at clients.   He is very well behaved!

Joey loves to be pet and is a great little boy!   He laid back and enjoys laying on a dog bed with one of the dogs in his home.   He walks well on the leash.   He is house and crate trained!   He has a great temperament and will be a Loving family member!

Joey is 10 months old and weighs 30 lbs.   His breed mix is a small Shepherd or Australian Kelpie mix.   Whatever his mix, he is super SWEET!   He is neutered, micro-chipped and up to date on vaccines!   He is ready to find a new home!   Please use the link below to complete an online app:

pet_name: INDY ANNA (AFFECTIONATE, LOVING, QUIET, LOVES TO RIDE AND BE NEAR HER HUMAN
description:
Female
German Pinscher mix
23 lbs
3.5 yrs  (01/10/2021)
Spay/Microchipped
Current on Shots

Indy Anna is my name, and I was found on Independence Day weekend running and afraid.  A kind lady stopped to help me and make sure I didn't get hit by cars on the busy road.  She picked me up put me in the truck seat and off we went.  I just laid down and collapsed with relief.  I was very hungry and thirsty and very scared.  I am now in my foster home, vetted and ready to have a new family with a cozy, fluffy bed and toys and most of all lots of love.  Belly rubs and cuddling are required!!

Indy Anna is a very SMART girl, RIDES like a pro and loves to be NEAR and TOUCH her human and who can resist those CUTE stand-up ears!  She is crate and house trained and does well on leash.  Indy Anna BONDS very quickly, can sit and loves to give KISSES and rest her head on your lap while watching tv.  A nap in the recliner with you is the best.  Indy Anna can jump straight up onto desk height and will sit and watch you while you are working.  Indy Anna is fine with other dogs and would like a home with quieter surroundings and less traffic.  She is super excited to see you when you come home and is not destructive while alone.   Indy Anna will bark if someone knocks on your door but other than that is a pretty QUIET LAID-BACK girl.

Indy Anna is a LOYAL, LOVING girl and will be BFF forever.  She is very DEVOTED to her human and will be wherever you are.  Indy Anna is a great size and is a "hang out" and "lets go riding" kind of girl.  She has also been seen in the puppy pool so she would most likely loving riding on a boat or being at the beach.  Indy Anna would love to take strolls and then come home to a movie night and when out camping would CUDDLE to keep you and her warm.  If you feel like you can give Indy Anna a forever, loving home please contact Freedom Street Rescue.

My momma, Bella was dumped near a ranch and all of a sudden 7 babies popped up!!! My mom was so very brave, protecting and taking great care of us and we are healthy, happy puppies looking for love!  You can see my mom in the video!

Sakari is a SUPER CUTE, CUDDLY, LOVING puppy who is HAPPY, loves to run and play, chase bugs and hang out with her siblings and her humans. Sakari is HAPPY GO LUCKY and will make you smile and laugh.  She will definitely bring JOY and HAPPINESS to your home.  Just imagine walking in the door and seeing those eyes and sweet little face. description:

7 months (12/15/2023)
Border Collie Mix
30 lbs (expected 40-50)
Neutered/Microchipped
Current on Shots

Hello everybody, my name is Jet and a young dog loving, college student saw me, and 6 other puppies dumped in a park in the city, and he just knew in his heart that he could not leave us all there.  He quickly took action and called his mom to ask if he could bring us home.  WOW imagine what mom is thinking!!!  Well, she is a compassionate woman as well and said to bring them ALL home.  Some of the pups have found homes and I am looking for mine.  I am safe, fed and loved and pretty much have everything I need-----well except for ONE thing!  I need my new family to love me.  Please help me find a family to care for me forever and not dump me in a busy park and then jet away!!!  (Don't mind the pun!!)

Jet is an EXCELLENT boy with a GREAT TEMPERMENT.  He's young and very TRAINABLE as to whatever his new family desires in their home. He's learning about leash walking and progressing with all the other things that are needed in a puppy's life.

breeds_label: Border Collie & Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler Mix
description:
Meet Carlos, the 10-month-old Collie Cattle dog mix who's 45 pounds of pure joy and adventure. This sweetheart of a boy is the perfect blend of energetic and laid-back, making him the ideal companion for both active outings and cozy nights in. After being rescued from a life of neglect, Carlos is eager to embrace the world and all it has to offer.

Carlos is a lover of all things fun and active. Whether it’s jogging, skateboarding, or enjoying a boat ride, this pup is always up for an adventure. But don’t be fooled—he's equally happy to chill on the couch for movie night. Starved for attention and playtime, Carlos blossoms with a bit of love and exercise, quickly settling into a calm and content pup.

Carlos has had wonderful interactions with all people he meets, including kids. His potential to be an amazing family dog is evident in his sweet and friendly nature. He’s dog-friendly and loves to play with both dogs and kids. He hasn’t shown any aggression and seems to get along well with all dogs he meets, regardless of size or gender.

While he’s energetic and still has a bit of puppy in him, Carlos isn’t high-maintenance. He enjoys his exercise but also knows how to relax. A big yard would be fantastic for him, but he could also adapt to apartment living as long as he gets his daily dose of attention and exercise.

Carlos isn’t crate trained but does fine when left to roam in a safe environment. Despite his difficult past, he has no known destructive tendencies. Carlos is just thrilled to be out and about, happily soaking up the freedom.

Carlos loves water sports, fishing, and boat riding—anything active and fun is right up his alley. He’s ready to be the perfect pet for a family who will love him unconditionally and provide him with the attention he deserves. If you’re looking for a playful, adventurous, and loving companion, Carlos is your guy!

Meet Ari! She is fostered in Northern New Jersey but is available for out of state/out of area adoption to the perfect home! Transportation for an out-of-state adoption can be coordinated by our rescue. For more information about our adoption or transportation process, please e-mail our team at SaintMuttsRescue@gmail.com.

+++

Meet our Ari! 

Ari is a beautiful 10-month-old Black Lab Mix who was rescued from a high-kill shelter in Texas before finding her way to freedom in the Northeast. Ari was set to be euthanized solely due to lack of space at the shelter - and her time was up. We are so grateful to have had the opportunity to bust Ari out of the shelter. She is young, eager to learn, and has such a bright future ahead of her. 

Ari is loving, social, and playful. She is the true epitome of a goofy lab puppy. She would thrive in a home with an individual who is eagerly looking for a loyal companion - or with a couple or family who will load her with tons of love and attention. With such a social personality, Ari would be the first to greet new guests at the door at family or friend gatherings. 

On the smaller side for a Lab, Ari weighs about 45/50 pounds. She isn't too tall - and is the perfect 'pocket' sized pup.  Ari is crate trained and is doing very well with her potty training. Routine and structure have been a tremendous help in her house-training success. She is eager to please and notifies you that she has to use the bathroom by standing at the front door. 

Ari walks beautifully on a leash. Her foster enjoys long walks with Ari. She loves to use her nose and is completely unreactive to other dogs or people on leash. She is a dream to walk and would be the perfect companion to keep someone company on new adventures, hikes, or trips. She is wonderful in the car when she travels with her foster Mom.

Ari is a medium/high energy pup. She would benefit from an adoptive home of someone who plans to go on daily walks with her. She LOVES to be outside and would also benefit from having a fenced in backyard. An apartment would not be a good fit for Ari. 

For the active adopter, Ari is your go-to girl for hikes, camping trips, and all things outdoors. She loves adventure and is always ready for a new experience. With her vibrant puppy energy, Ari brings a youthful exuberance to everything she does. She’s eager to please and quick to learn, making training sessions both fun and rewarding. Ari has not had any formal training but would benefit from basic obedience classes to help manage her excitement and to use her brain! 

But the magic really happens when the day winds down. Ari transforms from playful pup to professional snuggler in zero flat, finding that sweet spot in your arms that says, “This is exactly where I belong.” Ari LOVES being in the presence of her people. She follows her foster from room to room - and is equally as excited to curl up on the couch or in bed with her person.

If you’re on the lookout for a gorgeous, and affectionate companion to share in all of life’s little and big adventures, Ari is waving her paw in the air. She’s more than ready to fill your days with laughter and your evenings with the kind of cuddles that make everything else fade away. Who knew the perfect adventure buddy also came with built-in snuggle features?

+++++++

+++

Why hasn't this girl found her forever home yet? 

Cindy Lou is a 10 month old Labrador/Shepherd mix who is not only beautiful - but intelligent, too! She deserves to find her forever family - and we're here to help her do that.

Cindy and her siblings were rescued as strays in Houston, TX where their foster family found them roaming - presumably dumped as an accidental and unwanted litter, which is unfortunately quite common for Texas. Despite this abandonment, Cindy is well-rounded, gentle, sweet, and has a wonderful demeanor. Cindy and her siblings have been raised in an incredible foster home where they have felt love. Cindy is house trained and crate trained - thanks to her dedicated fosters. 

Not only does Cindy Lou have her basic indoor manners down-pat, she is also very well socialized with other dogs. She would do very well in a home with another canine companion to romp around with. She has not been tested or exposed with cats. She has not been exposed to small children. Accordingly and with her shy demeanor, we would recommend a home with dog-savvy children over the age of 10.

Cindy is currently enjoying a large fenced-in backyard and would love to move into a forever home that can facilitate the same - but a fenced-in yard is not a requirement. An active family who plans to take Cindy on long walks, hikes, or on new adventures would be the perfect match for this girl!

Despite her adventurous side, Cindy Lou has a tender heart. She can sometimes be shy at first - but warms up quickly with a patient hand and treats! 

Cindy is spayed, heartworm negative, microchipped, and up to date on vaccines. She is very good to have her nails trimmed - and loves playing in the water with her siblings!

If you're in search of your new companion - and want a combination of beauty and intelligence, please consider giving her a forever home!

Meet our Bobby! 

Bobby is a 9/10 month old beautiful Retriever mix who is in search of the perfect home who will appreciate his calm, laid-back personality - and give him the stable, dedicated forever home he deserves. Bobby currently weighs about 50 pounds and will likely stay around this size once fully grown! 

Bobby is described by his foster mom as the epitome of friendliness and calm energy. He LOVES to nap and snuggle with his foster mama - and he SMILES! Bobby’s foster mom adores his snuggly smiles and selfies. Bobby would be a wonderful companion for someone who works from home. He is easy, quiet, calm, and behaves very well. 

Bobby would be fine as an only dog.- but would equally do well with another canine companion in the home! In his foster home in Texas, Bobby was fostered in a home that included a mix of canine pals. He is a playful member of the pack who integrates very well. He is currently foster in NYC as the only dog, but he frequently plays with the neighbors small dog - and does very well! He is a respectful pup to other dogs. 

Bobby’s positive interactions extend beautifully to people as well; he adores children, men, and women alike, showering everyone he meets with love.

Despite his calm demeanor, Bobby really enjoys long walks with his foster mama! They often go on a 2.5 walk multiple days throughout the week. Bobby has integrated and adapted to the city better than we could have anticipated - which speaks to his adaptive personality. 

Bobby is not crate trained, but he's well-behaved when left to roam his home and yard, showing no signs of destructive tendencies. Bobby IS beautifully housetrained and has not had an accident since arriving to his foster home in NY! 

Are you ready to add a ray of golden light to your life? Bobby is all set to dazzle you with his affection and loyalty. Bring home this delightful retriever mix and let the love shine in!

Meet Nicole, a gorgeous terrier mix whose stunning blue eyes and affectionate demeanor make her a standout companion. At 3-4 years old and weighing in at 60 lbs, Nicole has mastered the art of charm and companionship. She is sweet, gentle, and as loving as they come, with a personality that perfectly complements her striking looks.

Nicole is an exemplary model of good behavior; she walks beautifully on a leash, experiences no separation anxiety, and shows no signs of resource guarding. She shares her current home with various dogs of all sizes and has a particularly inseparable bond with her sister, Paris. Together, Nicole and Paris explore the world, proving that some bonds are truly unbreakable.

Nicole’s love extends to all—men, women, and children—and her interactions are marked by sweetness and loyalty. With a medium energy level, she is as happy taking leisurely strolls to the park as she is keeping up with a more active family. She adapts effortlessly to the energy levels of her environment, making her a versatile fit for any home.

Crate and house-trained, Nicole respects her living spaces and is content sleeping in her crate, though she wouldn’t mind snuggling up by your bed if invited. Nicole's intelligence and affability shine through in every aspect of her life, making her a joy to have around.

The ideal home for Nicole would be one that might consider adopting her along with her sister Paris, keeping this delightful duo together. Nicole promises to fill her new home with loyalty, affection, and plenty of heartwarming moments. Good evening! My name is Gus and I stick by my humans like Velcro! I am a LOYAL, HANDSOME boy who is very SMART and just wants to be with a person or family BUT PLEASE this time a kind human! I have scars on my back possibly from a chemical burn or a fire burn from wherever I came from. My back is all healed now, and I just want a family to love me and to share lots of CUDDLES and love. Animal control picked me up as a stray and I spent some time in the pound until we had a foster home available.

Gus is a great boy who is house, and crate trained, loves CRUISING in the car letting his ears fly and feeling free. I bet he would love riding in a jeep! Gus loves stuffy toys even carrying them on walks and he does not destroy them, and he is very well mannered inside and NOT destructive. Gus does well on leash and loves to play tug. He has learned the boundaries around his house when outside and knows not to cross them. Gus sits by the door until his leash is attached before going out. Gus is good with dogs especially his new little girlfriend, Suki. SEE VIDEO. Gus doesn't care for cats. Gus loves to cuddle and is an automatic lap dog (even though he's a little large) and even sits on the outdoor swing with one of his fosters. When his foster goes to bed he goes right to his crate and lays down leaving the door open and sleeps like a baby all night.

Gus deserves a chance at a new beginning with a family that won't hurt him and will love and share their life with him and to wipe away all those past memories. He would love to be a part of family vacations and functions. Gus would be a great companion to come home too and would make you happy on sad days. Road trips would be great as well sharing adventures and exploring and just having fun. FYI--a complete stranger came up and sat by the pool and Gus wiggled his way onto her lap and loved every minute. If you think you can provide Gus a forever, loving home please contact Freedom Street Rescue.

Hi everyone, my name is Olaf and I'm just like the Olaf on Frozen--Optimistic, Outgoing, welcoming and I totally love the 4-year-old twins and all the dogs in my foster home. I did not feel that way as you can see in the picture posted on Facebook when I was found alongside the road. I was on the street starving and alone for some time and I had injuries sustained from a possible car the vet guessed. Again, I am thankful like Olaf on Frozen for little things like food and water and love and for great big things like my foster family stepping up and helping me nursing me back to health.

Olaf has slowly blossomed into a playful loving boy. He DEFINITELY knows he was rescued. Olaf is crate trained and house training is going well. He does well on leash and loves walks and surprised his foster mom by hopping on her bed and taking a nap with her. Olaf is curious about cats, so cats not recommended.
He is just a happy boy who loves his foster family, his doggie friends and the little boy and girl living in his home. Olaf also rides well and is learning several commands. The dog identifier on the phone lists several breeds like Dogo Argentino, Pit Bull, Dalmation and Bird dog but it really doesn't matter I'm just Olaf to all.

Olaf has gained a healthy amount of weight, and his wounds are healed and the wound on his head has healed, and the hair is growing back. He is now ready for his forever family to love him, and he will show them everlasting love in return.
Olaf would be very happy in an active family to go on exciting adventures whether hiking, camping, (he probably would snuggle to keep you warm on cool nights) traveling or whatever makes his new family enjoys. If you feel like you can give Olaf a forever, loving home please contact Freedom Street Rescue.

She is now in search of the perfect forever home to love her, spoil her, and treasure her - as she so deserves.

She loves new adventures and would be the perfect companion to accompany someone who travels or likes to hike! Already knowing her basic commands and manners (walking nicely on leash and sitting on command), Renata would be a great fit for someone seeking to grow and learn with their new companion! Reny's foster Mom says she is 'one of the smartest dogs I've ever had.' 

Chasing squirrels? Cats? Reny chases cars! She is working very hard on controlling her excitement by cars passing by, but we think a home away from a road or major highway would be of benefit for our girl! 

Reny loves hanging out with other dogs, especially playful ones. She's cool with dogs of all sizes and ages, even puppies. However, she's not a fan of alpha dogs - or a dog who will 'check' her. Her play can initially start off as 'rough' play, so a dog who can match or tolerate her play level is a must! 

Per Reny's foster Mom, Reny is wonderful with children! She has been walked by the nieces and nephews of her foster Mom (ages 6-12) - and has even done very well around a 2 year old in the home!

Before being rescued and while spending time in the shelter, Reny allowed volunteers to dress her up happily - giving everyone kisses and soft tail wags.'

Looking for an excitable addition to your life? Renata may be your girl! If you're in search of someone to keep you company on all of your upcoming adventures, Renata is ready to be by your side!

Meet Roscoe, the 2-year-old Catahoula mix who's a gentle giant with a heart as big as his 65 lb frame. Roscoe is your quintessential lap dog trapped in a big dog's body, always ready to cuddle up but just as eager to play and please.

Roscoe is a bundle of love and loyalty, with a fondness for toys—balls, in particular—and an endless capacity for affection. He’s incredibly food motivated, making his training sessions both fun and rewarding, though he’s still perfecting his leash skills. He’s a big boy who doesn’t quite understand his size, so a home with older children would be ideal, and he'd prefer a cat-free environment as he tends to see them as a chase challenge.

Currently, Roscoe is enjoying his days with Molly, a Carolina dog who matches his playfulness. While he hasn't been introduced to all the dogs in his current foster home, he's shown no signs of aggression towards any dogs he's observed from a distance or through barriers.

One of Roscoe's favorite pastimes is going for car rides. He absolutely loves to hop in and feel the breeze on his face, making every trip an adventure worth savoring. Whether it’s a quick jaunt around town or a longer excursion, he’s always ready for the ride.

Roscoe’s past may have had its rough patches—he was found following two teenagers around after having been subjected to less than kind treatment by a previous owner, evident from the BBs under his skin and his cautiousness around taking food directly from hands. Despite this, Roscoe's resilience shines through. He expresses his gratitude through big smiles, especially when you scratch under his chin, and has learned to trust again, showing affection with a polite kiss after his meals are set down.

Activity-wise, Roscoe is as versatile as they come. He’s as happy to lounge by your side as he is to play in a yard. He doesn’t need an overly active family but enjoys having space to roam and explore. He’s well crate trained and if given enough mental stimulation and chew toys, he shows no interest in being destructive.

Roscoe is looking for a forever home where he can continue to learn that the world can be a kind place, where he can give and receive love freely, and where his sweet nature will be cherished. If you're looking for a loyal friend who will adore every moment spent with you and bring joy to your days with his big, heartwarming smiles, and who loves car rides as much as he loves playing, Roscoe is ready to meet you and start your wonderful journey together.

Meet our girl Tiny!

Tiny is currently fostered in Texas, but is available for out of state adoption. We are also looking for a foster or foster-to-adopt home for her. For more information on our adoption and transportation process, please email us at SaintMuttsRescue@gmail.com.

+++

Tiny is - well - tiny! This beautiful Border Collie mix is quite petite at only 35 pounds! She has such a sweet and bubbly spirit despite her life of neglect. At only 1 year old, Tiny is forgiving - and has so much ahead of her. We are excited for her to find an individual or family who will love her for the remainder of her life.

Tiny was rescued by a family in Texas after a few weeks on the run around town. Her original family, who had her as a puppy, no longer wanted he and accordingly, they dumped her outside to fend for herself. Initially timid in new environments and with new people, she warms quickly when shown love and patience. 

Despite her timid nature (initially), Tiny has done well with children. We would recommend a home with children over the age of 12 for this sweet but shy girl.

Tiny has also done very well with other dogs and lives with her foster buddy, Stevie, currently! We would prefer to find a home for Tiny with another confident dog who can show Tiny the ropes in her new home! Tiny has not yet been tested with cats. 

Tiny is doing very well with her house training. Due to her life of neglect - and being on the run as a stray - she would benefit from a family willing to be patience, but work with her on basic manners and obedience! She is described as well behaved by her family, but she has so much more to learn at such a young age!

For more info on this sweet girl, please email us at SaintMuttsRescue@gmail.com.

To apply to adopt Tiny, please complete our adoption application below:

Introducing Sandy, the 6-month-old Catahoula puppy who turns life into a non-stop adventure! Weighing in at 30 pounds of pure energy, Sandy's favorite activities include running, jumping, and generally embodying the spirit of a whirlwind.

Sandy spends her days with a canine crew of older, more laid-back dogs and her energy definitely sets her apart as the group's lively youngster. She's friendly with dogs her size or larger and would absolutely love a pup sibling who can match her vibrant energy—her interactions with smaller companions are yet to be explored.

Living with a single foster dad, Sandy has adapted well to her human companion, though she’s always eager to meet new friends. Her ideal home would have a big yard for all her energy, and she’d thrive best with an active family who can keep up with her love for life and joyful lifestyle.

Dog-friendly and full of life, Sandy is looking for a home where she can run, play, and snuggle with a family as energetic as she is. If there were a social butterfly award at doggie daycare, Piper would be the reigning champ—she absolutely adores her fellow canines. Whether it's a day filled with play or just hanging out with her two foster siblings, Piper is all about that dog pack life. Cats? Well, the jury's still out on those mysterious creatures.

Before making her grand entrance to NY, Piper spent some time with a pet sitter where she proved she’s as good with small humans as she is with dogs. She’s got a soft spot for kids, showing off her gentle and playful side in equal measure. However, when it comes to the gents, Piper can be a bit reserved at first. Then it's all love, all the time.

Piper is the epitome of playful energy followed by blissful naps. She can go from 100 to zero in the blink of an eye, transitioning seamlessly from play mode to serious couch potato. Cuddling up with her foster mom for some quality relaxation time is high on her list of favorite activities, making her the perfect chill companion after a fun day of adventures.

At 2 1/2 years old and tipping the scales at an agile 48 pounds, Mimi is a burst of sunshine on four legs. This girl isn't just about wagging tails and wet noses; she's a master of fetch and could probably give you a run for your money in a tug-of-war challenge with her favorite squeaky toy.

Mimi's got this life thing figured out—she's fully potty trained and walks on a leash like she's strutting down a runway, making her the perfect sidekick for all your outdoor escapades. Her social calendar is always full, thanks to her love for people and a paw-sitive attitude towards other dogs. Corina's eagerness to please and her sweet disposition make her a joy to have in any home. She has a remarkable ability to get along with children, showcasing her gentle and caring nature.

While Corina is a friend to people of all ages, as with all of our rescues, we recommend a home with children aged 10 years and older!

If you're looking for a dog who can match your enthusiasm for life and then wind down with you in quiet moments, Corina is ready to fill your home with laughter, love, and a bit of pit bull terrier magic. 


******************

Meet Lionel, our lovable 2-year-old mixed breed pup, standing tall and lean at 55 lbs with delightfully pointed ears that add to his unique charm. Lionel's slender frame and towering height make him a standout, but it's his joyful spirit and loving nature that truly win hearts.

From the moment you approach Lionel, you're greeted with his infectious excitement. He can barely contain his joy, jumping up as if to say, "Hello, new friend!" Leashing Lionel is a breeze, despite his playful antics of tangling up in excitement and showering you with his signature “nippy kisses.” This affectionate behavior is just Lionel's way of showing how much he craves human connection and love.

Outside, Lionel's playfulness shines through. He's all about giving love, jumping up to offer more kisses, demonstrating his eagerness to bond. Lionel is like a ray of sunshine, brightening up the day with his cheerful demeanor. He's a dog who's longing for a forever home where he can learn, love, and thrive.

Lionel's interactions are full of affectionate gestures. His playful energy makes him an entertaining companion, and it's clear that with a bit of guidance on manners, he'll be the perfect family dog. He's friendly towards both people and other dogs, making him a wonderful addition to a loving home.

Along with all of our rescued animals, we recommend a family with children aged 10 and over for Lionel. Lionel is the kind of pup who fills your home with laughter, play, and unconditional love.

If you're looking for a tall, affectionate, and joyous canine companion, Lionel is your guy. He's ready to learn, ready to play, and most importantly, ready to love.

Dana is the epitome of a sweet girl! With a sparkling spirit, she's always eager to learn new things and showcases impeccable obedience. 

Temperament: Dana is an incredibly loving and affectionate pup. Despite her past experiences, she remains joyful and exudes a playful demeanor around other dogs. She is also very smart and eager to please her humans, making her easily trainable. In just a few days, she has already learned commands like "sit" and "down," which speaks to her intelligence and willingness to learn.

Training and Exercise: Dana's intelligence and eagerness to please make her highly trainable.  Our trainers often rave about how Dana is one of the best leash-walkers they've ever had. This lovely lady responds positively to corrections and is always eager to do her best. Given her active nature, regular exercise and playtime will be essential to keep her happy and healthy.

Affection: Dana comes alive outside and her playful side shines! Once inside, she settles down nicely and craves human affection. She loves cuddling and being close to her humans, making her an ideal companion for those who enjoy spending quality time with their furry friend.

What Dana's Looking For:
- A patient family that understands the beauty of growth. Dana deserves a home that will give her the time she needs to adapt and flourish, nurturing her budding confidence every day.
- Although she loves to play and gets along with her canine friends, Dana would truly shine as an only pet. She deserves all the love, snuggles, and attention you can offer.
- A household with rescue experience would be a match made in heaven. Dana has been through a lot and deserves to be understood and cared for in the best way possible.

Dana's Backstory:
Dana had a rough start in life, this brave girl was found abandoned in a kennel on the side of a highway in the peak of summer. We suspect she might have spent most of her life in a kennel as she tends to circle when in her crate. But every day, with love and care, she grows stronger and more confident. Despite the pain she must have endured, Dana's loving nature shines through, and she has a bubbly and affectionate personality.

Special Note:
Due to Dana's unique sensitivities, she would thrive best in a home without children. Let's give this girl the peaceful and loving environment she so rightfully deserves!

If Dana sounds like the perfect fit for your family or if you’d like to meet her, please get in touch. She's waiting for her forever home! If you can help give Dana temporary foster home, please complete our foster application.
