Name: Murphy
Breed: Collie Pyrenees Mix
Age: 1 year
Disposition: Working breed

About Murphy:
Murphy is a one-year-old Collie Pyrenees mix who is looking for a home where he can put his working breed instincts to use. He is an active and intelligent dog who thrives on having a job and purpose in life.

Personality:
Murphy is a dedicated and hardworking dog with a strong work ethic. He is known for his intelligence and is quick to learn and follow commands. He is an alert and attentive companion who is always ready for a task. While he may be serious and focused during work, he can also be affectionate and loyal to his human companions.

Work and Job Requirements:
As a working breed, Murphy requires a home where he can have a job or specific tasks to engage his mind and energy. This could include activities such as herding, agility training, or participating in dog sports. Murphy will excel in an environment where he is given the opportunity to work and use his natural instincts. Regular mental and physical stimulation is essential for his overall well-being.

Training:
Murphy is a highly trainable dog due to his intelligence and eagerness to work. He will benefit from consistent and positive reinforcement training methods. With the right guidance and training, he can become a well-behaved and reliable companion. Engaging in activities that challenge his mind and provide structure will help fulfill his working breed needs.

Activity Level:
Murphy has a high activity level and requires regular exercise to stay happy and content. Daily walks, runs, or engaging in activities that simulate his working instincts will help burn off his excess energy. Providing him with sufficient physical exercise and mental stimulation will contribute to his overall happiness and prevent behavioral issues that may arise from boredom.

Ideal Home:
Murphy would thrive in a home where his working abilities can be utilized. Owners who have experience with working breeds or have a background in dog training would be well-suited for him. A home with a large securely fenced yard or access to open spaces would be ideal. Murphy needs an owner who understands his needs for mental and physical stimulation and is committed to providing him with a purposeful life.

If you are looking for a dedicated and active companion who thrives on having a job, Murphy might be the perfect match for you. Prepare to embark on a fulfilling journey with this intelligent and hardworking dog!

Hello there! I'm Chico, a friendly and playful 6 year black mouth curr mix, and I'm on the lookout for my forever companion. Are you ready to be my best friend? Let me tell you a little bit about myself and what I'm looking for in a forever home.

First and foremost, I'm a champion lounger. I love spending my days inside, relaxing and enjoying the comforts of home. However, when I step outside, that's when the real magic happens! I come alive with energy and excitement. Playing fetch is my absolute favorite pastime, and there's nothing quite like the thrill of chasing a ball. If you're up for a game of fetch, count me in!

I'm also a fan of long walks, especially when I have a loving human by my side. There's something about the fresh air and exploring new surroundings that truly brings me joy. Im a big boy, close to 70lbs, but you don't have to worry about me overpowering you, I walk beautifully on a leash and always leave slack in the line bc I really like being close to you! It's the perfect opportunity for us to bond and create lasting memories together.

One thing you should know about me is that I just completed my training program, and I'm proud to say that I know all my commands. I'm a quick learner and can follow cues like sit, down, place, and many more. I'm eager to show off my skills and impress you with my obedience. What me in action at the link below:

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100088241135668&mibextid=LQQJ4d

When it comes to my ideal home, I would do great as an only pup. I can provide you with all the love, loyalty, and companionship you need. However, if you have a female sibling playmate in mind, I would be more than happy to have a furry friend to share my adventures with. I have a friendly and sociable nature, so getting along with other dogs is not a problem for me.

If you're looking for a loving and loyal companion who enjoys both relaxation and outdoor adventures, then I just might be the perfect match for you. Let's spend all our days together, making each other's lives brighter and more fulfilling.

If you're interested in meeting me, please reach out! I can't wait to meet you and embark on this incredible journey of friendship and companionship together.

Meet the Superhero Litter! 


Hulk, 9 weeks (estimated DOB May 2024), male, Carolina Dog/Retriever mix, estimated to be a medium/large size when full grown. He is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and is able to transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

This litter was rescued from a shelter in Houston when they were at risk of euthanasia. The puppies are now old enough to start finding homes of their own. We included a picture of Mom, Sally, for reference (she is 56 pounds). 

Hulk is described as a goofball with a silly, playful personality and is the biggest of his litter. He loves chasing and wrestling with his siblings, and is a good-natured fellow who rarely is caught sitting still for photos.

Hulk is not fully housebroken and has spent some time crated, but generally spends time in a pen with his siblings. We are looking for a home who understands this comes with the territory of raising a young puppy. 

Hulk has not been around cats but is being fostered with kids ages 5-15 years old. We always recommend a home with kids who respect and understand animal boundaries. For younger kids, we expect parents who will supervise and help teach appropriate animal manners. 

Hulk is looking for a home who has an understanding of raising puppies into adulthood. This can be prior experience or someone who will seek support as needed (training, friends/family). Puppies bring so much joy, but also need intentional and committed attention. They need help socializing with new people, other dogs, leash work and basic obedience. 

Puppies under 6 months of age are placed on a spay/neuter contract until they are old enough to be altered. 

For puppies this age, someone needs to be home more than they are away as crating them for long periods of time is not conducive for their developmental needs. If you work outside of the home longer than 4 hours, please explain who will is available to spend time with this puppy while you are aware. If that information is not included, we will not consider your application. 


***Listed BREED and AGE - We are taking our best guess & recommendations from our veterinarian on age, breed and size when fully grown. We rarely know a dog's exact age nor are we able to tell the true or full breed mix of dogs as our information is limited most of the time. ***

Patricio is an approximately 9 months old, neutered male, lab/pit mix, 51 lbs. Patricio is in a foster home in Houston, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Patricio ended up at a crowded shelter before he'd even had his first birthday.  At approximately 9-10 months, Patricio loves hard. It’s clear from his drive-by snuggles and how he attempts to join every family he meets at the dog park that while he was found as a stray, he was well-loved in his prior life.  He will make a fantastic addition to an active family who will enjoy doing activities with him.

Patricio's foster family has 3 dogs with whom he enjoys endless hours of play. Wrestling and chase are his favorite games if he can entice one of the siblings to join.  When the resident dogs are too tired or grouchy to play, he will happily entertain himself by finding a toy to chew on.  All toys are chew toys to this silly boy! He’s been a very respectful boy of the house and hasn’t chewed on anything other than the things intended for him. 

While he hasn’t had many kids to play with at his foster home, he has engaged with some at the park.  He is a lover of all humans, however his active play style is better suited for older kids who can understand puppy play.  He has learned not to use humans for chew toys – however especially with kids, this will need to be reinforced in his new home.   

Patricio gets an A+++ for leash manners – he walks calmly with a loose leash, doesn’t pull, and doesn’t harass the squirrels, ducks, or even the swans he encounters! He calmly passes other dogs or humans on a walk.

Patricio happily hangs in his crate when he’s alone.  Just a little treat as positive reinforcement to get him to go in and then he will have a nice snooze while you’re gone!  Due to his foster’s schedule, he hasn’t been left for more than 4 hours but could easily work upward from that timeframe as he now understands crate=calm rest. Patricio is a very smart boy. He is fully potty trained and has quickly learned everything we’ve worked on! He is incredibly responsive to positive reinforcement with any sort of food.

This all-around VERY GOOD BOY Patricio is going to make someone a very lucky dog parent – he’s full of love and fun, silly energy.

Stanley, 1.5 years old, neutered male, Pitbull Terrier/Retriever mix, 45 pounds. Stanley is in a foster home in San Antonio, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Stanley is a playful and energetic guy! He shares a home with another dog. He has also gone to stay at one of our boarders when his foster is out of town. He has met so many new dogs on those visits. He has met dogs big, small, different breeds, all ages and both genders. He is playful by nature, which we would expect given he is a young guy with lots of life. You will find this guy running with the pack, greeting new dogs and having the best time. 

Stanley has been around a few kids (ages 5-12y) with other temporary fosters while his Main Foster Mom has been out of town. The feedback has been positive but that he takes longer to warm up to men/boys.  No matter the age of kid, we typically advise homes with kids who can understand and will respect animal behavior cues. We have no history with cats.

Stanley is mild-mannered on the leash and walks calmly but does pull. His foster mom is working with him on this but his new family may find that a harness or Gentle Leader head collar work better to manage his pulling. Stanley is fully house and kennel trained. He's proven trustworthy while in the house unsupervised (he's non-destructive and doesn't have accidents). He is crated for longer periods of time and does great. 

All dogs are fed separately as a rule of his Foster but she notes there have been no signs of aggression or resource guarding when another dog sniffs at his food while he's eating. He has no issues sharing toys, treats or bones and shows only moderate interest in people food.

Stanley is active and loves to get his energy out, and would be best served with a yard of his own. He currently spends a lot of time in the backyard playing with the other dogs and/or would enjoy some dedicated play time. He enjoys walks and runs, playing ball, and having something to chew on. He doesn't need to have another dog in the house but it would be helpful, especially one of similar age and size.

He's silly and goofy and an embodiment of the pittie personality (cuddly and affectionate especially at bedtime, dramatic and vocal, energetic and athletic). He loves water and will try getting into the shower or bath, even though the water is hot. He would thrive with a breed experienced adopter who is willing to pour time and attention into him, training and teaching him good manners. He would enjoy being a running partner and going on active adventures.

Cotton, 2year old, spayed female, white German Shepherd/labrador retriever mix, 51 pounds. Cotton is in a foster home in San Antonio, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Hi! My name is Cotton and I was saved by Dizzy Dog from San Antonio ACS. When I came to my foster home I was really skinny and a little scared. :( My foster parents think I would really like a friend to play with.  I can lay and entertain myself in the yard, although I sometimes play with things I shouldn't like the plastic pots and yard tools, so don't leave those out!  

I have very expressive blue eyes that look like I have eyeliner on.  My ears are also great -sometimes they are up like a German shepherd and sometimes they are down. I cross my legs when I lay down and wait for a treat.  I know how to sit and shake. I'm really very smart!

I'm not sure how old I am but probably still young since I do have a lot of puppy energy! I've not been around many kids before and because I can be really excited to say hi, it's probably best if any kids in my life are older like 10-12+? I REALLY love attention! I love to be petted and if I can sit in your lap, I will! Once I get lovings I calm down. I don't really know how to play with toys so I probably didn't have many before I got here.  

I love going on walks and do really really well on the leash, not pulling and walking calmly next to you. I have never had an accident in the house and will go into my crate if you ask me. I won't make a mess there either but sometimes I get anxious and scratch at my bed in the crate so I prefer being with my people.  I love to lay on the bed with you too, or just next to or even under your bed!

I have a spot on my back that doesn't have any fur on it.  My foster parents think I may have been burned by something or someone.  They put cream on it to keep it soft, It's a little sensitive when it's touched but it doesn't seem to hurt. 

I'd love to be your new furbaby! I promise to love you a lot!

Celine Dion, 3.5 years old, spayed female, Weimaraner/Mountain cur mix, 58 pounds. She is located in HOUSTON, TEXAS and can transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

Celine was saved from euthanasia at a county shelter in Houston. The shelter listed her as a Husky mix, but we see other breeds. We are taking our best guesses in terms of the breeds we listed, but imagine she is made up of other breeds too.

Celine is a young and energetic pup still mastering the art of play. While she loves the idea of making new furry friends, her play style can be a bit intense. She did wonderfully with a very tolerant 75-pound husky, but her jumpy and in-your-face approach was too much for some of the other dogs. Celine is eager to play and, with a little more guidance, she's sure to become a well-mannered playmate. 

When it comes to playtime, Celine is all about high energy. She can romp around with the best of them but does settle down after a while. She's learning to pick up on cues from other dogs, though there are times when her husky friend had to be vocal to get her to stop. Celine has been exposed to dogs of various sizes but mainly played with larger ones. 

Meeting new dogs on walks has generally been positive for Celine. She pulls a little initially but calms down quickly. Her interactions on the leash are friendly and wagging tail without much excitement. After some basic manners training, she’s become quite good at walking alongside her foster siblings.

We have no history with cats. Celine loves people and has done well with a 12-year-old child in her foster home. She can be slightly jumpy, but with a few weeks of manners training, she has improved significantly. She would likely be best suited for a home with children over 5, ensuring a playful but safe environment for everyone.

Celine is enthusiastic about walks, pulling a bit at first but settling into a loose leash stroll after a few minutes. She loves to sniff everything, showing her curious nature. She is fully housebroken, Celine has adapted well to being crated. Though she didn’t like the crate at first, she now goes in willingly for meals or treats and can stay crated for extended periods if needed.

Celine has shown no issues with food aggression. There have been no problems with toys, bones, or treats. She’s also comfortable with people around her food.

Celine would thrive in an active home with a yard and daily activities. She has a moderate to high energy level and would benefit from having another playful dog companion. However, she may also do well as the only pet in an active household.

Celine is playful, silly, and curious. She loves playing with toys and is very affectionate. When meeting strangers, she shows no signs of fear and is generally calm. In the car, she can be a bit nervous and may pant, but with more car rides, she’s likely to get more comfortable.

Celine is a loving and spirited dog looking for an active home where she can continue to learn and grow. With her playful personality and eager-to-please attitude, she’s sure to bring joy and laughter to her forever family.

Meet the Superhero Litter! 


Harley Quinn, 9 weeks (estimated DOB May 2024), female, Carolina Dog/Retriever mix, estimated to be a medium/large size when full grown. She is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and is able to transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

This girl is more vocal than her siblings. She loves cuddle time and pets. She has a silly personality!  

This litter was rescued from a shelter in Houston when they were at risk of euthanasia. The puppies are now old enough to start finding homes of their own. We included a picture of Mom, Sally, for reference (she is 56 pounds). 

She is not fully housebroken. She has spent some time crated, but generally spends time in a pen with her siblings. We are looking for a home who understands this comes with the territory of raising a young puppy. 

She has not been around cats, but is being fostered with kids ages 5-15 years old. We always recommend a home with kids who respect and understand animal boundaries. For younger kids, we expect parents who will supervise and help teach appropriate animal manners. 

Harley Quinn is looking for a home who has an understanding of raising puppies into adult hood. This can be prior experience or someone who will seek support as needed (training, friends/family). Puppies bring so much joy, but also need intentional and committed attention. They need help socializing with new people, other dogs, leash work and basic obedience. 

Puppies under 6 months of age are placed on a spay/neuter contract until they are old enough to be altered. 

For puppies this age, someone needs to be home more than they are away as crating them for long periods of time is not conducive for their developmental needs. If you work outside of the home longer than 4 hours, please explain who will is available to spend time with this puppy while you are aware. If that information is not included, we will not consider your application.

Bambi, 10 months old, spayed female, Plot Hound/Mountain Cur mix (best guesses), currently 30 pounds so full grown will be in the medium range.  We are not completely sure all the breeds that make up this pup, so your guess is as good as ours! She is in a foster home in SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS and can transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

Meet Bambi, an adorable and energetic pup with a heart full of love and curiosity. This young dog is still finding her way in the world, and with a little patience and training, she’s sure to become a wonderful companion.

Bambi loves to play with other dogs and has a high-energy play style. She's eager to make friends and engage in friendly play, although she sometimes plays a bit hard. She’s smart enough to pick up on cues when another dog wants to stop playing and has had positive interactions with dogs her size, like beagles and Jack Russell beagle mixes. When meeting new dogs, she starts off nervous but quickly warms up and becomes friendly. She recently went to a dog park and made friends with everyone there! 

We have no history with cats. Bambi has shown that she can be nervous and timid around children at first. However, once she gets to know them, she becomes friendly. We recommend a home with kids who understand and respect animal boundaries.

Walking on a leash is a bit of a challenge for Bambi. She tends to freeze and throw herself on the floor, showing she’s confused and needs some leash training. She also pulls on the leash, so she'll benefit from a patient handler to help her learn.

Bambi isn’t fully housebroken yet and tends to pee when she’s excited or nervous. She’s been crated and does well as long as there’s nothing in the crate with her. If there’s a bed inside, she might have accidents. The longest she’s been crated is overnight. 

Bambi is an active pup who needs regular walks, playtime, and plenty of attention. She’s best suited for an active home that can provide outdoor activities and ample playtime. She doesn’t necessarily need another dog in the home to keep her company. However, it would be important for her to be around other dogs to maintain her positive social manners. 

Bambi is an independent, timid, and nervous pup who transforms into a playful, smart, and silly dog once she gets comfortable. She loves being petted and is very affectionate. She enjoys playing with toys and is curious about everything around her. When meeting strangers, she tends to be timid and nervous, often freezing and keeping her distance before hiding behind her foster momma. Once given some time, she will approach new people with a wagging tail. 

Bambi has a unique and adorable habit of leaping like a deer from the grass to the top of the porch, completely disregarding the stairs. Bambi would thrive in a home with children who can play with her daily or an active person who enjoys taking her to parks and on hikes. She needs a family that can provide her with the attention and playtime she craves.

Bambi needs a patient family as she’s still a puppy. She has a habit of jumping when being fed and nibbling on hands or legs when walking. Despite these quirks, she’s very loving once she trusts you. Bambi is a sweet and energetic pup looking for a loving home where she can grow and thrive. With a bit of training and a lot of love, she’s sure to become a loyal and cherished member of your family.

Vero, 1 year old, spayed female labrador retriever mix, 41 pounds. Vero is in a foster home in Houston, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Vero is in a home with two small female dogs (10 and 20lbs) and had no issues meeting or playing with the girls, although she can play pretty rough. She's still a puppy so her play skills are still being learned but she is never aggressive and has begun to pick up on when to leave other dogs alone. 

She's very friendly to dogs and humans alike. She doesn't have any issues with sharing toys or food and does not need to have a canine sibling - she is confident enough on her own.

Matter of fact, Vero is an absolute lover - she jumps up for hugs and kisses, will climb up into your lap and lay her head down for pets. She's cuddly and affectionate and has never met a stranger, everyone is a friend she just hasn't kissed yet!

Vero lives with two kids aged 8y and 10y, and had no issues at all. In general, we recommend homes with kids over the age of 10y or those who can understand and will respect animal behavior cues. She does live in a home with cats and has improved in her behavior around them. She initially enjoyed chasing and barking at them, but now is calmer and leaves them be.

Vero is leash, house and crate trained. She is exuberant when first getting to go outside so she may dart forward but she settles down quickly and walks with ease. She alerts when she needs to go outside and has not had any accidents in the home, and is quiet once in her kennel. She does need (or demand, your choice) to be lured into the kennel with a treat but she has no issues once in.

She knows sit and throws paws and will do nearly anything for a treat. She lets you dress her up in silly costumes and doesn't fuss with them at all. Vero enjoys playing with toys and would thrive in an active home with lots of outlets for her energy - walks/hikes, doggy day care or play dates, puzzles, etc. She could benefit from some basic training - she is still a puppy so she jumps up a lot and can get into things she shouldn't - but overall, Vero will be the perfect dog for the luckiest family!

Florence (Flora), 3 years old, spayed female, Carolina Dog mix, 60 pounds. She is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and can transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

Florence, affectionately nicknamed, Flora, Flory, Lory, or Sweetpea, is a playful and energetic dog who loves to wrestle and be chased. She would do best in a home with dogs of similar size and energy level. When playing, Flora could play for hours.  She loves to interact with another dog in the home, Furman by licking his face. Flora has experience playing with dogs ranging from a 35-pound Cocker Spaniel to a 60-pound Pyrenees mix.

Flora requires slow and guided introductions to other dogs. She has shown some leash reactivity, exhibiting behaviors like raised hair, whimpering and barking. Her foster parents have worked with her on this behavior. When she is off leash, she easily makes new friends. 

Flora’s compatibility with cats is unknown. She adores the 8-year-old child in the home, but is nervous of new children. While she has done well with children aged 6-11, she tends to bark  at new kids, especially when they move around quickly. Therefore, Flora is best suited for homes with children aged 10 and older.

As mentioned, Flora has some leash reactivity and gets easily spooked, often pulling a lot. However, she has made progress with positive reinforcement and minimal stimuli. She walks much better in calm environments with less activity.

Flora is fully housebroken. She has demonstrated some anxiety in the crate at home. When her foster parents have gone out of town she has gone to boarding where she is crated with no issues. At home, she is able to be out of a crate and unsupervised with zero issues. She is fed separately from the other dogs in the home.  Otherwise, she shares her toys well and has no issues with people and food, although she needs reminders to take treats gently.

Flora has high energy needs and requires dedicated outdoor playtimes to do well inside the home. She thrives in a moderately active home with regular outdoor play sessions. Flora would benefit from having another dog in the home to boost her confidence and match her energy.

Flora loves playing with the other dog in the home, enjoys talking, bucking around the yard, eating, going for walks, sunbathing, and birdwatching. She is a total love bug and enjoys snuggling. She does well in the car but is terrified of storms, often seeking shelter in a closet or burying her head in a lap.

Flora’s ideal home would be with someone who is often around, enjoys walks or jogs, and will play fetch with her. A home with another dog of similar age, size, and energy level, and possibly a child, would be ideal. Flora needs an owner who will continue positive reinforcement to help with her anxiety. Flora is very smart, loves learning new tricks, and is very submissive and affectionate.

Blinky, 2.5 years old, neutered male, Catahoula mix, 51 pounds. Blinky is in a foster home in Houston, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Blink and you might miss him! This boy is energetic and high energy, enjoying nothing more than playing with 2- and 4-legged friends.  Blinky is in a foster home with three resident dog brothers (40-90lbs) and does well. He's very social and enjoys being the life of the party! He tends to match the energy of the other dogs- so if someone wants to play he will engage. If they are more chill, he follows suit. 

Blinky is very kid friendly and has been around children ages 6-12.  Blinky can be a jumper so normal caution should be exerted to ensure he doesn't accidentally knock over a child. He is very friendly! 

Blinky has been in a home with cats and ignores them. 

Blinky is leash, crate, and house trained with great success. He is very curious on a leash and likes greeting other dogs. He has not been left loose while unsupervised as of yet but has proven to be non-destructive thus far. Blinky does best in a kennel when riding in the car.

While he wants all of the attention, Blinky is happy to share his food, toys, and treats with his foster brother and has shown no issues guarding resources. Blinky eats his meals loose with the resident dogs but it's always a good idea when introducing a new pet to feed in the crate to ensure healthy boundaries and to reinforce a positive connection with the crate.

 A moderately active family would be his ideal. He would enjoy having a canine sibling but could also thrive being the only apple of your eye. He is quite cuddly and loves to receive affection. He is outgoing and friendly, and has not shied away from meeting new people or new experiences.

We have no history with cats or kids. We think she would do great with kids who can understand and respect animal boundaries. In typical puppy fashion, she just jump out when excited or to say hello.

breeds_label: Black Labrador Retriever & Pit Bull Terrier Mix
description:
******Please note, once completing the initial screen you will be connected with the placement for a video chat. Transports run every few weeks and we will have the dog on the next available transport once approved. If you are not able to accept a dog until a specific time period, please apply at that time************

We are a volunteer run rescue and donate our time to these dogs. IF you are not serious about moving forward in our adoption process, please do not apply. If someone other than yourself is part of the decision making process, please make sure you have spoken with them and they are on board. We really do not want to waste anyone's time if you are not serious about adopting this dog.

Jake, 2yr old, neutered male black labrador/pit bull mix, 75 pounds. Jake is in a foster home in Houston, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Jake was found wandering the streets of a Houston neighborhood with a pregnant female companion. When he was taken to the city shelter, he was in rough shape—infested with fleas, losing his hair, and looking very skinny. Fortunately, he was rescued by Dizzy Dog, and his journey to recovery began.

Jake can be a bit clumsy at times, but he has the sweetest personality! He absolutely loves going to new places in the car and meeting new people (he never passes up a chance at getting some attention ?) and animals! He has occasional bursts of energy but a short game of fetch or running around the backyard with a dog friend is enough to tire him out. After which, he enjoys sunbathing on the patio. He also loves a chill 20-30 minute walk! Each night while we are making dinner, he lays calmly on the kitchen floor. He never begs for human food, just wants to be close to us!

Jake has never met a dog he doesn’t like. He loves all dogs, both big and small! He is great at adjusting his play style to match the size and energy level of other dogs. He plays gently with smaller dogs and is more energetic with larger ones. On leash, he gets excited when he sees other dogs and occasionally jumps around because he wants to play with them. This behavior has decreased with regular daily walks but still happens occasionally. He thrives in environments where he can interact and play with other dogs, making him a great companion for multi-dog households.

We have no history with cats nor kids but due to his size and playful nature, we recommend a home with children aged 12 and older. He doesn't intend to hurt anyone, but his size and the way he moves when he is excited could be too much for younger kids.

Jake tends to pull with a regular harness, but he walks great with a gentle leader. He has made significant progress in getting used to it and knows it means it's time for a walk. With a gentle leader, he walks calmly with me. However, he does jump around a bit in excitement when he sees squirrels, people, or other dogs. This is improving with regular daily walks and exposure to these triggers.

Jake had three accidents in the house when we first got him, each one happening right after he ate. These accidents occurred when he was fed in our kitchen, not in his kennel. Now, we make sure he is fed on our patio or goes outside immediately after eating. Since implementing this routine, he hasn't had any accidents, and it’s been several weeks. Additionally, Jake does not chew on things he shouldn't when he is out of his kennel. Jake has come to feel very comfortable in his kennel, sleeping soundly from 9:30 PM when he happily runs into it until about 7:30 AM. He also goes into the kennel easily during the day if we have to leave the house, especially with a frozen Kong to keep him occupied.

Jake does not need to be fed separately. He either eats in his kennel or next to our Weimaraner in the kitchen or on the patio. He shows no aggression with toys or treats, but he sometimes takes the toy Bonnie is playing with, as they have a rougher style of play with each other. He doesn’t have this same style of play with any of our other dogs.

Jake has a moderate energy level and can tire out with regular light physical activity, such as a 30-minute walk, a game of fetch, or running around the backyard with one of our dogs. He would thrive in a home with another dog of similar size to play with. While he loves playing with dogs of all sizes, having a more playful companion his size would be ideal.

If we are home and he is in his kennel, Jake does bark quite a bit because he can hear us in the house. We rotate our dogs throughout the day, so he is in his kennel some of the time while other dogs are out (this rotation is done because of our dogs, not him). He would likely do fine in his kennel if we weren't in the house where he could hear us. With a consistent routine and positive reinforcement, his separation anxiety has decreased immensely. He usually settles down after a few minutes with a frozen Kong to entertain him.

Jake is great at playing with small dogs, often adjusting his play to their level. Despite his size, he is gentle and backs off if they feel overwhelmed. He loves to play and seeks peaceful interactions. Aside from being great at playing with small dogs, he is SO tolerant of them barking or growling at them when they first meet. Our littles were a bit scared of him due to his size at first and he just let them explore and sniff him and get comfortable.

He loves to cuddle and be close to his people, whether lying next to you or at your feet. He is a loyal companion who enjoys being around his family. He has good manners and does not beg for food during meal times, making him a pleasant companion during meals. He is very intelligent and a quick learner. He didn’t seem to know any commands when we first got him, but within a few days, he had already learned to sit, wait, and come. He is very treat-motivated, which makes training easy and effective.

Jake would thrive in a loving home that offers a balance of physical activity and affectionate family time. He would do best with a family or individual who enjoys moderate physical activities, such as daily walks, backyard play, and occasional games of fetch. Having another playful dog of similar size would be perfect for Jake, as he loves playing with dogs and enjoys having a companion. Jake’s new family should understand his past experiences and be patient with his separation anxiety. He has made great progress but may still whine or bark initially when crated. A consistent routine and positive reinforcement will help him continue to improve.

***Listed BREED and AGE - We are taking our best guess & recommendations from our veterinarian on age, breed and size when fully grown. We rarely know a dog's exact age nor are we able to tell the true or full breed mix of dogs as our information is limited most of the time. ***

Milo, 3 years old, neutered male, Pitbull Terrier mix, 53 pounds. He is in a foster home SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS and is able to transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

Milo was abandoned at a dog park in 105 degree heat. Animal control was called and he was picked up and taken to the county shelter. He was later placed on the euthanasia list and we scooped him up! We find it really hard to not love this guy!!

Milo is a bundle of energy and joy! He loves playing with other dogs and goes full speed during playtime. His playful nature is best suited for a home with an active lifestyle. While he gets along well with dogs of all sizes, he's still learning when to stop if the other dog isn’t interested in playing. Milo is friendly and loving towards people, including kids aged 5-7, though supervision is recommended due to his energetic personality. 

Milo shares a home with two other dogs (male and female). He will be best suited in a home with another dog who wants to engage in play. He has met other dogs outside of the home and has been very friendly. 

Milo is good on a leash, though he may pull slightly when he sees other dogs. However, he quickly refocuses with treats and walks nicely by your side. He is fully housebroken. He knows the “crate” command and goes straight to it. He does well in the crate for 3-4 hours but make sure both latches are securely closed, as he’s a clever escape artist. 

He has a silly and mischievous personality. He will try to steal food/bones from the other dogs so feeding separately is advised. It is hard to find him not smiling for pictures. 

Milo loves running, playing fetch, LOVES water activities, toys and bones. After a day of play, he loves to cuddle and would love to sit in your lap if you would let him. He rides great in the car. He has done wonderful riding around on a boat too. He is very intelligent and easy to train. He loves to meet new people. He can b clumsy at times, tripping over his own feet. We think this only adds to his charm. 

We have no history with cats, but think he would want to chase them. 

Milo is looking for an active home. He needs physical outlets throughout the day. He would do well with another dog or would do fine as the only dog. He is looking for a home who will continue to provide structure and basic training. Milo is an affectionate, energetic, and playful dog who will bring joy and laughter to a loving home that can match his spirited nature!

Tulip, 4 months (estimated DOB March 2024), female, Terrier mix, estimated to be a medium size when full grown. She is in a foster home in SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS and is able to transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

This girl is sassy and always on the move! She has a big personality in a little body. She shares a home with several other puppies and adult dogs. She is always jumping on them, chasing and just being an energetic puppy. 

Tulip was saved from what we believe is a backyard breeder. Her foster mom was in a rural area helping to save some dogs on the street. She stumbled across a home where one of the adults surrendered Tulip. We are not sure why, but are grateful she is in our care. 

She is now housebroken but would not be surprised if she had a few accidents in a new home. She has spent some time crated. 

She has not been around cats or kids. We think she would do well with kids who both understand and respect animal boundaries.

She is extremely sweet and cuddly. She loves to sleep with her foster mom and was very excited when she was able to jump on the couch herself! We think she will be about 30-35 pounds when she is full grown. 

Tulip is looking for a home who has an understanding of raising puppies into adult hood. This can be prior experience or someone who will seek support as needed (training, friends/family). Puppies bring so much joy, but also need intentional and committed attention. They need help socializing with new people, other dogs, leash work and basic obedience. 

Puppies under 6 months of age are placed on a spay/neuter contract until they are old enough to be altered. 

For puppies this age, someone needs to be home more than they are away as crating them for long periods of time is not conducive for their developmental needs

Johnny, 2 years old, neutered male, Husky, 56 pounds. He is in a foster home located in SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS. He can transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

Johnny is an energetic and playful Husky with a strong personality. He loves to play hard, often engaging in a lot of jumping and running. With his high energy levels, he brings excitement and activity wherever he goes. Johnny requires an experienced owner who understands the Husky breed.

Johnny shares a home with another dog and loves to engage in vigorous play, including a lot of jumping and running. He has played with a 50 pound dog and attempted to play with a 10 pound dog, but it was too much. He does not react when seeing other dogs when walking on leash. 

He is not cat friendly. He has been around kids as young as 6 years old and also likes to play hard. We recommend a home with kids who respect and understand animal boundaries. 

Johnny is fully house broken. He does very well in his crate. He does pull when walking on leash. He has not shown any issues when taking treats or food around other dogs. 

He is solid moderate energy and is looking for an active home. He enjoys running outside in the backyard for 10-15 minutes and then relaxing indoors. He is very typical Husky who is independent and less affectionate than other dogs. 

He can be stubborn, temperamental, smart and is very playful. He plays with toys sometimes. He is very happy meeting new people and will jump up to say hello. He rides well in the car. He likes to talk a lot when it's time to eat or go outside. 

Johnny is looking for a home that understands the Husky breed, with a confident owner who won't be intimidated by his stubbornness and temperamental nature.

Daphne, 2 years old, spayed female, Cattle Dog/Terrier mix, 40 pounds. She is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and can transport out of State to an approved adopter. 

Like so many of our dogs, Daphne was on a euthanasia list at the county shelter in Houston. She is currently in a foster home with another dog. 

Daphne is a friendly and adaptable dog who quickly bonds with other dogs and enjoys playing with them, adjusting her energy level based on her companions. She is generally quiet and has low to medium energy at home, though she can be high energy and barky in certain situations. Daphne is good at reading other dogs' cues during play and gets along well with dogs of all sizes and breeds.

She enjoys playing chase and can be quite energetic, especially with dogs who match her energy level. She attends a doggy daycare a few days a week and has a great time! She is comfortable playing with all sizes and breeds, with no reported issues.

We have no history with cats. She has met and hung out with a 13 year old child (they do not live in the home) . She was initially nervous that resolved quickly into playfulness. She enjoyed the snuggles and pets. We recommend a home with kids 8 years and older. 

She walks nicely on a leash with minimal pulling, comfortable walking at your side or slightly ahead. She is fully housebroken and is initially vocal when crated alone, but does settle down. When you are home and she is crated she prefers being able to see you or to have the crate door open. 

Daphne shares toys and treats with and around her foster brother. She enjoys rope and plush toys, likes to chew on them.

She thrives in an active environment, whether indoors or outdoors; would do well in an apartment or condo with moderate activity levels.
She bonds quickly with dogs and benefits from having another dog or active family members for company.

Daphne prefers gradual introductions to new people and can be overwhelmed in busy social settings; not aggressive, but cautious and flighty. She likes car rides but needs to be secured due to moving around.

Daphne would thrive in a home where she can stay active and engaged, with opportunities for play and exercise. A family willing to provide patient introductions and steady companionship would be ideal. She enjoys affection and cuddling, especially at night.

Katy, 5yr old, spayed female, pitbull mix, 45 pounds. Katy is in a foster home in Houston, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Katy has not had the best start to her life but she does not let it get her down. Her foster describes her as the sweetest, SWEETEST pup you will ever meet. She is cuddly and affectionate, and you will fall in love with her piglet grunts. She sits and stares at you with soft, squinty eyes and showing her sweet smile. She curls up in the tightest ball ever to fit next to you, but only after pretending she’s unable to climb up on the couch or jump on the bed. Of all her foster parent’s dogs, Katy stands ahead of them all as her most favorite hands down.

Katy lives in a home with two other resident dogs but has limited interaction with them as they can be prickly, and Katy has a more assertive personality. She’s had the opportunity to play with other dogs but does not pick up well on the cues they’re done playing and tries dominating them by pinning them and standing over them. She’s never bitten but we initially would advise an only dog home, or slow introductions with a more submissive/easy-going and well-balanced dog. Her foster has been doing a lot of work with Katy to help positively socialize her and notes improvement in this area. 

Katy is moderate energy – silly with her zoomies and enjoys throwing her toys around. She enjoys long walks but is more of a couch potato who sleeps in her bed all day while her foster works. She would enjoy hikes or car rides to the vet or a park, or just being with her people. She LOVES being the center of attention and will  follow you around like a shadow. She’s curious and cuddly, silly and playful, and is most deserving of a home of her own with someone who is patient and understanding.

Katy can be a bit shy around strangers, especially when they are introduced to her in the house. Her foster has been working with her a lot and Katy has improved mightily but she will love you forever if you first meet her outside and then come into her home. 

Katy has exceptional house skills – she’s fully house trained and happy in her kennel, settling down quickly when her foster family leaves. She’s fed in her kennel and has come to associate her crate with safety and comfort. She’s not been left loose while unattended but her foster notes she probably could, as she has not demonstrated any destructive behaviors thus far. She does well on a leash and gets better every day, working on improving her loose leash walking and ignoring dogs she sees along the way.

Katy has not been around any kids but based on her excitement at receiving pets (she loves to toss her head back when cuddling and look up at you lovingly) and preference for her “things” to be left alone, we would recommend a home with older kids (10+yr). In general, we recommend homes with kids old enough to understand and respect animal behavior cues. We do not have any direct history with cats but Katy has encountered the strays in her neighborhood and watches intently, attempting to chase. If cats exist in the home, we recommend very slow introductions and supervised interactions.

Dex, 3 month old, intact male, American Staffordshire Terrier, 20 pounds. Dex is in a foster home in San Antonio, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up! Adult male pitbulls weigh 40-65 pounds when fully grown.

Puppies are placed on a spay/neuter contract until 6 months old, when they are able to be altered and their adoption finalized. Puppies this age also require someone who is home more than they are away as being crated for long periods of time is not conducive to their growth. If you are gone more than 4hrs at a time, you need to have a plan ready for their care in your absence. 

Dex and his brother, Bobby, were abandoned in an apartment lot, observed by the residents being forcibly dragged out of the truck and dumped before their "owner" sped off leaving the puppies to fend for themselves. The boys, covered in fleas and malnourished, waited there until help intervened. Thankfully, due to fosters stepping up, we were able to save both boys and change the course of their fate.

Dex lives in a home with resident and foster dogs all his size or bigger (10-15lbs up to 40lbs), and is very active, as you would expect from a young pup. He enjoys wresting and playing, and can sometimes be too much for the older resident dogs, although the other foster and Dex get along like gangbusters. He takes redirection well and knows when to settle down or leave his siblings alone, and continues to improve on reading their cues every day.

Dex is still learning leash and house skills, and his new home should be willing to continue investing time and training in these areas. He's not had much experience on the leash and still darts around like a little madman when first leashed up, but he does settle down into an easy walk after some time. He's not yet house trained but does use potty pads and will not poop in the house. He follows the lead of his canine siblings and goes outside to potty, but does still have regular accidents in the house that crating helps. Dex is crated when his foster is at work and at night, and does well overall.

Dex is fed away from the other dogs not because he is food aggressive but because he's a voracious eater and will sneak away to steal the other's food. He loves treats and toys, and is a good sharer. 

His foster mom describes him as very affectionate, super smart, playful and silly, and independent and curious. He does not need another dog in the home but should have plenty of opportunities - whether play dates, dog parks or doggy day care - to continue his positive socialization. 

His ideal home would have kids to chase him around and cuddle when he's ready for naps and be fairly active. He will need lots of physical and mental stimulation to burn off that puppy energy and ensure he does not develop any bad habits due to boredom.

We have no history with cats, but Dex has been around his foster's young (3yo) grandchild and did excellent - no jumping or nipping, just sweet affection and respect for their respective sizes. In general, we recommend homes with kids over the age of 10yrs or those who can understand and will respect animal behavior cues.

We really do not want to waste anyone's time if you are not serious about adopting this dog.

MEET KIERSTEN

Kiersten is a 5 YR old, 52 lb, spayed female, American Bulldog Mix. She is in a foster home in Houston, TX. She can be transported to an approved adopter. 

Your new cuddle buddy Kiersten would be the perfect addition to any home. She loves to play with both dogs and humans and still gets the zoomies in the evening. She's a happy girl who sticks by her people and aims to please. She enjoys walks and still has lots of pep in her step. She's medium energy and gets two walks a day and some play time. She loves to play tug or fetch! Once she knows you're her person, this girl melts into you and is the sweetest thing. 

When initially meeting Kiersten, she may be a bit shy but one pet from you and she'll be your new best friend. Her sweet, playful, and obedient demeanor make her an excellent dog for new or experienced owners alike. She grows very attached and loves her people. We believe she'd make an excellent dog for a family with older kids as she gets happy bursts of energy that may not be suited for younger kids. She has been around children ages 5-13 yrs and did well with them. Sometimes, she can be a bit mouthy when playing but stops when corrected. 

Kiersten loves other dogs. She loves to play hard but is good at adapting to the play style of the other dogs and has no issues picking up on ques. She's generally very sweet and submissive with both dogs and humans. She has played with dogs both big and small. When she sees other dogs she gets very happy and excited and wants to say "HI!" but if you need to redirect her from them on walks, she's happy to keep walking with you. We do not know how she is with cats at this time, but think she might have a good temperament to be around one. 

Sweetie Kiersten is the ideal good girl. She takes direction very well and is not destructive in the house. Her foster family is able to leave her in the home uncrated with no issues. This girl is totally housebroken! She's currently not crate trained, but that has not appeared necessary due to her excellent behavior. We have also not observed any food aggression issues with her. 

The ideal home for Kiersten is one where she gets to play and get lots of love and cuddles from her humans. She'd do wonderfully in a home with other dogs and would love to join a loving family where she can be loved forever.

Auroral 1.5 years old, spayed female, Pitbull mix, 42 pounds. She is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and can transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 


Aurora and her 7 puppies were found on the streets of Houston. They were taken to the county shelter where they eventually found themselves at risk for euthanasia. A foster home stepped up to save them all! Aurora was very skinny when we first took her into care and has really filled out with proper care. She is a young dog who was probably a mom long before she should have been. 

Aurora is a lively dog with a zest for play and a heart full of affection. Her play style with other dogs is exuberant and vigorous, often involving chasing and wrestling with dogs of similar size, typically around 40-60 lbs. She's not one to back down from a rough-and-tumble play session, and she enjoys the company of other energetic pups. She can come on strong in her play and is best suited for other dogs who are balanced in their playstyle. 

When it comes to her energy level, Aurora is an excited girl. She's always raring to go and loves engaging in activities that keep her moving and entertained. 

Aurora's interactions with other dogs are generally friendly and enthusiastic. She wags her tail and eagerly pulls towards them in a welcoming manner. However, she may need some guidance in recognizing when another dog has had enough, as she might not immediately sense when it's time to dial down the playfulness. 

She's a work in progress when it comes to leash manners but responds well to guidance and training. She likes to pull to greet either people or other dogs. In terms of house and crate training. 

We have no history with cats or kids. We recommend a home with kids 10 years and older. 

Aurora is generally well-behaved but may indulge in chewing on furniture or objects when she's bored. Providing her with plenty of toys to chew on helps keep her entertained and prevents destructive behavior. She's crated when no one's home, typically for around 4 hours at a time, and she settles down after a brief period of protest.

Aurora's ideal home would be with an active family who can keep up with her energy and provide plenty of opportunities for play and exercise. While she's affectionate and loves cuddling up with her humans, she also needs outlets for her energy levels, such as outdoor activities and playtime with toys. Training to help her learn to be calmer and more mindful of boundaries would be beneficial, along with a household that understands her need for space and attention.

Hope, 2 years old, spayed female, Retriever mix, 42 pounds. She is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and can transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

Hope's story is really why we rescue. Her foster mom was driving to the airport in Houston when something caught her eye off the highway. She still does not know why she pulled over, but she did. This side of the highway was covered in trash- clearly a dumping ground. She walked around and spotted a dog (Hope) sitting on top of a crate with two puppies inside. She immediately called for help and the whole family was moved into a temporary foster until she returned from her trip. 

Hope is a resilient dog and we are excited to find her an adoptive home. Both of her puppies have already been adopted. Hopefully it does not surprise you that upon meeting new people Hope will give out a bark. This can happen when her foster's friends or family come over or out on a walk. She needs some reassurance, baby talk or some treats and she learns quickly you are a friend. She is not mean acting and we know she does this because she is just unsure. 

She now shares a foster home with two other adult resident dogs. She is always wanting to play and loves other dogs. Her foster mom thinks she trusts dogs more than she does people. She is can be fairly active when first meeting and has come a long way in her manners and picking up on ques. We anticipate in a new home she will need some time to adjust to any resident dogs. She will be best suited for another playful dog. 

As noted above, when she is walking by herself she is more uncomfortable passing people/dogs she does not know. When walking with her four legged friends, it's clear she feels more at ease. She does tend to pull on leash and will need continued practice in this area. 

We do not think she is cat friendly. She has not been around kids, so we suggest a home with kids 10 years and older. She can get the zoomies and have spurts of energy. 

Hope is fully housebroken and really loves her crate. She has not shown any issues with food or treats around the other dogs or with humans. She is playful, silly and affectionate once she has time to know you. She LOVES bones and toys that are food dispensers. She would really love to cuddle 24/7 if you let her. She rides great in the car- jumps in and seems to enjoy the ride. 

She was a great mom to her puppies- protecting them until they were rescued. One of her puppies had a vision impairment and she helped her navigate. She is obsessed with belly rubs. Hope is looking for a home with another dog to keep her company and build her confidence. She would love a home who is active and will be patient with her as she navigates new faces and surroundings.

Max, 1.5 years old, neutered male, Pitbull mix, 53 pounds. He is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and can transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

Max was rescued from an overcrowded shelter in Houston. He had this really long tail that did not fit his body and was causing "happy tail." This basically means in all of his excitement his tail would hit anything in site causing it to bleed. The tail is never able to heal and after consulting with a vet we had part of his tail amputated. He has recovered well, but his hair is still growing back on that area. 

Max spent some recovery time in a boarding facility where he ran his heart out with other dogs. He met allll kinds of dogs- big and little, male and female. He loves to play and run around. There is another dog in the foster home. She tends to be really forward with new dogs and this has made Max a little scared. He does great on walks with her, but in the house he tends to keep his distance. We think he would love another dog to match his personality or would also be okay as the only dog too. 

As you can imagine, given his younger age he is an energetic guy. He is looking for a home with moderate physical outlets. He enjoys his walks and playtime with his foster parents. He is friendly when passing other dogs on leash. 

He has come across cats out walking and appears curious. He has not lunged or tried to run after them, but we can't speak to how he would do in a home setting. We have no history with kids and recommend a home with kids 10 years and older. 

Max walks okay on leash and will pull when he wants to sniff things. He is housebroken and does well when crated. 

He is a curious and playful dog. He can get a little scared of loud noises or sudden movements. He loves to play fetch and chew on stuffed toys. He rides well in the car, is generally a happy guy always wagging his now nub and excited to see his people.

Flor, 6 years old, spayed female, Bulldog mix, 85 pounds. She is in a foster home in Houston, Texas and is able to transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

We will first note that this girl has been on a weigh loss program with her foster mom haha. She has another 10 pounds or so to go, so will need a home that will continue to monitor her food intake. 

Flor is incredibly friendly and happy to socialize with any human- big or small. Her foster parents had a small house party and she did so great meeting a lot of new people. She has been around kids as young as 10 years old and loved all the pets and scratches. We always recommend homes with kids who both understand and respect animal boundaries. 

Flor was previously in a foster home where she did fine with the other dogs. Unfortunately, she was left out unsupervised and when that foster came home found that one of the resident dogs had attacked her. She immediately received vet care and was moved to a new foster home. Due to this, we have had her assessed with a trainer to see if there were any repercussions regarding her attitude towards other dogs. She did really well meeting other dogs. Our trainer noted she was tense/nervous at first, but quickly adapted and great skills. He noted she will do best with slow introductions and around another dog who is confident. 

Her current foster home does not have other dogs. She has met dogs out on walks and even had one stranger ask if their dog could play with her. She was very sweet and did really well. We want to add slow introductions look like initial separation and having the dogs only interact on walks over the first few days. From there, you continue to monitor until you feel comfortable with off leash interactions. She has not shown any aggression and does not react negatively to new dogs. 

We do not think she is cat friendly based on her running to chase and bark after stray cats in the backyard/neighborhood. 

Flor will initially pull on leash and stops after a little while. She really really loves walking. Our hope is her forever home would enjoy walks with her too. She is crated when her foster parents are out of the house and does well. She is fully housebroken. We have found that she prefers her water bowl is inside her crate otherwise she doesn't drink water. Not surprising, she is very excited for treats and can be a little over excited when taking them from your hand. Her foster mom makes her wait and encourages her to take them gently. 

She tends to match whatever energy her people have. Her current home is lower energy and she does just great. Her foster mom thinks if another home was more active, she would have no issue keeping up. She rides really really well in the car. She is SUPER affectionate. 

Her foster mom says this about her, "Flor is a super silly, sweet, loving girl, she is independent  and loves to be with her humans. She will be your shadow."  She loves belly rubs and picks up on things very quickly. When she is really exited she hops like a bunny or tap dances!

Candace, 6 months (estimated DOB 11/2023), spayed female, Retriever mix, 
currently weighs 30 pounds so estimated to be large size when full grown. She is currently in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and can transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

Candace and her brother were supposed to be with a short term stay with one of our fosters through her local shelter. She asked us if we could help network them so here we are :)

We are not sure everything that Candace is mixed with! We do think she will be larger once she is full grown. She is an energetic and active puppy. 

Candace shares a foster home with her brother and several other adult dogs. She absolutely needs a home that is able to engage her physically. She should have another dog companion for her to continue to learn and develop her social skills. 

She is housetrained but will note she has access to the outside and is not left unsupervised. Her foster mom has not seen any accidents. She does well when crated. We anticipate in a new home some struggles in these areas. We always want a patient home who will work with her through that transition. She has not had much leash training, so will need some work in that area. She rides well in the car. She LOVES water and if it's deep enough he will be in it! 

Candace is an explorer and more outgoing in that way than her brother. Her foster home has a large space for her to check things out. She does like affection and will cuddle with you on the couch. 

There are cats in the current foster home and she was actually a little scared of them.  She tends to steer clear and leaves them alone. She has not been around kids and we think she would do fine. We always recommend a home with kids who understand and respect animal boundaries. A home who understands she is a puppy who may jump up or knock into you and is still learning. 


For puppies this age, someone needs to be home more than they are away as crating them for long periods of time is not conducive for their developmental needs.

Sport, 2 years old, neutered male, Black Mouth Cur/Retriever mix, 70 pounds. He is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and able to transport out of State once an adopter is approved. 

This guy is such a lover who loves BIG. He was saved from euthanasia at a county shelter in Houston. We are so grateful we had a foster home for him! He shares a home with other dogs and has spent time playing at a local dog park. He plays really well with other dogs and is super friendly. The foster home has two small dogs under 30 pounds and he is great with them. He would do great in a home with another dog or would be okay without a dog. 

Imagine Sport has a big puppy- he is a little bit awkward as he runs and moves around. He has spurts of energy (zoomies) and then crashes out for awhile. He has no idea he is not a lap dog and would love if you would hold him. He loves his stuffed animals and does not shred them as much as he likes to carry them around. He is such a happy, go lucky boy. 

He has meet cats and kittens while they were in carriers at the vet office. He casually sniffed and wagged his tail. We will note, he has not been in a home with a cat, so this is the extent of our information regarding cats.  He shares a foster home with kids ages 8-14 years old and LOVES them. They also have friends who come over to visit and he is always excited to say hello. His foster mom describes him as a "big pillow and snuggle buddy." 

Sport is learning to not jump out of excitement when first meeting you. He is very smart and learns quickly. He does pull on leash and could use more work in this area. He is fully housebroken and does fine when crated. 
 
Sport is looking for a home who will engage with him- this could be by having another dog or providing outlets physical outlets. He is a curious, attentive and outgoing dog. He is extremely cuddly and affectionate. He rides well in the car and enjoys going places. We hope you give this guy with a huge heart an opportunity to become a part of your family!

Venus, 5yr old spayed female, labrador retriever/hound mix, 50 pounds. Venus is in a foster home in Houston, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Venus proves that even older dogs have tons of spunk and life in them! Her foster describes her as one of the most energetic dogs she's met and would thrive in a home with a canine sibling. She plays with lots of dogs at the dog park and gets along with every one, all at least her weight or much larger. She keeps up with the   Bellas and Buddys, but does forget to read their cues of being done playing. 

Venus is leash, house and crate trained to much success. She hasn't had any issues meeting other dogs on a leash but will pull and whine to go say hello. She pulls on the leash but is easily redirected home; a Gentle Leader head collar or harness may help with leash skills in lieu of training, which is always a good idea. Venus has not had any accidents in the house and is often curled up napping when her foster is at home. She usually stays crated when unable to be supervised because she loves nothing more than re-making the bed for her foster mom, tossing pillows and blankets to and 'fro. Venus does have some separation anxiety (she pants and paces, barks and howls) when left alone so crating has been super helpful to her foster mom. 

Venus has not been around kids but given her energy and constant movement, she would likely do best in a home with kids over the age of 10yrs. She occasionally scratches out of playful excitement and may inadvertently knock over a young child. No matter the age, we recommend homes with kids who can understand and will respect animal behavior cues. Venus is not good with cats. 

Venus is overall smart, playful, curious and silly. She love attention and if she doesn’t get enough, she demand it in a sweet and playful manner. She loves tennis balls and ropes for tug of war, often losing herself in play and forgetting other dogs are around. She is the most cuddly and affectionate dog ever, and loves meeting new people. She treats each new person as a new friend she's just not kissed yet. She loves to jump up for cuddles and affection (if you let her), car rides, and exploring like the adventurous girl she is.

She would be perfect for someone with a backyard and children. She is not an outside dog and is most comfortable sleeping on the bed underneath the blankets. She needs a lot of attention but she will not act out if she does not get it

Hi I'm Faith! They named me that because I was rescued on Thanksgiving-Eve and had my puppies the very next day. It was really cold out in the parking lot but I believed I would make it through. A Good Sam took pitty on me as I was in early labor and struggling to find a play to deliver. I had 15 pups and 12 of my babies survived.  I've now raised my babies and I have faith that I'll get my forever home soon...

I'm incredibly sweet and affectionate, and I get along with other dogs. I'm also housetrained. I'm about 50 lbs and the vet said I'm about a year and a half old. 

Friends Fur Life Rescue found great homes for all of them (except one who is with me still waiting) and they got me to the vet so I'm in tip-top shape now! I'm spayed and my belly is nice and flat now (unlike in my profile picture lol). 

Can I join your family? You won't be disappointed! Please fill out my rescue's form today and my people will give you a call!

https://sites.google.com/view/friendsfurlife/adoption-application

Thank you for reading! I'm in Texas but my rescue will send me to your city. Looking forward to hearing from you!

MANGO is a 50 lb, 2.5 yr old, neutered Bull Terrier mix who is currently in a foster home in Houston, TX. He can be transported once his adoption is approved! 

Mango is a fun, sweet love bug who's searching for his forever home! 
He loves cuddles on the couch where he can put your head on your legs or chest and just snooze on you. When not sitting at your feet while you cook, Mango loves to chew, zoom around with his plush toys and chase balls around the room. His love languages are touch and quality time. 

Mango is a medium energy dog who is very good at entertaining himself with chews. His favorite game is fetch, which he plays at expert level which includes catching, bringing back, and releasing the ball gently in your hand.  He's also a scholar and has completed obedience training. He knows "sit," "down," "paw," and "drop it."

Mango does not currently live in a home with other dogs but has met dogs on walks and does well. He can relax in their presence and wait patiently while the humans finish chatting and for the walk to resume. Typically, Mango ignores other dogs on walks but is certainly curious when the other dog seems excited to meet. He tends to match the other dogs' energy when he sees them on walks, but is not concerned with dogs that lunge or growl and chooses to ignore them. Otherwise, Mango is a calm walker and does not typically wander all over the place (unless the smell is REALLY good). He also keeps pace on short runs with his foster mom and seems to enjoy running with her. 

Because he does not live with other dogs, Mango's play style was assessed by a trainer. He can be very excited to see other dogs and play with them off leash, and would do well slowly acclimatizing to other dogs in the home. He did well over time with gentle corrections and was better at picking up on ques as time went on while in his training assessment. 

Mango is both crate and house trained. He currently sleeps in his crate, although we think he would love to have a home where he sleeps with you with his paws always touching, but, if not, he knows how to sleep quietly and peacefully in his crate until you let him out in the morning. He's crated when his mom is not home. He generally knows what dog toys are and doesn't try to play with household items. For exercise, he generally only asks for one walk a day and a game of fetch, but would benefit from two if you have the time. 

Mango is fed in his crate to help create positive associations with it. He jumps for joy when his food comes out. He gobbles it up, so currently he's eating from a slow feeder. 

We recommend a home with older kids for Mango, although we do not have a history with children. Currently, he sometimes likes to jump when excited, although he has shown some improvement in that regard. When he gets his zoomies, or jumps he can be boisterous and could possibly knock over small kids. He's a very gentle soul, but his excitement can get the better of him. 

Mango would love a home where he can cuddle his humans and be showered with affection. Touch and play are his love languages and his happy tail would win anyone's heart. He has done well meeting strangers and he's been patiently waiting for the right forever home to find him. 


We do not have a history with cats.

If someone other than yourself is part of the decision making process, please make sure you have spoken with them and they are on board. We really do not want to waste anyone's time if you are not serious about adopting this dog.

Junior, 1.5yr old neutered male, Siberian Husky mix, 65 pounds. Junior is in a foster home in Houston, TEXAS and can transport out of state once an approved adopter is lined up!

Junior has had a rough, unfortunate and rocky start to his short life but all that is behind him now with only brighter days ahead. He lasted an unprecedented 40 days in the city shelter before landing on the euth list so when we say Junior is one of the more chill huskies you'll ever meet, we mean it!

Junior has been around dogs of his same size and bigger, from bull terriers to Danes, and he keeps up with them all. He plays rough like a puppy, boxes with his front paws, and humps when he gets the chance. He play bows and chases the dogs around the yard, and is learning when to leave the other dogs alone, although he has not yet mastered the social cues. Junior absolutely needs a playmate - he doesn't have to be the only dog or have a sibling but he needs to continue his positive socialization around other dogs, and would be great for doggy day care, play dates or parks.

Junior does pretty well on a leash and absolutely loves going for walks. He knows the word and gets excited when he sees the leash come out. He starts out wiggly and pulls a bit when excited but it is nothing out of the ordinary and that training cannot fix. 

Junior has seen cats while on walks and doesn't seem to want to chase them but we do not have enough history to say whether he is cat friendly. He's encountered kids in the neighborhood playing on the other side of the fence and is very interested in saying hello. We think he'd be best suited for a family with older kids simply because he is still a puppy himself and likes to jump or slap with his paws. 
 
As a young man, Junior still needs to improve on a few things - he jumps, throws paws, counter surfs, and is a Grade A beggar. Even still, he knows sit and a few other commands, and is a quick learner. He's extremely well behaved in his kennel and is quiet except when he needs to go out to potty. He's fully house trained and hasn't had any accidents in the house. 

Junior is fed separate from the other dogs in the home as a general rule of his foster. He's not shown any signs of resource guarding or food aggression, and happily shares his treats and toys. He loves going to the toy bin and finding a new/different toy to shake the stuffing out of or toss about. Junior is still a pup and full of that youthful energy but he settles well, lying on the  floor next to you or entertaining himself with a toy.

His foster describes Junior as shy and clingy, but says he's working on his confidence. He is slow to warm up but once he's gotten use to you, he is super cuddly and affectionate, and has no sense of personal space. He makes coming home at the end of the day the best experience ever, as he is giddy and bursting with silly, goofy delight to see you.

Junior's ideal home would be a single individual or older couple who will make him the center of their world, babying him and taking him on adventures. He is slow to warm up to men and does not like people sneaking up from behind him or moving too quickly, nor does he take well to harsh/strong correction - it all scares him too much. Junior is very loving and loyal to his people and he relies on his family to make him secure if he is unsure. He is a Velcro pup and bonds tightly.

description:
******Please note, once completing the initial screen you will be connected with the placement for a video chat. Transports run every few weeks and we will have the dog on the next available transport once approved. If you are not able to accept a dog until a specific time period, please apply at that time************
