Luigi, 7 months (approximate DOB March 2023), neutered male, Hound/Retriever mix (taking our best guess), currently 42 pounds but not full grown. He is located in a foster home in Houston, Texas and can transport out of State to an approved adopter. 

So many of our dogs have "stories" before they come into rescue. Luigi and his two siblings were thrown out of a moving car. Another one of our foster homes witnessed it happen and immediately took them in. She was not able to keep them, so we moved them to their current home. We never understand why people do some of the things they do. Thankfully, none of the puppies were harmed and are currently happy and healthy. 

Luigi is a typical puppy who has spurts of energy and then naps or chills out for awhile. He is not fully housebroken and has a few accidents from time to time. He does okay when crated. His foster mom uses one of those pens so he has more space to move around. 

He is very friendly with other dogs and we think would really benefit from another dog in the home. This will help him continue his positive social skills and another dog will help teach him the ropes. 

We have no history with cats. He has been around kids and is very sweet. He will jump up. We always recommend homes with kids who understand and are respectful of animal boundaries. 

He is incredibly sweet and cuddly. He is always carrying something in his mouth. He has a soft happy whine he makes. He really really loves soft toys to carry around. 

Luigi will need continued work walking on leash. He is looking for a home who is excited for the joys and challenges a puppy brings. A home who is committed to providing structure and basic obedience. 


For puppies this age, someone needs to be home more than they are away as crating them for long periods of time is not conducive for their developmental needs. This means if you work outside of the house more than 4 hours a day, you need to indicate on the application who will be home to let him out to potty.

Rex, 3.5 years old, neutered male, Pitbull mix, 40 pounds. He is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and can transport out of State to an approved adopter. We are partnering with his rescue, Blue River Animal Rescue. 

Rex was adopted as a young dog and then returned to the city shelter in Houston two years later. He had been chained outside in the adopter's yard. Unfortunately he was under socialized with other animals. 

Rex is a true GEM. He has so so much love to give and loves people so much. He also gives unending and unstoppable kisses. He is very people friendly. He would need to be your only pet, but don’t let that stop you from reading further. ?

Despite Rex's past, he has shown a dog's resiliency, forgiveness and unconditional love. He was saved from the shelter’s euthanasia list, stayed in boarding for 7 months, and finally came to us in Feb 2023. In his time with us, he has met several friends of ours and stolen everyone’s heart!?

Rex knows sit and down, is doing great with “Place”. He is crate and potty trained, is very food motivated and learns quickly. He is a very happy, low-maintenance boy who enjoys some activity, as well as snoozing while we work during the day. He is fairly quiet with not a lot of barking. 

He recently completed a 3 week training stay with one of our trainers and did really well. We would be happy to chat more about this and include his trainer in any conversation. 

Rex is incredibly deserving of a home of his own. He is great with big and little people. He wants to shower you with love.  Are you ready to give Rex a home?

Greenley, 4 years old, spayed female, Pitbull Terrier mix, 44 pounds. She is in a foster home in HOUSTON, TEXAS and can transport to another state once an adopter is approved. 

Greenley and her puppies were rescued from euthanasia after being at the county shelter in Houston. Yes, the whole family was at risk of being put down! A wonderful family took them all in. Two of her puppies are still looking for homes and the other four have been adopted. She's been a really great mom to her pups and has always been super affectionate to humans around her pups. 

She also shares a home with two adult dogs. She is energetic and wants to play with them. She does a lot of play bowing and wrestling. If there is another dog in the home, she needs one who enjoys and will engage in play. 

There is a cat, rabbit and parrot in the house. She is kept separated from these pets with no issue, but we do not trust her to be unsupervised with them. 

She has been around teenagers and has done well. She really loves to cuddle. She will jump up when excited (not onto you, but straight up into the air). We recommend a home with kids 10 years and older. 

Greenley generally walks calmly on leash. She will get distracted, but you can easily draw her attention with a treat. She is crate trained and housebroken. 

She is looking for a moderately active home. She would love to go on walks, trails, hikes etc. She has some bursts of energy and then chills out for awhile. She absolutely LOVES water! She is fairly calm when in the house and shows more energy when out in the yard. She is very food motivated and eager to please. 

Her favorite toys are ones with squeakers. She is very affectionate and loving with her humans. She is happy to meet new people and greets them with tail wags. She is a little nervous when first riding in the car, but quickly settles in. 

She would do great with another playful dog or would do great as the only pet. She is really looking for people who are affectionate and cuddly with her. She would also love a house with a hose to play in/with! She gets super excited and dances when you come into the room even if it’s only been a minute. She will talk to you if she feels she needs more attention.

He deserves a family that will include him in daily activities and make him the center of their family.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Pearl is a sweet girl that like to lounge around and play with squeaky toys. She loves attention from her people and loves to run and chase the rabbits in the yard.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Latke lost the only home he has ever known since he was 11 weeks old through no fault of his own. He just wants to be with people and is an absolute sweetheart. He is good dogs, cats and kids, although he doesn't really play. He makes a nice walking companion, is house trained, crate trained and is trustworthy when left alone in the home. He would enjoy a quiet home where he can enjoy your company and get lots of love and pets!Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Celeste is a young girl who is good with dogs, cats, older kids and always ready to play. She is working on her house training but has been keeping a vey tidy kennel lately! She could use some leash training as well as some other basic obedience training as she continues to grow.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Roxie is a total sweetheart. She was a favorite at the shelter and could be counted on to play nicely with all the dogs there. Roxie is such a lover of people and wants to be near her human and hang out. She also loves other dogs and has been great around dogs of all temperaments. She prefers not to share a home with cats. Roxie responds well to a few commands, is good in her crate and is house trained. She is going to make someone such a great forever buddy.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Cormac has a zest for life. He loves to play so much that he will army crawl in flowers to entertain himself.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Ophelia is a young girl who can be a bit shy at first but then becomes quite goofy and loveable as you get to know her. She is better with confident dogs, as a nervous girl herself, it's best to have another dog around who isn't so shy. She was curious about her most recent fosters cats. Playful enough that she would most likely do fine in a home with cats in the future. Ophelia would also most likely do best with respectful toddlers if not just kids 5 and up. She is working very hard on her house and leash training. She does well in her crate, especially after a good romp around to get some energy out. Foster said she slept through the night when crated with no accidents. All in all, Ophelia is a great pup and will make a terrific companion.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Stan is handsome, walks nicely on a leash and is a sweetheart of a dog! He is a local boy so we do not know about his history, but he has never met a stranger. He will greet with a smile and a wag. He does well in playgroup and is crate trained. Come meet this happy boy and fall in love!Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Vinny loves to go for walks, hikes and play fetch!. Once he gets his exercise in for the day, he will chill and hang in the house. He can be selective with his dog friends and probably would do best as the only pet. He is fully house trained and crate trained and looking for a new human best friend.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Mia is a sweet girl who is good with dogs and kids. She is housebroken, crate trained, walks well on a leash and is happy to go on adventures or snuggle time. She learns things really quickly and eager to do so, she is ready for a family of her own.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

breeds_label: Labrador Retriever & Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler Mix
description: Camilla is Good with dogs and kids. Crate trained. Rides well in a car.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Nyla would love to be part of a family. She is just learning how to play with other dogs and is good with adults. She loves to play with toys and go for walks. She is a happy girl with a big smile to show it. She loves car rides and would be a great addition to a family with kids.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Herman is a real fun guy who we are still getting to know, but so far seems to love everyone he meets! Once he's settled in we will introduce him to some doggy friends! He will need a proper introduction to cats if/ when he were to go home with one in the family. He keeps a clean kennel.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Buddy is still all puppy! Put him with a pile of toys and he is so happy! He is good with adults and dogs and doesn't bother cats. He loves to play with other dogs that can keep up with his play style, but is also just happy hanging with his humans or chewing a bone. He walks great with a harness and loves to just sniff around and enjoys romping in a doggie pool. This handsome boy has been here for 7 weeks just waiting for someone to fall in love with him!Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

Cream was abandoned in the town of Dewitt.  This senior pup would love a home to live out his senior days and have a family to love.

description:

Sweet Dayna came to us after her owner had found themselves houseless and needed to do the right thing for their pup. She is a very shy, under socialized puppy, but once she trusts you she is a completely different dog. She is sweet, affectionate, and eager to please. In her short time with us at the shelter she has blossomed with our staff and volunteers exponentially. We are so proud of her and cant wait to see the wonderful lady she will grow up to be! We think for now, she would do best in a home with kids aged 10 and up

If you are interested in Dayna, fill out an application on our website.  Or email frontdesk1@cnyspca.org.

Are you looking for a furry companion who is full of joy and love? Look no further than Zero, the adorable 15-pound dog who is sure to steal your heart with his playful antics and sweet nature.

Zero is the epitome of happiness in a small package. Despite his petite size, he has a big personality that shines through in everything he does. His playful demeanor will bring a smile to your face and warmth to your heart. Whether he's chasing his tail in the yard or cuddling up on the couch, Zero is always ready for fun and affection.

If you have other small pets at home, Zero is the perfect companion for them. He gets along great with small dogs and cats, making him a wonderful addition to a multi-pet household. While Zero is a social butterfly with small dogs and cats, he can be a bit intimidated by bigger dogs. We do not recommend him living with large dogs.

One of the best things about Zero is that he is already leash trained and housetrained. This means you can enjoy long walks in the park with him without any hassle, and you won't have to worry about accidents in the house. Zero is a well-behaved pup who is ready to fit right into your daily routine.

For Pet's Sake Rescue is a Mississippi based rescue. All animals are currently in MS. Mississippi is overpopulated with too many animals, not enough adopters, and many high kill shelters. For Pet's Sake Rescue saves each animal from a different background. 

***Breed input is required for each platform but is not guaranteed to be accurate. We do not DNA test. We rescue animals from different situations.We discuss breed assignments with our vets to label them as accurately as possible.***

For Pet's Sake Rescue transports animals to other states for better adoption potential. Our goal is to keep animals alive and out of kennels into their forever homes as quickly as possible. Each animal is quarantined and vetted during their time in our care. Each adopted pet is spayed/neutered, vaccinated, dewormed, microchipped and has current flea treatment unless otherwise noted. 

You can visit our website at www.forpetssakerescue.org for our full adoption process and adoption application. Once we review your application and check your vet reference, we will contact you to proceed. If both parties agree to the adoption, we will send you an Adoption Contract with an invoice. Once the invoice is paid, your pet is "on hold" for you to pick up or we can transport the pet to a designated location closer to you via transport. Transports are arranged for specific dates. We will discuss these dates and locations with you during the initial phone call. 

We are currently unable to adopt pets to ME and RI residents.

Any of our adoptable animals can be transported unless otherwise noted in their profile. View all of our adopted animals at www.forpetssakerescue.org

Are you looking to add a furry friend to your family? Look no further, because Trudy is the perfect companion for you! This 4-year-old female dog is a bundle of joy waiting to bring happiness into your home.

Trudy is the epitome of a well-rounded dog despite her difficult beginning in a hoarding lifestyle. She is up to date on all her shots, spayed, house trained, and even kennel trained. This means you can skip the hassle of training and focus on building a bond with this lovely pup.

One of the best things about Trudy is her friendly nature. She gets along great with other dogs and cats, making her a perfect fit for multi-pet households. Trudy also adores kids, so you can rest assured that she will be a gentle and loving companion for your little ones.

Trudy is around 50lbs, making her a perfect size for both indoor and outdoor activities. Whether you're looking for a cuddle buddy on the couch or a playmate in the backyard, Trudy is up for anything.

For Pet's Sake Rescue is a Mississippi based rescue. All animals are currently in MS. Trudy can be transported to Albany, NY. Mississippi is overpopulated with too many animals, not enough adopters, and many high kill shelters. For Pet's Sake Rescue saves each animal from a different background.

Meet Zi, a sweet 2-year-old pup who has been patiently waiting for her forever home in a boarding kennel. Zi is a special dog with a lot of love to give, but she comes with some unique needs that make finding the right match crucial.

Zi is a loving and affectionate dog who adores humans. She thrives on attention and companionship, and is always eager to shower her human friends with her playful demeanor. Despite her friendly nature, Zi struggles to get along with other dogs and cats. This makes it challenging for her to find a home where she can be the center of attention.

Zi's journey has not been an easy one. She ended up in the boarding kennel. While she has been well cared for at the kennel, it's not the same as having a loving family to call her own. Zi longs for a home where she can feel safe, secure, and loved unconditionally.

Zi may have some challenges when it comes to interacting with other animals, but her love for humans knows no bounds. She is loyal, affectionate, and eager to please. With the right training and guidance, Zi has the potential to flourish in a loving home environment.

If you are considering adding a furry friend to your family and are willing to provide Zi with the love and attention she deserves, please consider adopting her. While Zi may not be the perfect fit for every household, she is a special dog who deserves a chance at a happy and fulfilling life.

Zi is currently in Mississippi. She can be transported to Albany, NY

Adoption Fee $450
Transport Fee $150
Health Certificate $50

Are you ready to add some sunshine to your life? Meet Cloud, the happy-go-lucky puppy with boundless energy and a heart full of love. Currently boarding at a vet office due to lack of space, Cloud is eagerly waiting for his forever family to come and take him home.

Cloud is not just any ordinary puppy - he is a ray of sunshine on four legs. With his wagging tail and playful demeanor, he is sure to bring endless joy and laughter into your life. Whether he's chasing after a ball or cuddling up for some belly rubs, Cloud's energy and enthusiasm are contagious.

One of Cloud's best qualities is his friendly and sociable nature. He gets along famously with other dogs, making him the perfect companion for your furry friends. Not to mention, Cloud is great with children too, making him an ideal family pet.

If you're looking for a furry friend who will always be by your side, look no further than Cloud. Whether you're going for a run in the park or curling up on the couch for a movie night, Cloud will be there, ready to shower you with love and affection. His loyalty knows no bounds, and he is sure to become an integral part of your family in no time.

If you're ready to open your heart and home to Cloud, now is the perfect time to make a difference in his life. By adopting Cloud, you not only gain a loyal and loving companion but also give him the chance.

Cloud is currently located in Mississippi. He can be transported to Albany, NY. Please email us for additional information or go to www.forpetssakerescue.org for an application.

$450 adoption fee
$150 transport fee
$50 health certificate

Are you looking for a furry addition to your family who is great with children and other dogs? Look no further than Miles, the adorable 5-month-old puppy who is full of energy and love. Miles is the perfect companion for families looking for a playful and friendly pet to join their household. 



Miles is not just your average puppy - he is a social butterfly who loves to interact with children and other dogs. His friendly nature makes him a great fit for families with young kids or other pets. Whether it's running around in the backyard or snuggling up on the couch, Miles is always up for some fun and companionship.



While Miles is already great with children and dogs, he could benefit from some basic training to help him become the best companion he can be. With his love for running and playing, Miles is eager to learn new tricks and commands. Training him will not only strengthen your bond with him but also help him develop good behavior and manners. Miles is food motivated, treats are his lifeline.

Gorgeous Greta is a 2 yr old German Shepherd mix girl who is good with dogs, cats, and kids of all ages. 

Greta is highly intelligent, and extremely affectionate big baby, who is also very obedient, housebroken, and easily trainable. She loves car rides and is very smart passenger. 

Greta loves humans and will snuggle with them at any given chance. She lives with both doggies and kitties, and does well with both. But she can be an only dog as she really is more about humans than her furry companion. Her foster parents love her and think she will make an amazing addition. 

Greta rode out Hurricane Beryl like a champ, with no anxiety.  

She loves bellyrubs, and cuddles. She has zoomies every now and then, because she gets so happy when her foster parents come home from work. 

German shepherd experience is mandatory to adopt our GSDs. 

Greta is 2 yo, currently weighs 72 lbs, fully vaccinated, spayed, microchipped. and heartworm negative. She is kept on heartworm and flea preventative. 

She is being fostered in Texas, but can travel to many states and even Canada. 

To meet this adorable pup, please send a completed application via www.savesomesouls.com 

Yards must be fully and adequately fenced, to be considered for our pups. We do not accept electric or underground fences.

Salt is an affectionate, silly, loveable 1.5 year old Pointer/Labrador Retriever mix who is the definition of a velcro dog. This 55lb medium sized boy just wants to be by your side getting loved on all day every day! One of his favorite things to do is go outside and roll around on the mesh dog cots we have here. It must feel pretty good, because he always makes a series of hilarious grunts and groans when he does it! He thinks it's the ultimate back massage!

Salt came to us off the streets of Houston with his brother, Pepper, who has already been adopted. Salt has always been the shy one towards people but when he and his brother were still puppies, he acted like his brother's protector! He likes to act all macho at first, but he's really just a big ole mush who wants your love. 

Salt is a dog who thrives on routine and he'll often have a brief panic if something changes- such as moving his crate slightly. We like to say that he's on the spectrum because he's so peculiar about the way he wants things! True to his nature, Salt is reserved with new people at first. Once he gets a feel for your lifestyle and the way you do things, he quickly runs in stride with it and attaches to your hip! 

Salt isn't much of an active dog, but he does occasionally get the zoomies when he's feeling a little bit crazy! He thoroughly enjoys being around other dogs, especially if they practically worship him like his adoptable friend, Roscoe, does! Salt would be happiest in a quiet home with at least one other dog to accompany him. While he would prefer to have a canine sibling in the home, he would also be content with just a human who is home most of the day and can give him all the attention he wants. He is good with pretty much all dogs of different sizes, ages, and genders, and is also good with respectful kids.

Salt is located in Houston TX but can be transported to most US states for adoption.

Codi is a senior Labrador Retriever/Hound mix who is estimated to be around 10 years old. In late April, Codi was dumped on the side of a busy highway in Cleveland TX with another dog. His friend unfortunately got hit by a car and died before anyone could render aid to either of them. Ever-loyal Codi stayed by his deceased friend's side for days refusing to eat or drink, until he was finally able to be caught by his rescuer.

Codi was extremely shut down after he was rescued. This poor boy was skin and bones, had scars and open wounds all over his body, was riddled with fleas, ticks, and all sorts of other parasites, and was missing most of his teeth. He was so terrified of people that nobody could even look at him without him cowering.
Once in foster care, Codi quickly attached to resident dog, Bernie, and used him as a guide to help him navigate his new environment. Learning from Bernie's example, Codi started to warm up to people and learned that not everyone is bad. Now, after a few months in a foster home, Codi loves to sleep on the bed with his foster mom and does full-body tail wag wiggles when he's happy. He is not shy about asking for attention and loves to be pet! Codi is still understandably wary of new people at first, but he warms up quickly once you gain his trust.

Codi has come such a long way since being rescued those few months ago. For some time after he was rescued, Codi was too scared to even step foot outside in fear that he wouldn’t get to come back in. It’s been a process getting him to learn that he’ll never have to be on his own again, and he shows his gratitude every day. He has gained so much confidence and has a great lust for life now. Codi is housetrained, goes outside and comes back in flawlessly, knows to go to the door when he needs to potty, and is much less fearful of new things. Codi is good with all other dogs of every size and age, and he loves cats! He's the whole package!
Codi is unfortunately heartworm positive from his many years of living on the streets, but he will get treatment before adoption. He has become such a great dog and would really thrive in a calm, patient, multi-dog household. He definitely has many more years ahead of him, and we want to make them the best ones yet!

Codi is located in Houston TX but can be transported to most US states for adoption.

Chai is a sweet, wrinkly-skinned 6 month old Catahoula Leopard Dog/Basenji mix. This petite girl started out as the most reserved out of her 2 other siblings (Addison and Ryder, who has already been adopted) but she quickly fell in stride with her more outgoing sister! Chai looks to her sister, Addison, to lead the way most of the time, but she definitely adds her fair share to the puppy mischief! You can often find these two troublemakers side by side in action. They're two spunky partners in crime!

Chai was found with her sister and older brother from a different litter, Ryder, on the streets of Houston. Their mother was nowhere to be found so she and her siblings had to fend for themselves until a kind lady came along and rescued them and they made their way to us! Since being here, Chai has gained lots of confidence and is right on track to grow into a well-rounded adult dog! 

Chai is a smart little pup who likes to be next to her people most of the time. She never strays too far and is a good listener. She loves to be challenged and enjoys figuring out puzzles and working out how to do things on her own. She may get discouraged when she can't figure things out as quickly as she wants to, but she never gives up! 

Chai is good with other dogs, cats, and people of all kinds. She would do well in most environments/households and is an easy-to-please pup! Chai would thrive best in a home with at least one other canine companion to romp around with, but this is not required for her to be happy. Chai is about 30lbs currently and is expected to get no bigger than 40lbs fully grown. 

Chai is located in Houston TX but can be transported to most US states for adoption.

Addison is an outgoing, energetic, 6 month old Catahoula Leopard Dog/Basenji mix puppy who loves to play! This girl has boundless energy and brings non-stop entertainment anywhere she goes. Being a persistent little pup, Addison manages to get even the most stubborn dogs to play with her!

Addison was found on the streets of Houston with her sister, Chai, and older brother from a different litter, Ryder (who has been adopted!). While Ryder has been the main protector of the group in lieu of their mom who was never located, Addie comes in close behind as his backup! She is not afraid to stand up for herself or her dog friends if she needs to!

Addie is a brave and independent girl and doesn't get phased by much! She loves the outdoors and is always ready for the next adventure. She's a very hardy puppy who hasn't let her rough past life define her; rather, she has turned it into her greatest strength! Addison likes to play hard during the day and cuddle even harder at night. As much as she loves other dogs, her loyalty to her humans comes second to none! She enjoys getting all the attention she can get and loves to snuggle up to her people.

Addison is good with other dogs, cats, and people of all kind and would do well in most environments/households. She would thrive best in a home with at least one other canine companion to adventure with, but this is not required for her to be happy. She is about 30lbs currently and is expected to get no bigger than 40lbs.

Addison is located in Houston TX but can be transported to most US states for adoption.

Missy is a goofy, lazy, cuddly 3 year old Bully mix who loves attention and playing short rounds of fetch. Missy is a bit of a hefty girl weighing in at about 70lbs, but she acts like a lap dog! Her favorite thing, other than cuddling with her people, is playing with her toys and you'll often find her with one in her mouth. Bonus points if they squeak! Missy loves being outside and likes to plop down in the grass or sand and just sunbathe til her hearts content.

Missy was found on the streets of Houston almost 2 years ago and has sadly had no adoption interest in that time. We don't know why- she's the perfect girl! Missy is extremely friendly and loves meeting new people. She's so gentle and asks for pets very kindly. She can be a bit stubborn at times if you ask her to do something, but she does it in the cutest way- by rolling over and asking for belly rubs! Her most happy place is laying in bed with you, snoring away! 

Missy is house trained, crate trained, knows a few commands, and does well on a leash. She would love to be a lounge dog, simply napping the day away and enjoying activities with her humans. She is such a sweet, people-loving, patient girl who really deserves the best home. Missy is good with other dogs but likes to be the leader, so a home with a less dominant dog would be best for her. She would also not mind being the center of attention as the only dog in the household! Missy is good with older kids and would love to have some human siblings to play and explore life with!

Missy is located in Houston TX but can be transported to most US states for adoption.

Bo is a sweet, cuddly, gentle 9 month old Labrador Retriever/Mastiff mix who loves to play and romp around. This guy is a large breed mix weighing in at around 100lbs, and he may even get a little bigger! Despite his intimidating size, Bo is one of the sweetest dogs you'll ever meet. He thinks he's a lap dog and loves cuddles on the couch!

Bo came to us with his brother, Hooch, after his owner was evicted and had nowhere to take them. It's obvious that they were well raised and well loved as they're both perfect houseguests! Bo is a puppy so he still has some of that unfiltered puppy energy, but he tends to match the vibe of the people around him rather well. Bo loves to play with other dogs and is easy to get along with. He is very respectful of other dogs' personal space and reads their behaviors well. Since he was an owner surrender from a household with children, we know firsthand that Bo does great with kids! 

Bo is house trained, kennel trained, knows some commands, and is very smart and attention motivated. There's nothing he can't learn with the right owner! This handsome boy is looking for a home with at least one other dog that he can be buddies with, and preferably someone with experience with large breed dogs and their needs. Bo is such a lover and would do well in just about any environment!

Bo is located in Houston TX but can be transported to most US states for adoption.

Hooch is a stunning, charming, quiet-natured 4 year old Dogue de Bordeaux aka French Mastiff mix. This big block-headed boy is quite the lover and likes to pretend that he's a lap dog, even though he weighs nearly 130lbs! With his big floppy ears and gorgeous rusty coat, he knows he's all that! 

Hooch came to us with his brother, Bo, after their owner was evicted and had nowhere for them to go. It's obvious that they were well raised and well loved as they're perfect houseguests! Hooch has great manners in the house and mostly likes to sleep throughout the day. Being that handsome is hard work, you know! When he's not sleeping the day away, Hooch loves to cuddle up to his people and get as much attention as he can. He shows amazing body language when meeting other dogs for the first time and is very patient. He's a very loyal boy who likes to stick close to his people and make sure they're safe. 

One unique thing about this boy is his oddly shaped tail. You might notice in his pictures that it appears to be bent in the middle- and that's exactly right! When Hooch was a little puppy before he was rescued by his previous owner, he was in a bad situation/location where dogs aren't  treated nicely at all. It appears that someone crushed his tail in a door which caused it to break and heal back improperly. Don't get him wrong though, he still knows how to wag that thing at high speeds! He does have some tenderness where his tail was broken and doesn't like to have it messed with a bunch, but otherwise it has given him no issues.

Hooch has been around kids his whole life and does remarkably well with them. He's a very gentle, watchful babysitter and takes his job very seriously. If he senses that something isn't right, he'll let you know right away! His bark, though seldom heard, can sound loud and scary but it's all for show. This guy is actually a big smooshy scaredy-cat! He can be a bit wary of strangers at first, but he warms up quickly.

Hooch is house trained, crate trained, knows a few commands, and does fairly well on a leash. He is good with other dogs but does not require a canine companion to live his happiest life. All he really wants is someone to love on and nap with him all day!

Hooch is located in Houston TX but can be transported to most US states for adoption.

2 year old Luna was living in a field for a while when neighbors tried to catch her but could not succeed. She will stop by to say hello to the dogs who were on walks, but was very hard to trap. 

When the heat in Texas reached 90, Luna started coming around to a home she chose and allowed being petted. The owner of the property was able to touch her and finally she started living inside with three kitties, and soon came to our foster home. 

Once in foster home, Luna turned out to be a super sweet girl, who was quiet, and shy, and loves kids. 

Luna has no separation anxiety and quite independent.

Luna  is extremely loyal, sensitive, calm and housebroken. 
She loves to play fetch and will love a home with a fully fenced yard, where she gets playtime with her furever parents.   

Luna needs a home with a fully and adequately fenced yard. 

She is 65 lb, fully vaccinated, spayed, microchipped, heartworm negative and kept on heartgard and nexgard. 
 
She is extremely beautiful, very calm, and adorable. Once she has gotten over her initial shyness, she becomes completely velcro, and loves to be petted.   

Luna is currently in Houston, but can transport to other places.

If you are interested to adopt Luna, please send an application via savesomesouls.com

**Yards must be fully fenced to adopt our pups. No invisible fences.

Henry is a 2 year old extremely velcro pup who is very sweet, affectionate and loving.   

 He does great with other dogs but can also live alone.  He loves humans and is almost like a lapdog. 

Henry has received obedience training from a private trainer. He walks very well on leash and is a sweet, happy boy. 

Henry is currently about 50 lb and fully vaccinated, neutered, and microchipped. He is heartworm negative, and kept on heartworm and flea preventative.

Henry is being fostered in Texas, but can travel to any state, and even Canada for the right home. His adoption fee includes his transport fee. 

To meet this gorgeous pup via facetime or whatsapp or other video chat apps, please send a completed application via www.savesomesouls.com  

Yards MUST BE adequately and fully fenced to adopt our pups. We do not accept electric or underground fences.

Suki is a 3 year old Rottie mix girl who is a dream. 

Suki was found as a stray, living in an apartment complex, and eating from a supermarket next door. Our team member saw her and had to trap her as she was too intelligent and would not come to humans on her own. She was so easy to trap, that it felt as if she wanted to be rescued.  

Suki lives with her foster parents' Belgian malinois Emma (you can see the video of them at the beach) and loves to follow her around. They live very close to the beach and are there every morning. Her foster mom says she seems to be fascinated with birds - whether because she wants to eat them or just simply enjoys their song is yet to be determined

Suki is extraordinarily smart and very affectionate and loving.  

When her foster parents leave for work, she takes one of their shoes to where she is laying down - she doesn’t chew it up, just puts it next to her and only one, not both. 

She is not a fan of crate but will comply if needed. 

A home with a fully fenced yard would be mandatory for her, as well as a family who can dedicate time, patience and love. 

Suki is currently about 86 lb and fully vaccinated, spayed, and microchipped. She is kept on heartworm and flea preventative. 

She is great with dogs but has not lived with kids or cats in our care, so we do not know how she is going to be around children or cats.  

Sweet Suki is being fostered in Texas, but can travel to any state, and even Canada for the right home.  Rottweiler experience is mandatory to adopt our breed specific pups. 

To meet this gorgeous pup via facetime or whatsapp or other video chat apps, please send a completed application via www.savesomesouls.com

Yards MUST BE adequately and fully fenced to adopt our pups.  We do not accept electric or underground fences.

Sweet senior  Zuko is the perfect pup. 

Zuko got rehomed as his current owners had a new baby and did not have time for him. 

Zuko is a very sweet, calm, extremely loving big baby, who is still active at 9. He is also very obedient, housebroken, extremely intelligent, and gorgeous.  He currently lives with a toddler and a teenager. 

Zuko does really well with large dogs but can chase small ones. Therefore a home without small animals is ideal for him.  

He will do great in a quiet home as an only pup, spoiled by his parents. He loves people and is very velcro. 

Zuko is about 9 years old, 46 lb, has all his shots, and is neutered, microchipped and heartworm negative. He is kept on heartworm and flea preventative. He is being fostered in Texas, but can travel to many states and even Canada. 

To meet this adorable pup, please send a completed application via www.savesomesouls.com 

Yards must be fully and adequately fenced, to be considered for our pups. We do not accept electric or underground fences.

Winslow maybe 11 years young but he still has so much life in him. He plays with his foster brother Beemo, both saved from a high kill shelter of Houston.   

Winslow is a very sweet, calm, extremely loving big baby, who enjoys hanging out in his foster mom's yard, and lay around in the sun. He is also very obedient, housebroken, extremely intelligent, and gorgeous. He doesn't have any guarding tendency and is very submissive. 

He will do great in a quiet home, with or without another dog. 

Winslow is about 11 years old, 60 lb, has all his shots, and is neutered, microchipped and kept on heartworm and flea preventative. 

He is being fostered in Texas, but can travel to many states and even Canada for the right home.  

To meet this adorable pup, please send a completed application via www.savesomesouls.com

Meet Sam, a funny and adorable pup with lots of love to give! This young male is a friendly and playful pooch with a heart of gold. Don't let his age fool you, this clever canine is already a skilled listener and a loyal companion who will stick by your side. He enjoys a good romp and is always ready for playtime, but he also knows how to relax and enjoy the finer things in life, like snuggles on the couch.  While Sam has a playful spirit and loves to make new friends. If you're ready to be charmed by this funny, brave, and affectionate pup, Sam is the perfect addition to your family!  When you adopt Sam, you will not only gain a new best friend but also a lifelong companion. If you're ready for lots of love, laughs, and cuddles, come meet Sam today!  

Sam is currently fostered in Texas but is available for adoption throughout the country thanks to our transport program 

Sam's adoption fee is $500 which includes his neuter, current vaccinations (rabies, 4 parvo/distemper boosters, and Bordetella), negative heartworm test (if 6+ mths old at transport), negative fecal within 14 days of transport, health certificate within 10-days of transport, registered microchip, and transport costs. 

As a Project Freedom Ride direct adoption, the adoption interview/meet and greet would take place on a video call (FB Messenger Call, Facetime, Zoom, Etc). The adoption application and fee would be finalized & paid in full prior to receiving your dog.

 Drop off locations through our transport program are as follows:

Hi there, I'm Emmie! I'm a young female pup with lots of love to give and I'm in search of a forever home where I can be someone's loyal companion. Even though I may be a bit shy at first, I am a very friendly dog and I am super curious about the world around me. I love to explore and I love to cuddle on the couch with my human friends. Even though I may be a couch potato, I have lots of energy when I'm playing and I would love a home with a backyard to run around in. I'm an all-around great dog and I'm excited to meet my new family! I may not know how I am with other dogs yet, but with my sweet and playful personality, I'm sure I'll make some four-legged friends in no time!  Emmie is currently fostered in Texas but is available for adoption throughout the country thanks to our transport program 

Emmie's adoption fee is $500 which includes his neuter, current vaccinations (rabies, 4 parvo/distemper boosters, and Bordetella), negative heartworm test (if 6+ mths old at transport), negative fecal within 14 days of transport, health certificate within 10-days of transport, registered microchip, and transport costs. 

As a Project Freedom Ride direct adoption, the adoption interview/meet and greet would take place on a video call (FB Messenger Call, Facetime, Zoom, Etc). The adoption application and fee would be finalized & paid in full prior to receiving your dog.

* Northwest Route – Moab, UT - Salt Lake City, UT – Meridian, ID – Richland or Kennewick, WA – Seattle, WA – Mt. Vernon, WA 

* Midwest Northeast Route – Des Peres, MO – Hannibal, MO – Coralville, IA – Woodbury, MN – Madison, WI - Hillside, IL – Lafayette, IN – Cleveland, OH – Pembroke, NY – Syracuse, NY – Castleton On Hudson, NY – Newburgh, NY – Bedminster, NJ – Philadelphia, PA – Halethorpe, MD – Springfield, VA – Richmond, VA

Meet Poppy!!

My rescue journey didn’t start all rainbows and glitter. I was just about 8 weeks old and 5lbs when Project Freedom Ride stepped in to help me. The story goes that some kind people found me after I was allegedly stomped on by some cruel human who had no disregard for my well-being. It left me with a severely damaged back left leg. Thankfully those kind people sought help and Project Freedom Ride answered. They immediately took me to the emergency vet and after meeting the amazing Dr. Kunkle at Blue Pearl it was determined I was a great candidate for an amputation. It would allow me the quickest and easiest recovery and at just a couple months old that was exactly what I needed. On May 21st that damaged leg was removed, and I have never looked back. Nothing can slow me down now!! 

More about me … 

* Yep! I’m a tripod
* Age – estimated birthday is March 25th, 2024
* Weight – estimated at 20-25lb as of July 22nd, 2024
* Social butterfly
* Super outgoing and playful
* Dog Friendly. Fostered with other dogs
* Cats are unknown and per our adoption policy if not fostered with cats will not adopt to a home with cats for everyone’s safety
* Learning commands like sit & wait and am doing rather well for my age
* Love squeaky toys & nylabones
* Will cuddle some but not long periods of time .. I love to play
* Still working on fetch, it’s a weird concept
* Still working on crate training overnight and some days while my foster mom is at work (6-8 hrs) – only #1 accidents – never #2
* Very treat motivated
* Although new places can be a little bit of an adjustment for me, with the noises and all, I would love to find paw-rents who are social like me. Let’s get out and see the world together. Got another dog – even better. I would LOVE a buddy! 

If you’re interested in Poppy please fill out the inquiry form here (copy paste link into browser): https://form.jotform.com/211295763938164

Poppy is currently fostered in GA but is available for adoption throughout the country thanks to our transport program 

Poppy’s adoption fee is $500 which includes her spay, current vaccinations (rabies, 4 parvo/distemper boosters, and Bordetella), negative heartworm test (if 6+ mths old at transport), negative fecal within 14 days of transport, health certificate within 10-days of transport, registered microchip, and transport costs. 

As a Project Freedom Ride direct adoption, the adoption interview/meet and greet would take place on a video call (FB Messenger Call, Facetime, Zoom, Etc). The adoption application and fee would be finalized & paid in full prior to receiving your dog.

 Drop off locations through our transport program are as follows:

* Northwest Route – Moab, UT - Salt Lake City, UT – Meridian, ID – Richland or Kennewick, WA – Seattle, WA – Mt. Vernon, WA 

* Midwest Northeast Route – Des Peres, MO – Hannibal, MO – Coralville, IA – Woodbury, MN – Madison, WI - Hillside, IL – Lafayette, IN – Cleveland, OH – Pembroke, NY – Syracuse, NY – Castleton On Hudson, NY – Newburgh, NY – Bedminster, NJ – Philadelphia, PA – Halethorpe, MD – Springfield, VA – Richmond, VA

breeds_label: American Bully & American Staffordshire Terrier Mix
description:
Meet BEAN !

BEAN is a 2 to 3 year old Bully mix that came into a Texas kill shelter after neither his owner or any of his family was able to care for him. He had been injured pretty badly by roaming dogs prior to coming into the animal shelter. Our group got him to the veterinarian clinic and his injuries were repaired. Bean then went to a medical foster to heal after losing weight and not doing well in the shelter environment. He is now fully healed and healthy. He walks well on leash, although he will pull a little unless he has a halter on while walking. He is doing better with his walks as we have been doing some training with him. He does well with other dogs as long as they are introduced slowly. He is not good with cats as he likes to chase them a little too much. He likes all people that he has met and is a happy guy with a fun personality ! He has not been around young children in the foster’s home and due to his size, he would tend to unintentionally bump into them. He would be better with children over 8 years old. Bean is a sweet dog that would make a great walking buddy, but would also love to curl up and watch sports or movies with his family. 

*Bean is around 2-3 years old and weighs about 50 pounds. 

*He is doing pretty well on a leash and loves to go on walks. 

*He is good with other dogs when introduced slowly and is around other dogs in his foster home. 

*He loves all people !

*He has a great smile !

Here’s some more videos of BEAN:
https://www.youtube.com/shorts/bEdbFHJJWLg

https://www.youtube.com/shorts/1x-M_3huGuo


Bean's adoption fee is $500 which includes his neuter, current vaccinations (rabies, 2 parvo/distemper boosters, and bordatella), negative heartworm test, negative fecal, health certificate, registered microchip, and transport costs.

Bean’s local adoption fee is $200 (travel costs are not needed).

He is available through Levelland Animal Friends, a partner rescue of Project Freedom Ride. We are located in the Texas Panhandle. He is located with our rescue here in Texas. He would be transported on one of the PFR transports to either Meridian ID, SLC, UT, Seattle, WA, Mt Vernon, WA, Kennewick, WA, Portland, OR, Buffalo/Syracuse/Newburgh/Castleton on Hudson, NY, Philadelphia, PA, Pittsburgh, PA, Cleveland, OH, Columbus, OH, Springfield, IL, Chicago, IL, Des Moines, IA, Indianapolis, IN, Baltimore, MD, Lansing, MI, Grand Rapids, MI, Kansas City, MO, Minneapolis, MN, Stevens Point, WI, Madison, WI, Springfield/Richmond, VA, or Bedminster, NJ. Meet LUCKY!

Meet our 80 lb. foster Lucky! He is a handsome Anatolian Shepherd mix male. He and his female friend had a great life until their owner died about 6 months ago. The owner’s out of state family was having someone go by to feed him and his friend, but eventually, they got out of the yard where they were living and animal control picked them up. They were put up for adoption at the local shelter. The female friend ended up being euthanized and Lucky got lucky and didn’t suffer the same fate because someone was supposed to be coming for him. Unfortunately, the potential adopters were a no show, so a great foster stepped in to take Lucky home with her to save him. He is updated on vaccinations, heartworm negative and has been started on flea/tick/heartworm prevention. The local shelter had him listed as 10-12 years old, but our veterinarian said he is actually about 6-8 years old. He is great with the foster’s other 3 dogs, has been cat tested, and is wonderful with the foster’s grandkids… His only downfall is that he barks at the neighbors cattle….endlessly! We are hoping to find Lucky a new forever home, but in the meantime our gentle giant is safe with his wonderful foster family.

*Lucky is around 6-8 years old and weighs about 80 pounds. 

*He is doing well on a leash and loves to go on walks. 

*He has a sweet personality and is very polite and gentle.

*He is good with other dogs and does super playing with the foster’s personal dogs. 

*He loves all people and children too! 

More videos of LUCKY with other dogs:
https://www.youtube.com/shorts/mE03t4E0L0A
https://www.youtube.com/shorts/Uo7LoLljdI8

Lucky's adoption fee is $500 which includes his neuter, current vaccinations (rabies, 2 parvo/distemper boosters, and bordatella), negative heartworm test, negative fecal, health certificate, registered microchip, and transport costs.

breeds_label: Labrador Retriever & American Staffordshire Terrier Mix
description:
Meet POLLY !

Polly is a gorgeous Labrador Retriever mix that was found wandering out in the country in West Texas with many porcupine quills lodged in her muzzle and embedded in her gums on the right side of her face. She was found by a kind person and brought into a high kill shelter that does not provide veterinary care. A shelter partner, Levelland Animal Friends, was notified and Polly was taken to the local veterinarian. According to the veterinarian, the quills had been there for several days and because of that she could not eat and visibly had lost several pounds. The quills were removed and she healed quickly and got back to normal weight over the course of a couple of weeks.

She is around 1 to 1 1/2 years old and weighs about 65 pounds. She is doing well on a leash and is a quick learner. She knows sit and shake…and really enjoys treats! She has a sweet personality and loves to give hugs (she is amazingly gentle with her hugs even though she is a tall girl)!

She has a beautiful mocha colored coat and cute white socks on all four paws. If you look really closely, you can see a hint of brindle color on her head. 

She is good with other dogs. She's been around the foster’s cats, but she plays a little too rough for them. It would be best for her to not be in a home with cats.

Polly's adoption fee is $500 which includes her spay, current vaccinations (rabies, 2 parvo/distemper boosters, and bordatella), negative heartworm test, negative fecal, health certificate, registered microchip, and transport costs.

She is available through Levelland Animal Friends, a partner rescue of Project Freedom Ride. We are located in the Texas Panhandle. She is located with our rescue here in Texas. She would be transported on one of the PFR transports to either Meridian ID, SLC, UT, Seattle, WA, Mt Vernon, WA, Kennewick, WA, Portland, OR, Buffalo/Syracuse/Newburgh/Castleton on Hudson, NY, Philadelphia, PA, Pittsburgh, PA, Cleveland, OH, Columbus, OH, Springfield, IL, Chicago, IL, Des Moines, IA, Indianapolis, IN, Baltimore, MD, Lansing, MI, Grand Rapids, MI, Kansas City, MO, Minneapolis, MN, Stevens Point, WI, Madison, WI, Springfield/Richmond, VA, or Bedminster, NJ. Meet Rolo!

Rolo was found as a stray.  This boy has the sweetest personality, and we can't imagine why someone would dump him out on the streets!

Rolo is about 5 years old and about 70 pounds.  He is great on a leash, rides well in the car, and is a very sweet boy!

Rolo currently lives with a female dog about his size.  He is very mellow and sweet.  He'll be great for a family or an individual who has a quiet, chill home.  He's a bit of a couch potato!

His new family will likely need to work on housetraining.  He's not been around cats that we know of, so we won't be adopting him into a home with cats.

Don't let the fact that he might be a rottie mix scare you...this boy is SO sweet!  


Rolo's adoption fee is $500 which includes his neuter, current vaccinations (rabies, 2 parvo/distemper boosters, bordatella), negative heartworm test, registered microchip, negative fecal, health certificate, and transport costs.

Meet Izzy, the sweetest girl you’ll ever meet! This adorable 1-2 year old is on a mission to find her forever home, and she could be the perfect addition to your family! Izzy absolutely loves her outdoor adventures and soaking up the sun, but what she cherishes most are the warm snuggles from her friends! She’s great with kids and would love a furry sibling to share her joy with. 
Izzy will be spayed upon adoption.

If you would like to meet Izzy, please email us at: bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com

Hilma is not only stunningly beautiful but also has the sweetest personality to match. At around 1-2 years old, she’s on a mission find her forever home. Hilma gets along well with other dogs and would like to have a doggy companion to share her life with. She enjoys her walks, loves to snuggle, and most of all, she’s always up for giving kisses. Hilma is waiting for her chance to bring love and joy into a family’s life. Are you the one who can make Hilma’s dreams come true? 

If you would like to meet Hilma, please email us at: bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com

Meet Gretchen, the sweet and stunning Shepherd looking for her forever home! Gretchen recently arrived at our shelter with her sister, Gwen, but they don't need to be adopted together. This 2-3 year old beauty is a bit timid but absolutely adores human companionship. She melts for scratches and pets! Gretchen also met another dog at the shelter and seemed to enjoy their play time. Could Gretchen be the loyal companion you've been searching for? Gretchen will be spayed upon adoption. If you would like to meet Gretchen, please email us at: bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com

Gwen is a sweet 1-2 year old Shepherd who recently joined our shelter along with her sister, Gretchen. While Gwen loves her sister dearly, they do not need to be adopted together. Gwen can be a little timid around new dogs, but she is a sweetheart who  loves her walks and is eager to find her forever home. If you’re looking for a loving companion who will fill your life with joy, come meet Gwen today. Gwen will be spayed upon adoption. If you would like to meet Gwen, please email us at: bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com

Ingrid is a sweet 1-2 year old girl looking for her forever. She is incredibly and snuggly, making her the perfect companion for those who appreciate a good cuddle. Ingrid enjoys her daily walks and recently had a blast playing with another dog at the shelter, so she’s open to having a doggy sibling in her new home! This adorable girl is ready to leave the shelter life behind and start a new journey with a family who will cherish her as much as she deserves. If you’re looking to adopt a loyal and affectionate friend, Ingrid might be the perfect fit for you. Ingrid will be spayed upon adoption. 

If you would like to meet Ingrid, please email us at: bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com

This sweet one-year-old pup is ready to steal your heart and fill your days with love and joy!  Laurel is a bundle of happiness who adores human attention, long walks, and cuddles galore. She's longing for a forever home where she can share her love with a doggy friend. Could you be the one to give Laurel the dream home she deserves? Laurel will be spayed before adoption.

Shelby is a darling 1-year-old pup with a heart full of love. Despite her larger size, she’s a gentle giant who adores spending time with her volunteer friends. Shelby walks wonderfully on a leash and will sit pretty for a snack. Her perfect family would appreciate her snuggles and possibly offer her a doggy sibling. Do you have room in your heart and home for this amazing girl? Come meet Shelby and fall in love with her sweetness! Shelby will be spayed before adoption.

Hi there! My name is Jai, and my special name is pronounced "Jay". I'm a young boy at just 1 years old, but I am a very good boy! I love to play and explore. I will sit nicely for a treat and I take those treats so gently. I am very loyal and I'll always be by your side, ready to play or to cuddle. I also wouldn’t mind a doggy companion to live with. If you are interested in meeting me, or if you have any questions regarding me, please email us at: bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com

Meet Ashley, the sweet little goofball looking for her forever home! Ashley is a professional cuddler, expert tail-wagger, and all-around adorable companion. At just around 1 year old, she’s ready to bring endless joy and love into your life. Ashley’s dream family includes humans who love playtime, belly rubs, and spontaneous adventures. And guess what? She’s also hoping for a furry sibling to share her toys and secret doggy conversations with! If you’re ready for non-stop tail wags, puppy kisses, and a lifetime of fun, Ashley is the perfect match for you!

Meet Alyson, a lovely 1-year-old pup in search of her forever family. Alyson adores walks, snuggles, and the companionship of other furry pals. Alyson will happily sit for a snack and would love to learn more tricks. Could you be the one to give Alyson the love and care she craves? Let’s make Alyson’s dream of a loving home come true. Alyson will be spayed before adoption.

? Introducing Megara (Meg)! ? 

Meet Meg, a stunning 2-year-old pup full of love and joy! Meg is not only easy-going and enjoys casual walks, but she also likes to lay in the grass and daydream. Meg has a playful side waiting to brighten up your day. This sweet girl is dog-friendly and will be meeting more doggy friends at the shelter soon. If you’re looking for a furry companion who loves playtime and snuggles, Meg is ready to find her forever home. Who is ready to welcome Meg into their hearts and home?

Let’s make Meg’s dreams come true and give her the loving family she deserves!

Alvin is around 1 year old and has lots of puppy energy! He’s looking for a family that wouldn’t mind teaching him some manners. This goofy boy will sit for treats and has done well meeting some doggie friends. If you have any questions about Alvin, or if you would like to meet him, please email us at: bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Alvin will be neutered before adoption.

Meet Brook! This cutie is around 2-3 years old. She is sweet and attentive, and a quick learner who listens well, especially when treats are involved! She already knows sit and is eager to learn more. Brook is potty trained and has done well meeting other dogs. If you’re interested in meeting this smart girl, send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Brook will be spayed before adoption.

Oscar is a happy 1 year old pup. He loves to get out outside and sniff around. This cutie has done well meeting other dogs, but we are not sure at this time how he feels about making kitty friends. More info to come as we get to know him. Send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com to meet Oscar.  He will be neutered before adoption.

Dale is the sweetest boy! He’s around 1-2 years old and likes playing with toys and will happily prance around with a ball. Dale seemed to like the female dog he met here at the shelter. If you’re interested in meeting this cutie, please send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Dale will be neutered before adoption.

Ernest is a sweet boy. He’s around 1-2 years old. This cutie will lean right into you for butt scratches and pets. He’s also done well meeting other dogs. More info to come as we get to know him. If you’re interested in meeting this cutie, send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Ernest will be neutered before adoption.

Truman is such a sweet guy. He’s around 1-2 years old and seems to like making doggy friends. This sweet boy loves to chase a ball around. He can’t wait to have a family of his own to play with! If you’re interested in meeting this cutie, send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Truman will be neutered before adoption.

This happy bundle of love is Panther and she can’t wait to meet you! She gets so excited when she sees her human friends and will show you her happy dance that will definitely make you smile! Panther is around 3 years old and recently lost her home due to no fault of her own. Panther would love a quiet home where she can be the queen and doesn’t have to share the spotlight with any other pets. If you’d like to meet this adorable girl, send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com.

This gorgeous girl is Melania and she is around 1-2 years old. Melania is an absolute sweet girl! She loves getting all the attention and affection from her volunteer friends. She will even go as far as rolling over in the middle of the parking lot if that means she will get a belly scratch. Melania would make a great buddy to binge watch some Netflix and she is such a good leash walker. Melania also did well meeting a male dog at the shelter.

 If you have any questions regarding Melania, or if you would like to meet her, please email us at: bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Melania will be spayed before adoption.

This cute boy is Oats. He’s around 1-2 years old and came to us with his brother Hall. They were both underweight when we met them, but they are doing much better now. Oats is a quiet, sweet boy who likes to be around other dogs. If you’re interested in meeting this cutie, please send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Oats will be neutered before adoption.

Meet Van Gogh! This adorable guy is playful and sweet. He’s around 1-2 years old and liked making friends with a female pup. If you’re interested in meeting this cutie, please send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Van Gogh will be neutered before adoption.

This adorable girl is Mona Lisa and she can’t wait to meet you! Mona Lisa is around 1-2 years old and she is very sweet. She will greet you with a big smile and lean right into you for affection. She’s looking forward to finding a home with a family who will teach her the basics. Mona Lisa did well meeting another dog. Want to meet her? Send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Mona Lisa will be spayed before adoption.

Meet Faith. This sweet girl is a little timid at first, but once you spend some time getting to know her she will be your new friend! Then she’s all about the snuggles and love! Faith absolutely loves treats. She was a little shy meeting another dog, but she did warm up after a few minutes, so she might like having a doggy friend at home. More info to come as we get to know her. If you’re interested in meeting Faith, send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Faith will be spayed before adoption.

This handsome guy is Coal. He’s a sweet & friendly boy who enjoys spending time with the volunteers. Coal did well meeting s female dog. We are still getting to know him and will update this information once we know more. If you’re interested in meeting this cutie, send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Coal will be neutered before adoption.

Meet Autumn! This sweet girl is happy to meet new human friends and is excited just to be spending time getting your attention and affection. Autumn also loves treats! Want to meet her? Send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Autumn will be spayed before adoption.

Luna is the sweetest girl! She’s very loving and affectionate and will even give you kisses to show how happy she is to be spending time with you. Luna will happily sit for treats too. More info to come as we get to know her better. Want to meet her? Send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Luna will be spayed before adoption.

Meet Larry! This guy loves going for walks to sniff around and explore. Larry is around 12-18 months old. He is very interested when he sees other dogs going by, and was playful when meeting a female dog at the shelter. This cute boy loves treats! Want to meet him? Send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Larry will be neutered before adoption.

Chip is a friendly, affectionate boy who loves to make human friends. He is a great companion who wants to be involved with whatever you are doing- sleeping in and snuggling, hiking, or watching TV. He loves belly rubs and rope or rubbery chew toys. He loves knocking around a toy to make kibble fall out. His favorite time is bedtime when he can snuggle in bed with his person. He is smart, sensitive, and would love a family to play with. Other dogs make him anxious- he politely avoids them and would like to be your only dog. He has so much love in his heart that it sometimes shows up as an affectionate hand nibble. He can pull sometimes on the leash but is easily redirected. He is quiet and is good being in a crate. If you’re interested in meeting Chip, please send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Chip will be neutered before adoption.

This sweet boy is Murray and he came to us very skinny & neglected. Murray is a good boy who will sit for treats and is very food motivated. He loves chewing his favorite bones and playing with toys. Murray has been happy to make female doggy friends. If you’d like to meet this cutie, send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com. Murray will be neutered before adoption.

This adorable guy is Bleu II! He’s around 3-5 years old, likes to play with stuffed toys and seems to get along with other dogs. More info to come as we get to know him better. If you’re interested in meeting Bleu II, send an email to bandrbunkhouse@gmail.com.

Here is a possible biography for your female dog named Goldie: Goldie is a funny and gentle dog with lots of love to give! She is a friendly adult dog. She's a clever and playful girl. She's good at listening to and obeying her owners and is very affectionate and loyal. She's a great companion and will be a great family dog. Gentle and loving she gets along with people, dogs and cats. Please use this as a starting point and modify it as you see fit!

Olivia is a friendly and fun-loving female dog with lots of love to give! She is a gentle, funny and curious pup with lots of energy to spend. She loves adventures and making new friends. She has a lot of love to give. She is around 50 lbs and is 3 years old. She is fixed, vaccinated and microchipped. She is very eager to find her furever home, where she can spend her days playing, exploring, and snuggling up with her new family.

Milo is a young dog that is great with other dogs and good with people but he is also a bit anxious with strangers coming in his house.
He is friendly and fine meeting people but he is protective of his home.
Milo loves running, being outside and playing in the water. He is full grown and completely house trained.
We recommend a calmer home without too many people coming and going, older kids and experienced owners.

Eliza is a great adult dog. She is playful, affectionate, food motivated and she loves people. 
Eliza would do better with calmer dogs that can respect her and give her some space.
She is strong, healthy and easy going; she would be perfect for someone looking for an active dog but without a too high energy.
Eliza also had her ears cropped very bad (she barely has any ears left) but she holds no resentment for humans and loves everyone.

Baby is a medium size beautiful dog. She can be very affectionate but she does need slow introduction to new people.
Baby loves walking, she is great on leash and doesn’t pull. She would thrive in a quieter home, an experienced owner who can understand her insecurities and enjoy her fun and sweet personality.

breeds_label: American Staffordshire Terrier & American Bulldog Mix
description:
Hero is a beautiful boy, very strong and needing a bit of more training to walk on leash.
He is very gentle, obedient and friendly with people and dogs. He could be in a home with kids because he is gentle and has not aggression. However older kids might be better due to his strength and size.
Hero is a loyal companion and a very handsome dog.

Nacho is a very sweetheart. His owner died and his family abandoned him to die at the vet office.
Nacho is about 7 years old, beautiful and healthy. He is not great with cats but he is good with quiet dogs and loves people.
Nacho would thrive in a quiet environment but he loves walks, time outside and playing with his favorite people.
Nacho needs a home with older kids and where he can grow older with joy and affection.

Honey is a cute little lady.
She is about 6 years old, loves people, walks and just being on her bed around people.
She gets scared with loud noises and we recommend older kids. She likes some dogs but not too hyper or in her face too much.

Sephora is a great dog, she is really sweet and affectionate. 
She loves people and she is very good around other dogs although a bit pushy with some. Sephora  is easy going, calm but playful and energetic and would be a great family dog. Sephora is about 4.5 year old, she walks well with a harness and she is also house trained and crate trained.
Her beautiful face has some remarking color and those eyes are really deep and full of love.

Mars is a very handsome dog.
He the people he trusts and he is still like a puppy full of energy. He loves playing outside, long walks and he gets a bit too excited when playing, so he gets a bit mouthy and that's why we recommend no kids for him.
Mars is a loyal dog who needs a very experienced owner, a calm environment, daily walks and basic routine and rules to follow.
Mars has a big head and a big heart but if you have no patience and experience to be with strong, big dogs he would not be the right fit.

Coral is a very young girl who has hard time in a place if there is too much action around her. She is super sweet, playful, crate trained, quiet and well behaved but she needs slow introductions to new people.
Coral is a great and beautiful dog who loves her people very much again but she is not always looking for attentions from strangers. She can probably live with a calmer dog, but the ideal would be being the only dog in the house. Coral is a beautiful young dog and she gets more and more relaxed with the right people and situation and show her true sweet nature.
She is very food motivated, an easy learner, and a playful companion for an active person.  
Coral is a medium size dog, very beautiful and affectionate with the people she trusts and we know she will be awesome when she finds her quiet loving home.

breeds_label: American Staffordshire Terrier & Great Dane Mix
description:
Galileo is a big fun boy who loves people and other dogs. He is not aggressive or mean in any way but he thinks he is still a puppy and his manners need some more training.
Galileo would love a family who does outdoor activities, he loves the woods and the water. He is easy to train, smart and attentive but he just need your time, structure and love.
Galileo is a really handsome, a big stunning dog that bonds to people well. He loves playing fetch, lived with a small dog and he is strong on the leash but walks very well if you use a harness. We recommend a quiet environment without too many stimulation around him to help him relax and settle.
His ideal person should be an experienced, firm but calm one so he can feel safe, learn the rules and behave at his best.

Lola is a sweet and gentle American Bully, estimated to be between 2-3 years old. Found in a dire condition alongside her friend, Bubba, Lola was emaciated, hungry, and terrified. With tender care and nourishment, she has made a remarkable recovery. Lola is a devoted companion, forming a strong bond with Bubba. While they would love to find a forever home together, they can also thrive as individual family members given time and patience. Lola enjoys the simple pleasures of life, such as gentle pets and short walks, as the Texas heat can be challenging for her face shape. Despite her tough start, Lola has a heart full of love and is eager to find a family to call her own.  Contact us if interested in more information on sweet Lola!

Bubba is a strong and loyal American Bully, estimated to be between 2-3 years old. Found in a dire state alongside his companion, Lola, Bubba was severely underweight, hungry, and terrified. With tender care and consistent feeding, he has made a remarkable recovery. Bubba is a gentle giant who enjoys the company of his best friend, Lola, but he is also capable of thriving independently given time and patience. This confident boy has a particular fondness for frozen Kongs and car rides. Bubba is eager to find a loving home where he can continue to flourish and experience the joy of a stable and secure environment. While he would prefer to stay with Lola, he is open to the possibility of finding a forever home on his own. Contact us to learn more about this beauty.

Chloe, a gentle soul, is searching for a quiet haven to call home.  She is about 2 years old and weighs about 13lbs.  Surrendered to a small West Texas shelter, Chloe's past may be uncertain, but her future shines bright with the potential for a loving family.  While initially shy, her quiet demeanor melts away with a gentle touch and a patient heart.  Chloe's story might be one of overbreeding, but her spirit remains unbroken.  She simply wants to be cherished - to be someone's loyal companion, someone to shower with quiet affection.  Imagine a dog who looks at you with pure adoration, eager to please and be your devoted friend.  Could you be the one to finally see Chloe for the precious jewel she truly is?  Open your heart and your home to Chloe, and discover the unwavering love and loyalty this sweet girl has to offer.

Forest is a spunky and energetic rat terrier/chihuahua mix, approximately one year old. This little 14lb dynamo was found wandering the streets of Tahoka, Texas, with no one to call his own. Despite his young age, Forest still carries the boundless energy of a puppy. He loves to play and interact with other dogs, making him a potential playmate for any furry friend. Forest is currently learning the ropes of leash walking and basic manners, eager to soak up all the knowledge his new family can offer. With his charming personality and playful spirit, Forest is ready to win over the hearts of his forever family. 

Imagine exploring sunny parks together, Forest's tail wagging furiously as he sniffs out new and exciting smells. Or picture cozy evenings curled up on the couch with his soft fur against your side. Forest is a delightful companion waiting for someone to unlock his full potential.

Are you looking for a loyal friend who will bring excitement and laughter to your days?  Forest could be your perfect match!  Contact our organization today to learn more about adopting this little adventurer and giving him the forever home he deserves!

breeds_label: American Staffordshire Terrier & Pit Bull Terrier Mix
description:
Willow is a heart-melting mix breed puppy (terrier class/bulldog possibly), approximately 5-6 months old. This adorable bundle of joy was found discovered alone, abandoned and frightened in an alley, with no clue about her past. Despite her tough start, Willow has shown resilience and blossomed into a playful and affectionate companion. Her big, curious eyes, wagging tail and gentle nature instantly capture your heart. She's a bundle of energy, always eager to explore and learn. Willow is incredibly sweet and loves to cuddle. Her playful spirit and enthusiasm light up any room.  She's looking for a loving home where she can shower her new family with endless amounts of love and loyalty.

This adorable pup is looking for a loving home where she can thrive and become a cherished member of the family. Her ideal human companion is someone who enjoys outdoor activities, is committed to providing training and socialization, and is ready to shower her with endless love and affection. Could you be Willow’s forever home?
