Meet Mack: The Goofy Bull Terrier with a Heart of Gold!

This handsome fella is Mack, a stray bull terrier with a smile that could melt your heart. Don't let his initial shyness fool you – underneath that bashful exterior lies a total goofball with a firecracker personality!  

Here's the scoop on Mack:

Certified Silly Goose: Prepare for endless entertainment with Mack's playful antics. He'll have you giggling with his goofy grin and clumsy attempts at zoomies.  He is sweet, happy and loving.  He will give kisses if you let him!

Leash Master: Walks in the park are a breeze with Mack! He strolls along like a champ, ready to explore the world by your side. He wants to stay close.  

Undercover Clown: Don't be surprised if you find yourself the target of Mack's playful shenanigans. He's a natural comedian, always up for a good time, but perfect dog to chill next to you on the sofa.

Full of Fun: This energetic pup has a zest for life that's contagious! He's ready for adventures, cuddles, and all the belly rubs you can offer.  He is low to medium energy and very treat motivated.

Other Dogs: For the most comfortable environment, he thrives with female canine friends or enjoys quiet time alone with his owner.  

Mack was found as a stray in a small, rural West Texas town.  He was discovered in a backyard and was beat up by another male dog landing him at the vet clinic a few days.  Thankfully he is all healed and ready for his second chance!  If you're looking for a loving, goofy companion who will keep you on your toes (and laughing!), then Mack is your guy!

To ensure a happy and successful placement, we're seeking a loving home with someone who understands the unique personality of a Bull Terrier!

Contact us to about this amazing dog and see if he's the perfect fit for your forever home! 

Families with cats: Local Texas adoptions only so we can cat test in your home environment.

Neiko, a regal Akita with a soul full of sunshine, has been waiting for his forever family for a over five years. While the circumstances of his owner surrender remain a mystery, Neiko's spirit remains unbowed. This playful senior is a walking contradiction: wise and experienced yet bursting with youthful energy. He adores car rides with the windows down, the wind ruffling his fur, and wouldn't dream of missing out on a scoop of dog-friendly ice cream (it's practically a tradition!). A champ on walks, Neiko would happily explore new trails with you by his side. While Neiko isn't a fan of other furry friends, his focus is squarely on his human companion and bonds quickly.  If you're looking for a loyal, loving dog who thrives on adventures (and maybe shares your love for frozen treats!), Neiko could be your perfect match. Don't let his extended wait deter you - Neiko's heart, though patient, is brimming with love waiting to be unleashed. 

Neiko is a favorite among volunteers and enjoys outings with them. He is such a great dog with big love and big personality. He deserves a home of his own!

Neiko came to Saving Grace in November 2018. He was found wandering the streets and his owner didn't want him back when Lubbock Animal Services contacted them. He has a gorgeous brindle coat that makes him look so handsome and unique! He is the biggest, sweetest fluff ball you will ever meet!  Neiko holds his toys in his mouth and dances around on his back legs when he's happy - which is all the time.

Meet Ella: The Three-Legged Wonder Dog (Looking for a Forever Adventure Buddy!)

Howdy there! My name's Ella, and let me tell you, I'm a firecracker of a pup!  Life started out a little ruff – me and my best bud, Ava, were found all alone at an abandoned house. We then landed at a shelter, but let's just say country livin' wasn't quite the life for energetic pups like us. Especially since space was tight, and you know, the whole "risk of euthanasia" thing wasn't ideal. Thankfully, we were then moved over to Saving Grace until a home comes along.

But hey, that's all in the past! Now I'm on the hunt for my forever home, and let me tell you, it's gotta be full of fun and adventure.  I may be missing a leg (don't worry, it doesn't slow me down one bit!), but my spirit is bigger than life! I may be three-legged, but I have the energy of four!  Walks in the park or just cuddling on the couch - I am down for all!

While I adore my pal Ava (who also needs a home), we also enjoy time apart.  I am happy to shower a new family with all the love I've got.  

So, if you're looking for a vibrant, fun-loving pup who's ready to conquer every walk and cuddle session with enthusiasm, then look no further!  Don't be discouraged by my missing leg – my heart and spirit are full, and I'm ready to fill your life with endless joy.  Please contact Saving Grace and tell them you want to meet Ella, the three-legged wonder dog, and let's start our forever adventure together!

********************************************************************************************************

Fenced yard preferred.

Meet Leonard...a very lovable pitty companion who gives 110% love and commitment. He's packed with personality, charm and playful antics that will keep you entertained and smiling all day. Whether he's tossing around his favorite chew king ball or chasing it tirelessly in the yard, this energetic pup is always up for a good time. He's a connoisseur of durable toys like Goughnut, Kong Extreme and Benebones that can keep him plenty busy while you are busy. All this play makes Leonard a very good sleeper who settles down in a crate at night. As long as it's a chew-proof crate, he'll feel safe and secure knowing he has his own space to unwind. While he may need some time to adjust to new boundaries, with patience and guidance from a trainer, Leonard will thrive in his new home. 
Leonard is seeking a human(s) who understands the needs of his breed who can provide him with the structure and care he deserves. 
If you're ready to welcome Leonard into your heart and home, contact us today 315-457-8762 or info@humanecny.org, to arrange a meet and greet. Together, you and Leonard can embark on a journey filled with love, laughter, and endless adventure. Adopt Leonard and make a friend for life!Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Weight: Approx. 60 lbs.

Ideal Home: Active family with sturdy kids (Bugsy is a young, playful, large-ish dog); other dogs may be okay pending meet & greet.

Favorite Thing: Bugsy loves Darla, his shelter dog BFF.

Bugsy is an adorable boy bursting with the ebullience of late puppyhood. He would thrive in an active household with plenty of play, walks, and activity. He's a smart guy who learns quickly and already knows some helpful commands. The shelter environment is far from ideal for a young energetic dog like Bugsy. When he goes to his new home, he will benefit from further basic training and gentle guidance from his new family. If you're interested in meeting this loveable, fun-loving dog, please fill out an application on our website, www.humanecny.org; email info@humanecny.org; or call us at (315) 457-8762 to set up your meet and greet.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Weight: Approx. 65 - 70 lbs.

Ideal Home: Adults only; no kids; no dogs or cats; would love a fenced-in yard.

Many dogs and cats come to HumaneCNY having suffered neglect and abuse. Kenzo is no exception, and it is not an exaggeration to say that he was on the brink of death by starvation when he was rescued by a traveling nurse, an awesome Good Samaritan, in literally the nick of time. Through heroic efforts, he was saved from a devastating fate. It took a village and a lengthy recovery period to bring him to his current condition: healthy, bright-eyed, beautiful, playful -- dare we say even rambunctious?;) -- and full of life. What Kenzo could use now is a home of his own with loving adults who will provide plenty of play and exercise; structure, routine & gentle guidance; some basic training; a safe environment; and most importantly, a lot of love and affection for this sweet, affectionate boy. He loves to run and is nonreactive when walking/running on leash. He is a big strong boy but not a puller. Treats are motivating to him so the ABC's of training should be a fun bonding experience for him and his new person/people. He loves food, toys, lucky mats, and puzzle games. He is also house trained. Are you ready to be Kenzo's final rescuer and give this brave survivor his forever oasis? You can apply for him online by filling out an application on our website, www.humanecny.org; or email info@humanecny.org; or call us at (315) 457-8762.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Weight: Approx. 45 lbs.

Ideal Home: Active family with respectful kids; other dogs may be okay pending meet & greet; cats possible.

Favorite Thing: Outings and adventures.

Handsome Hunter is a perfectly medium-sized dog and appears to be a mix of cattle dog and some Shiba Inu thrown in for good measure. He's very friendly and interacts sweetly with staff and volunteers. No guarding, no aggression. He is not particularly interested in play time and is at his happiest on walks, runs, car rides, and adventures. We are hoping his new family will be an active one who will include him in their busy lives and activities such as riding around to their kids' various sporting events, hiking, walking, trips to the family camp, etc. Hunter will love all of it. Of note, Hunter was inadvertently exposed to a pair of cats [by a member of the public] in a recent incident at Humane. Although the situation was unfortunate -- but no worries, all involved are safe & sound -- Hunter was nonreactive to the kitties. Because of this situation, we think cats may be okay for him. Are you ready to adopt Hunter into your happy, active home? Then please fill out an application on our website, www.humanecny.org; email info@humanecny.org; or call us at (315) 457-8762 to set up your meet and greet with Hunter.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Age: Approx. 1 1/2 years.

Weight: Approx 35-40 lbs.

Ideal Home: Adult home, may include older teens 15+; best as the only pet.

Favorite Thing: Diamond has a lot of things she enjoys, but numero uno, paws down, no contest is being with her her person/people.

Our Diamond girl sure does shine! Looks wise she is unique, a real beauty. But we all know looks aren't everything, and Diamond does not disappoint when it comes to what she has to offer below the surface. So does Diamond have wonderful qualities that reflect her outward appearance? Yes, she she absolutely does. First of all, as her forever human companion/s, you will have endless options for activities, adventures, and bonding. That's because Diamond has a wide range of interests. She loves playing with toys, loves the kiddie pool and being in water (even likes being bathed), loves riding in the car and outings at the park, walks, and trail hiking. Speaking of walks and hikes, another area where Diamond shines is her nonreactivity to prey, such as squirrels, as well as to other dogs and people. Even in the veterinarian's lobby and waiting room, she completely ignored two tiny dogs sitting close by and all the other distractions going on around her. She was also great with the vet and staff during the exam. The volunteers who spend the most time with Diamond have been working on some of her basic training needs; and being a young dog, she would benefit from more training once she is comfortably ensconced in her new life outside the shelter. On a final note, the fact is that Diamond's most brilliant quality is her love of human companionship. While it's true that she has a long list of things she loves, for Diamond nothing is more valuable than being loved by a human and receiving physical affection from them and being close to them. We've seen here at Humane that she bonds very strongly with the people who spend the most time with her, and those people are equally head over heels about her. Do you have a nice big space in your life and your heart for a girl who will give her all to you? If you do, please contact HumaneCNY at 315-457-8762 to set up your meeting with Diamond.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Age: Approx. 1 1/2 yrs.

Weight: Approx. 40 lbs.

Ideal Home: Adults and older kids (she prefers her humans to be females) in a low key, low traffic home; other dogs are possible pending meet and greet. 

Favorite Thing: Being in the car riding shotgun.

Darla came to us very pregnant and promptly gave birth to an adorable litter of pups. They found their forever homes, but their beautiful, soulful-eyed mama is still waiting for hers. Darla is a shy girl but has branched out over the months she's been with us. After her pups were all adopted, Darla was able to start going on longer walks. Initially she was pretty overwhelmed by all the new sights, smells, and sounds; but she's come a long way since those early days and instead of keeping her tail tucked between her legs, she now holds it up proudly most of the time. Now that she's more confident, her world has gotten bigger as she goes for car rides and outings to parks. She is walked by a number of HumaneCNY's volunteer walkers; however, she prefers women to men. She is playful and energetic and really loves to romp around with her HumaneCNY canine BFF Jester. We think the best fit for Darla is a low key household with a predictable routine and family members who will offer plenty of TLC and a solid foundation upon which Darla can continue building her self-confidence. If this sounds like a description of what you have to offer, please contact HumaneCNY at (315) 457-8762 to set up your meet and greet with Darla.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Weight: Approx. 55 lbs.

Ideal Home: Adults, older kids; low-traffic home; fenced-in yard; other dogs possible pending meet and greet.

Favorite Thing: Giving sweet kisses to his human pals.

Toby's story is a heartbreaking one. Someone hit him in the head with a baseball bat, and when his rescuers arrived to help, he was found cowering in the basement. It's difficult for us to process the notion of such profound suffering so you can only imagine how hard it must be for Toby. What we know about Toby is that he takes some time to trust humans, and sometimes in new environments he has moments of pure panic, desperate to get back to his safe place. Can you really blame him? What we also know about Toby is that once he warms up to you, he will cover you in kisses, show off his very good manners for treats and will ask you to play with him. It's why he is a fan favorite at the shelter. When you meet Toby for the first time, he won't be the dog that runs up to you, wagging his whole body in excitement. He'll appear aloof, staying close to the people he knows or ignore you to sniff around and play with his toys. This may be one of the reasons he has been passed over by potential adopters time and time again. As Toby approaches one full year at the shelter, we are renewing our commitment to finding him his place in the world and a home with a family who will go slowly with him and allow him to build relationships at his own pace. Trust us, he will get there! He would also benefit from a fenced-in yard where he can explore the outdoors while feeling safe. As Toby moves through adolescence into adulthood, trauma has once again raised its ugly head, as it often does at this age. For Toby that means walks can be scary. He can be fine one moment and then panic, bolting for home. For this reason, he may not be a great candidate for a family who wants to bring their dog on lots of walks or hikes, at least not yet. He would love to lounge in the house with you, play with enrichment toys, go for car rides (Toby is good in the car and enjoys it), and run around in a secure yard. Are you the family for Toby? Are you ready to have a life filled with kisses and silly antics? Yes, you'll need patience, but aren't the best things in life worth waiting for? You can fill out an application on our website, www.humanecny.org; email info@humanecny.org; or call us at (315) 457-8762 to set up your meet and greet with Toby.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

description: Marley is a sweet, energetic dog who has the biggest heart for his people. He is very polite and will sit, lay down, wait and is very attentive to commands while on walks! He also recalls very well when you call his name no matter what he's doing. Marley loves playing fetch, chewing on his favorite toys and going on car rides. He seems to be very interested in playing with other dogs and has successfully met and romped around with a few dogs at the park. He is a very loving boy who needs someone that has the time and patience to continue working with him, although he is very smart and picks up things fast! (Is already crate trained through the night) An ideal home for Marley would be somewhere with room to stretch and a companion to play with, either another friendly dog or someone at home with flexible work hours as he thrives with having a buddy around.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Felix is good with other dogs and with cows. He does need work on leash walking. More information will be available after he settles in.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Age: Approximately 2 yrs.

Weight: Approximately 45 lbs. 

Ideal Home: Active adults dedicated to plenty of play and walks; older, sturdy kids (due to jumping) okay; other dogs okay pending meet and greet.

Favorite Things: Treats!

Brownie is a very friendly pup with a medium to high energy level. Lots of play and walks will be essential to her well-being and success fitting into the household. She's still young enough that she exhibits puppy mouthing and jumping when overexcited and will need some further work (from what she's been receiving at HumaneCNY) on her basic manners. However, she's highly food-motivated and alert so training could be a great bonding experience as well as fun for both dog and new owner/s. Currently she knows "sit," "down," "touch," and "place," all of which are great foundational commands upon which to build. On her walks, Brownie stays alert and settles in nicely. While she may be a little zig-zaggy, she's not a big puller. If you're interested in meeting young, sweet Brownie, please contact HumaneCNY by calling (315) 457-8762 to set up an appointment.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Weight: 45 lbs.

Mandy's Ideal Home: One or two adults; Mandy would love to share a home with a playful male dog (no cats, children, or female dogs); a fenced-in yard with plenty of toys and, in summer, a kiddie pool!

Favorite Things: Walks that allow for plenty of sniffing and squirrel sighting; playtime with friendly male dogs.

Mandy is a sleek black, beautiful, playful pup. Because of the extreme hardships she suffered in the days before she arrived at HumaneCNY, she can be wary of strangers. However, with a little bit of effort in the form of a walk or two and plenty of treats, she soon gives herself over wholeheartedly. It needs to be noted that Mandy will require several visits over the course of a couple weeks by potential adopters so that both she (and you) can develop a nice bond before she goes home with you. The recipients of her trust receive an abundance of love, kisses, and happy dances. She has a tried-and-true fan base of staff & volunteers here at HumaneCNY because she is such a lovebug as soon as she lets you in. Mandy loves to go for car rides, outings, and walks. We think she would be happiest in a home with a friendly, playful male dog that is medium to large size. This is a girl who loves to play! If you're interested in winning Mandy over and gaining the companionship of one of the most loving and fun dogs you'll ever meet, please contact HumaneCNY at (315) 457-8762.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

Weight: 90 lbs.

Ideal Home: One or two strong, assertive adults; quiet home; no other animals.

Favorite Things: Sticks, playing tug of war!

Meet Theo, a handsome and affectionate mixed breed searching for his forever home! At around two years old and 90 pounds, this light brown sweetheart has a charming personality waiting to bloom with the right family. Theo may appear nervous at first, but with patience and love, he blossoms into a playful and affectionate companion. He adores walks, playtime, and being showered with affection and pets. Having endured a challenging past, Theo is looking for a peaceful environment where he can thrive. He's house-trained and well behaved when left alone, making him a great fit for a loving household. Due to his past, he would do best in a home without other pets, allowing him to be the center of attention. Despite his past experiences, Theo has shown remarkable resilience and is eager to find a family who will give him the love and security he deserves. With a bit of time and understanding, he'll become your loyal and devoted companion for life. If you're ready to open your heart and home to this deserving pup, Theo can't wait to meet you! You can apply online by filling out an application on our website, www.humanecny.org; or email info@humanecny.org; or call us at (315) 457-8762.Contact HumaneCNY if interested in this animal. You can fill out application to adopt at the shelter.

MEET PACO!

This absolutely adorable, super sweet natured and gentle boy is named Paco ... and he's ready for his forever~

Paco is doing wonderfully in his foster home. He is living with a pack of dogs and he loves them. He does GREAT with other dogs in fact, accepts their different personalities and just gets along. 
He also LOVES his walks (working on his pulling), his jaunts on the nearby beach, playtime. He is a joyful, happy go lucky, happy-to-be-loved kind of guy, who loves giving kisses and getting pets. 

Ideal home for Mr. Paco would be one that loves and cares for him of course, and is committed to him forever (we promised him that). A home that will give him the exercise he needs every day in terms of walks, hikes, playtime. A home with an additional canine or two would be great. Adult only home or one with older kids since he can be mouthy occasionally. 

Paco is utd on all shots and is neutered. He is about 2.5 yrs old and weighs 55 lbs. 

Have questions? Interested in arranging a visit? Please contact reboundhounds@gmail.com and his rescue will respond right away, thanks!

PACO IS IN ARVERNE, NY

MEET MISS SANDY!

Sandy is an INCREDIBLE dog! 

Sandy is super smart, fun, sassy, sweet and affectionate! She is also a charmer ... and did we mention cute!

Sandy LOVES to play outside. She LOVES LOVES LOVES to swim! She LOVES to explore. She LOVES her walks and is great on leash. And ... she LOVES her humans (even if she does take a moment or two to warm up.)

Ideal home for this great girl? One that loves and cares for her of course; one committed to her forever. A home that will give her daily exercise via walks and hikes. A home that will continue her training that she has excelled at. Adult only home or one with older kids. And at this time, we feel Sandy should be solo pet. 

Sandy is house and crate trained. She knows obedience commands. She is about four years old and weighs 60lbs. UTD on shots and is spayed. 

Have questions? Interested in a visit? Please contact reboundhounds@gmail.com and we will get right back to you, thanks!

SANDY IS IN PENNELLVILLE, NY

Bowie is a 1-year-old gentleman who came to us due to unfortunate circumstances. In his short life, he has been through a lot and is working on regaining his confidence and readjusting. Once Bowie welcomes you into his corner, his loyalty is unmatched. We welcome you to chat with staff to learn more about Bowie! Give us a call!
Kettu is a 5-year-old lady. She can be shy at first, but would make a great companion for someone who allows her the time to come out her shell and blossom into her lively self.

Pearl is a senior Goldendoodle that came to us after being retired from a local breeding operation. She was raised on a farm setting and is used to being around other dogs and a large family, including kids. Pearl would be best in a home without cats. She is a bit timid but incredibly sweet and is ready to live the good life! Please give us a call for more information!

Luna came into our care after her previous family could no longer care for her. Her previous family mentioned she is good with other dogs and was good with the children in the home. We are told Luna was housetrained as well. Her previous family said Luna is best placed in a home with no kitties. She is a mixed breed and about 3 years old. She has been friendly and outgoing with staff here! Please give us a call for more information!

Dude came into our care after being part of a large local seizure case. He lived with several other dogs in his previous home. He is about 2 years old and a mixed breed (we aren't sure of what!). Dude is about 46 lbs. Please give us a call to find out more information!

Prin was originally found wandering as a stray. She is a sweet older female cattle dog. Prin loves everyone including kids and doesn't seem to mind kitties. She has gotten used to other dogs over time, but she is blind so she enjoys having her personal space with other dogs, too! Prin is housetrained as well! She does have diabetes, so her adopter would need to do injections for her to keep her happy and healthy! Prin is currently resting comfortably in a foster home, but give us a call to find out more!

Ruby came into our care after her previous family could no longer care for her. She is only about a year old, and is a mixed breed gal (unfortunately we don't know what she's mixed with, maybe raccoon?) Ruby is wonderful with everything! She is great with other dogs, loves to play, and has been friendly and outgoing with everyone she meets. She ignored the cats in her foster home. She would be best suited for an active family or someone who is interested in taking walks or going to the dog park. Ruby is about 50 lbs. and has an adorable nub tail. Guess what?! Ruby is housetrained, cratetrained, and great in the car! She seems to enjoy water as well! Give us a call to ask about how to take Ruby on your summer adventures!

tags: Loves To Be Held Like A Baby
description:
Angie is a sweet French Bulldog that just turned 5 yrs old. She is the perfect dog!
She is awesome with cats, dogs and children. She is a lightweight at 25 lbs. 
Angie was used as a breeder, having many litters in her life. She loves to carry around a squeaky toy in her mouth. She is not really into playing with other dogs, she kinda does her own thing. She is great on leash and doesn't get overheated easily like some bulldogs do. Angie is the sweetest girl; she loves to be cuddled with. She will do a couple of stairs, but does not do a whole set of stairs. 
She is crate trained and housetrained.
Angie has been spayed, dewormed, flea treated, and has had her rabies vaccine and distemper/parvo/leptovirus vaccine. She is also microchipped. Her adoption fee is $400.

Would prefer an adopter with breed experience. 
Adopters must be a homeowner. We no longer adopt to renters :(
Adopters must be an hour drive from Syracuse NY 
Adopters must fill out our application and be approved by Rescue.
Please contact us if you are interested in Angie and fit the criteria for adopting her. We will send you our application.
Thank you.

Tommy is a big, goofy 10-18mth old pup looking for his forever home! 

He has done great with other dogs, but no cats for him please. 

Tommy will be fully vaccinated and is pending neuter.

Lola, is a spunky, loving, affectionate, energetic over sized puppy who just wants the attention of all animals and humans. 

She loves walks, and is attached to her foster brothers to the point she uses them as a pillow when ever she can. 

Lola hasn’t expressed any forms of aggression, when food is around and or toys. She’s eager to learn, and food motivated when it comes to training. 

Lola would thrive in a family setting with young children and other dogs, not sure on cats. 

Lola is approx 10-18 months old. She will be vaccinated and is pending spay.

Meet Tank! 

Our 8 month old Parvo survivor, Tank is full of love, life and energy! 

Tank loves to play fetch and tug! He is curious and LOVES kids. 

When he’s ready to snuggle, he turns into a lap dog. ?

Tank gets along well with other dogs, is working on potty and crate training and will be getting neutered soon!

4/18/2024
Jasper is a 5 1/2 month old chihuahua/boston terrier mixed puppy. He is currently 12 lbs.
Jasper came to us untrained all around with urine stains on his coat, indicating that he was kept in a crate most of his young life :(
He is crate trained, but sometimes will have an accident in there. He is puppy pad trained. Housetraining is a work in progress. He is a happy guy, but has some resource and food guarding issues with other dogs in the home. Jasper would flourish in a home as an only dog. 
Jasper is neutered, vaccinated (rabies, kennel cough, and his distemper/parvo), dewormed, on heartworm preventative, flea treated, and is microchipped. 

Adopters must be a homeowner.
Adopters must live within a 1 1/2 hour drive from Syracuse, as a home visit is required.
Adopters must complete our application, complete with personal and Veterinary references.
Jasper is still a puppy, so a home where an adult is there with him most of the day, (for example, someone that works from home most of the work week} as he still needs training and socialization.

Sweet Carys is 2 years young and currently carrying a litter of pups, but will be spayed and available for adoption before we know it. 

She gets along well with other dogs and is living with a toddler. She prefers to be in a cat-free home.

Timber is a big snuggle bug. He loves snuggling up after a nice walk. He's working on basic manners and is house trained and crate trained. He likes blankets and sweaters and his toys. 

He does have a hard time sharing toys and food with other dogs, so if he were to live with another dog there would need to be some management.
Rudy is Deaf but working hard at teaching his foster mom sign language. He doesn't let it slow him down. He lives with 2 small children and has loved everything and everyone he's met.

Saunders is 8 years old and still looking for his forever home. His human mom passed away several months ago and we took him back into our rescue. He is good with little dogs but needs a home without cats or male dogs. He is typical Chow at first and is standoffish. He’s located in Brewerton New York. Please let us know if you think he’s the one for you.

Casey, a charming 3.5-year-old neutered male, is looking for a patient adopter to help him shine. He weighs 52 lbs, loves walks, and enjoys hugs. Although timid at first, he warms up quickly and gets along swimmingly with most dogs, especially females. Once you've gained his trust, he'll cuddle and allow all handling. Find him in Voorhees, New Jersey.

If you were interested in adopting Casey or one of our other dogs, you can fill out an application on our website at www.chowrescuecny.org

RC is a 5-year-old male Chow Chow that is blind. He would do best in a home that has both Chow and blind dog experience.

For more information about CCRCNY's policies or to find the application, please visit our website: https://www.chowrescuecny.org/adoption-process/

Pumpkin is a 5-year-old female who came in with a few others including Asia, another 5-year-old female, that she is bonded with. While either can be adopted alone, we do feel that they would do best together. Like most chows, Pumpkin will take a bit of time to warm up and would do best in a chow-experienced home.

For more information about CCRCNY's policies or to find the application, please visit our website: https://www.chowrescuecny.org/adoption-process/

Jenny is four years old
Butler is two years old

Big ole Charlie is ready to find his forever home. He is 2 years young, is good with cats, big and small dogs, and would love to find a home with a female companion. He will need a patient home that is willing to let him get acquainted at his pace. Charlie is from a hoarding situation and hasn’t experienced too much in his life, but he is willing and ready to find a home to call his own.

Are you that home? 

Fill out an application on our website - www.chowrescuecny.org 

Charlie is being fostered in Brewerton NY. Adopters have to be willing to come to Brewerton NY to adopt Charlie…

Hi, my name is Khan! I’m a five year old, male red Chow who would love to rock your world! I weigh 61 pounds, up to date on my vaccinations and flea/tick and HW preventive. I am currently living with my foster dad and his female Chow, I think she’s a hottie!! Caddie, that’s her name, and I play all the time! I love to run and tussle with her! She’s a bit faster than I am on the straight always! I also play with the Bassett Hound next door. My foster dad says I’m very sweet and I love as much attention as I can get! I even love belly rubs! I enjoy car rides and going to the ice cream store for a scoop of the white stuff!! Yum! If you’re interested in adopting me you can contact CCRCNY! I’m being fostered near Rochester, NY.

Hi, I'm Turtle Soup! I'm a nervous little girl who was picked up as a stray with my seven siblings. While some of my other siblings are relaxed, even in the noisy shelter, I'm having a harder time feeling comfortable. With a home full of love, though, I know I will be able to feel more at ease!

Because I'm just a puppy, I have a lot of energy so I need a home with someone who will play with me and invest the time into training me so I can meet all of my paw-tential! With a little bit of time and lots of treats, I'm sure to be the perfect pup! 

I am currently located in Texas but am available for adoption in multiple states across the country. My out of state adoption fee is $750. This fee includes:
     spay/neuter
     age-appropriate vaccinations 
     a registered microchip
     a heartworm test (if over 6 months)
     current flea/tick prevention
     the health certificate for travel
     the cost of travel (drivers, gas, and vehicle maintenance)

If you’d like, we can meet on a video call (Skype, FB Messenger call, Facetime, etc). My adoption will be finalized and the fee will be processed the day before transport.

Apply at to adopt me at
https://www.shelterluv.com/form/other/BRAZ/213-long-distance-adopt-app

or email jami@spcabc.org.

Hi, my name is Fontaine! I am a young, adorable, and energetic dog excited to find my forever home. I am a very good boy-sweet, playful and charming. I have yet to meet a stranger and greet everyone as a potential friend, especially if they bring me treats or toys!

I am almost completely potty-trained, walk great on a leash, and do really well in a bath. I'm also incredibly smart; it would be a breeze to teach me anything you want! With my friendly and outgoing personality, I am sure to make a great addition to any family who can give me the love and care I need. My friends at the shelter are noticing that I am losing a lot of weight from being in the stressful shelter environment, so I hope a family chooses me soon!

Hi, my name is Lazarus! I'm a two-year old mixed-breed with a lot of energy and personality. I'm a very loyal boy, and love to play. Plus, I'll do literally anything for a snack. I already know some basic commands, but I am smart enough to learn whatever you want as long as there are treats involved! 

I've been at the SPCA of Brazoria County since before Christmas. When I came in, I had a shock collar on. It had been on so long, it had embedded in my neck and I had a total of four puncture holes where the prongs had settled in! Luckily, my friends at the SPCA are kind and worked to earn my trust, and I've turned into quite the good boy. 

A few people have been drawn to my beautiful eyes and coat, but I haven't found my fur-ever home yet. I'm hoping that my perfect family will come along soon!

Behold, I present to you the delightful and enchanting Nadia, a true embodiment of joy and bashfulness, on her quest to find her forever home. Nadia, a mesmerizing blend of American Pit Bull Terrier and German Shepherd, exudes a charm that is simply irresistible. At the age of approximately 18 weeks, she has already received complete veterinary care, ensuring her well-being and health.

Nadia's heart brims with an abundance of love, eagerly waiting to be shared with her new family. Her soulful eyes sparkle with anticipation, yearning for cuddles.  With a spring in her step, she eagerly anticipates long strolls in the great outdoors, exploring new paths and embarking on countless adventures.

Nadia has mastered the art of walking gracefully on a leash, making every outing a delightful experience. Her friendly and sociable nature extends to both dogs and people, making her an ideal companion for anyone seeking a furry friend to enrich their lives.

Nadia is not just a pup in search of a home, but a radiant spirit ready to illuminate the lives of those fortunate enough to welcome her. With her playful demeanor, unwavering loyalty, and a heart brimming with affection, Nadia is destined to become the cherished member of a loving family.

description:
Allow me to regale you with a delightful tale of a jovial and exuberant canine companion named Nico, who is currently on the lookout for his forever abode. This charming young lad happens to be a delightful blend of an American Pit Bull Terrier and a German Shepherd, resulting in a truly unique and captivating mix of breeds. At a tender age of approximately 18 weeks, Nico has already received thorough veterinary care, leaving no stone unturned in ensuring his well-being.

But it's not just Nico's physical attributes that make him a standout candidate for adoption; his endearing personality truly sets him apart. With an infectious zest for life, this sweet boy is brimming with happiness, social charm, and a thirst for exciting escapades. Nico eagerly awaits moments of cozy cuddles, leisurely strolls, and thrilling expeditions into the unknown.

What's more, Nico has already undergone leash training, demonstrating his willingness to explore the outside world alongside his future human companion. Additionally, he has proven to be amiable and affable towards both fellow canines and people, making him an ideal candidate for families or individuals seeking a four-legged friend with a naturally friendly disposition.

So, if you're searching for a furry companion who can fill your days with laughter and adventure, look no further than Nico. Give him a chance, and he will shower you with boundless affection, loyalty, and a lifetime of unforgettable memories.

She is very energetic and would benefit from having an active hooman that makes sure she gets some dedicated playtime and teach her some basic commands to help her focus and settle down. She's good with the inside foster cats once she has a chance to meet them, not sure about outside cats. Nova is house broken and crate-trained, and she's waiting for her new life.

Gracie loves to play in the water bowl and go for a swim on hot days.  She also wants to cuddle up right next to you or under the covers for bedtime. Meet Nala!!!  

This little girl is a unique case that we are hoping to find a special adopter for.  Nala was found roaming a neighborhood with a large tumor (pictured in comments).  We agreed to take her into rescue and got her into our vet quickly.  During her spay, it was determined the tumor was an adenocarcinoma (mostly likely cancerous tumor) that was attached to her vagina/anal glands.  The vet totally removed the tumor with no issues for Nala, but did tell us that it could come back.  

Currently, Nala is a healthy 3 to 4 year old Chihuahua Mix that weighs around 9 - 10 lbs.  Her adopter just needs to know her background and that she may have another tumor that comes back and would be willing to just LOVE HER and provide a wonderful home until that happens.  (Note:  She had lived several years with the tumor as large as it was with no issues).  Nala gets along with kids, dogs and cats.  She loves to sit in your lap and sleep under the covers.

We really just want this sweetheart to get all the attention she deserves in a forever home, so will be willing to waive any adoption fee to help with that.  If transported, we would ask the adopter to pay for the transport fee.

Maggie was found dumped in a dirt road and saved by her first foster dad. After a month with him, it’s time to find her forever home.

A few key points about Maggie- Maggie loves snuggles, and she can typically be found cuddled up on someone’s chest or as the little spoon. She’s somewhat of a mosey along type of girl. She tends to be mellow as a default- she isn’t initiating a ton of play, but will feed off of another dog’s energy. Her best home is probably one with another dog that can help her learn the ropes of the house- for instance, she does best on a leash when she has another dog to follow (but she doesn’t pull, so easy to walk!). She doesn’t love crates, but she currently free roams a small area in her foster home with access to a doggy door. Like any 8 month old puppy, Maggie sometimes finds some mischief. The cat is quite intriguing right now, and no matter how much she barks at it, it still won’t play.

tags: Shy Would Love To Be A Couch Potato
description:
Freyja is looking for an experienced dog parent that has had large dogs in the past.   She needs a patient person that has dealt with shy and scared dogs.  Freyja was dumped on a dark road in the middle of nowhere and was almost hit by a car. She had obviously recently had puppies that were no where to be found.  A kind lady took her  in but she can't keep her.  
She is so amazing the stuffed animals and stuffed beds explode with excitement in her presence!   She is a very affectionate dog that would love to snuggle on the couch.  She really need a loving family that can be home with her and take her on car rides because she love to ride, especially with the windows down.
She just loves her 9 yo human foster sister (her favorite person).  Sometimes she forgets she is a pretty big girl and excitedly likes to jump on people as she runs and plays. We are working on that to correct that behavior.  Due to her size caution and training recommended for her.   She will need help with housebreaking, since her fosters  work long hours and have not been able to keep her in the house and set her on potty schedule.  She is not a fan of her crate and can be vocal about it.  She is not a fan of my crate and can be vocal about it.  Like a typical pitbulI she will need some strong chew toys.  What she really needs is a family with time, patience and some experience with training to see the potential she has to be a wonderful companion.  She is great off lead.

Sally is a sweet girl who is searching for her forever home. She is a sweet, dorky but smart girl that loves attention.  She is about 18 months old, female shepherd mix breed. She is about 65 pounds.  

She came into the system after someone noticed she was tied to a dog house with no other source of shade. 

She is a sweet, medium energy girl that gets along with everyone!  She loves playing, but her fosters are a retired couple with more dogs than energy.  She  loves kids, cats and dogs.  She is crate trained.   She does well with change and adapts very quickly.  She loves treats and toys (Sometimes to pieces.). She loves water.  

She has so much potential to be an amazing companion with some one on one attention.  She has watched other puppies come and go and still she is here with us.

Our dogs are fostered in Texas but available for adoption in the Northern States.  We have transports that leave Texas monthly.  Our out of state adoption fee is $600 per dog. This fee includes spay/neuter, current vaccinations, a registered microchip, a negative heart worm test (if over 6 months old), health certificate, flea/tick monthly preventative and transport costs. The adoption interview/meet and greet occurs on video call (Skype, FB Messenger call, Face time, etc). The adoption application and fee would be finalized prior to transport. To learn more about Second Chance Dog Rescue, visit our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/scdrsnyder

Kinzo is about 3 years old boy who is devoted to his people, he wants to go with you everywhere. He listens well and seems to like everyone he meets. Does great traveling and knows some commands. 
Kinzo likes other dogs and likes to chase cats but when gotten close to one he leaves them alone.  He was surrendered due to a dislocated leg that has since healed, his owner loved him dearly but due to circumstances beyond his control he wasn’t able to give Kinzo the rest he needed to heal. 
He will do best with a person that can be by his side at all times, he also does good in a kennel. He loves chest scratches and will paw at you if he thinks you should continue scratching.

Meet Mia !! She is the biggest ball of love !! Mia loves the water, playing with other doggies & humans. she’s great with kids and all dogs. Mia was born into foster and as she grew we noticed her two back legs are what the vet calls “cow hocked”, that means her hocks are set inwards resulting in a splayed appearance in her back legs. but that doesn’t slow her down one bit!! she’s had no issues with it and we hope this doesn’t effect her from being adopted, she’s just as amazing if not more!

Introducing Piper, a vivacious and loving hound mix who is ready to find her forever home! At 3 years old and a robust 75 pounds, Piper is the perfect blend of energy and affection.

Energetic and Playful:

Piper is bursting with energy and enthusiasm for life. She loves to run, play, and explore, making her an ideal companion for an active family. Whether it’s a game of fetch in the yard or a long hike in the woods, Piper is always up for an adventure.

Great with Everyone:

One of Piper’s most endearing qualities is her friendly nature. She gets along wonderfully with other dogs, is gentle with cats, and adores children. Her social and easygoing demeanor makes her a fantastic addition to any family dynamic.

Eager to Learn:

Piper is a smart and curious girl who thrives on mental stimulation. She would greatly benefit from a family willing to invest time in her training. With her eagerness to learn and please, Piper is sure to excel with positive reinforcement and consistent guidance.

What Piper Needs:

Active Lifestyle: A family that can provide plenty of exercise and playtime.
Training Commitment: Someone willing to spend time on her training to help her become the best pup she can be.
Love and Attention: Piper thrives on companionship and would love a home where she can be a true family member.
If you’re looking for a loyal and lively companion who will fill your days with joy and excitement, Piper is the perfect match for you. She’s ready to shower her new family with love and become a cherished member of your household.

Kai is a young energetic Husky mix. He knows sit, shake, lay down. He needs mental and physical stimulation to keep him healthy and busy. He was adopted as a young puppy and returned for nipping. While with us he lost a tooth so he was a teething puppy at the time who needed to be taught manners. He has shown resource guarding behaviors at times. This is not a dog for a 1st time dog owner. He needs a routine and a confident handler. He is handsome, smart and loyal but he does need the right fit.

R2H minimum adoption age is 25 years old.

Bolt was rescued from the outskirts of Houston, Texas where the number of homeless pets is a sad and overwhelming plight.  He was transported to a home in Colorado where he has attached strongly to the family he currently resides with there.

Bolt has a comical personality and loves to toss his toys around and to gallop around the backyard. His other favorite past time is snuggling with his people. Bolt has become inseparable with the young human child in the house and he and Bolt spend most of their days joined at the hip. 

Bolt is extremely soulful and devoted to whomever he attaches to as his family. He loves his people so much that it leads him to feel overly protective of them with outside visitors. Bolt's current home is devastated that they are unable to be his forever family, due to their home being high traffic with many visitors.  It takes Bolt a long time to accept new visitors into the home and for him to understand that new people are not a threat to him or his family.

Bolt enjoys being the only dog in the house and is not a fan of sharing his people with other dogs. We are seeking a home for Bolt in which unfamiliar visitors are rare, as this would allow him to feel safest.  His undying loyalty to his owner(s) would make him the most devoted companion to a lucky family of his own. 

Roams to Homes Rescue will arrange transportation for Bolt to an approved adopter anywhere in the United States.

R2H minimum adoption age is 25 years old.

Opal is a gem!  Pretty, petite Opal is happy, sweet, loving gal.  Opal loves meeting new people and her anticipation for meeting someone new is adorable.  If you don't want pups on the furniture, Opal probably isn't the best pup for you, this girl loves to be up on the coach with you for all the snuggles you care to give.

Opal is good with other dogs and loves running and playing with her foster brother Ranger.  She may be little and petite but this girl has some athletic moves.  Not much for fetch, or at least hasn't shown interest in chasing the ball.  Opal loves chewing on bones and is becoming quite the Kong expert.

Opal loves being with her person really more than with other dogs so a home with or without other dogs is fine with her.  She sleeps in her crate in her foster mom's bedroom.  Opal is good on a leash and enjoys her nightly neighborhood walk, exploring and smelling everything. If you are looking for a perfectly medium-sized pup with a big heart, stunning eyes and endearing personality, you have found the complete package.  Submit your adoption application for Opal today.

Amora was dumped on the streets of NYC and brought to the New York Animal Care Centers by police on April 27th.

She was terrified and not doing well at the shelter. 

Her time was coming to an end and she needed a savior.  A wonderful woman decided to step up for her and therefore saving her life.

She is now ready for her forever home.


Amora's STATS                 

Approximate age: 1 year        
Approximate weight: 68 lbs              
Breed (s): American Staffordshire Terrier mix    
Spayed or neutered?: yes
Good with:       

kids? Unknown, but likely older kids 13+ 
strangers?  Needs slow introductions with new people. She can warm up to them with treats and several meetings.     
other dogs?  Yes, she loves playing with other dogs, both small and large 
cats? Yes, either ignores cats or sniffs and walks away    
On leash? Yes, she does well on leash with minimal pulling on walks
Housetrained? Yes, she is perfectly house trained. She has not had a single accident in her foster home.           
Crate trained?  Yes, she is good in crate up to 8 hrs at her foster home. She may whine a little at first, but will settle down especially with a bone. She did better in the crate when we placed it near our other dogs crate. 


 Amora’s perfect home would be with adults or older children (13+) who will initially take the time to earn her trust because believe me, it is so worth it! She is a sweetheart who just wants to be loved, but just needs a little extra time and effort in the beginning for her to warm up to a new family. A relatively calm household with not many visitors may be best for this reason. She does well with other dogs and ideally, her perfect home would have other dogs since they help her confidence and she loves to play with them. She is also happy to be relaxing on the couch and will gladly lay down and take a nap. She is good mix of a dog who is active while also knowing how to be a couch potato. Since she mostly ignores cats, they’re okay too!

Amora LOVES rolling in the grass.  Likes to play fetch, may or may not bring the ball back
Very snuggly with her people. She is a shadow who follows you around the house and always want to be with you. 
Knows sit and we are working on down and touch
Thinks she is a lap dog despite her size

Amora can be shy/timid with new people. She needs someone who will go slow with her and understands it can take several visits with a new person for her to warm up to them. Once you win her trust though, it’s worth it!  

Fearful of new situations outside her home. Her foster home is currently working to build her confidence in these situations and she will need someone who will either be content staying at home with her or can continue to work with her outside the home. 

Amora is a 1 year old female who came to us from NYC ACC where she was at risk of euthanasia due to being fearful in the overcrowded shelter. Her shelter notes say “This poor, sweet girl.  This girl was brought to the shelter as a stray, but one would think beautiful AMORA was dumped by here family and was all alone in the streets not knowing who to turn to or where.  She is trembling in her kennel and so incredibly scared.  She is not aggressive.  When someone comes to visit her and take her out, she continues to tremble with her little tail tucked.  But when this new friend opens her door and kneels down, saying softly “want to go for a walk outside sweet girl?” she finds in herself the courage to slowly move forward and walks quickly with them to the play yard.  She is soft and gentle, quiet and good.  She doesn’t want to be a bother. She wants so much to be loved and comforted.  She just needs that quiet, calm, loving space where she can decompress and then warm at here own pace to a new life and a new family who will never, ever abandon her again.  We know she is holding her heart close, but we also know that Amora would be all love and cuddles, loyalty and devotion to the family that chooses her to be their friend.”  In the short time she’s been in her foster home so far, time and patience have already made a world of a difference from her description in the shelter. She has already started to come out of her shell to show her playful, loving personality. While she does take time to warm up to people, she has a lot of love to give to the right family. She is a dog who will initially be an investment of time and effort to gain her trust, but in the end, it will pay off for her forever family because she truly is an amazing dog.

R2H minimum adoption age is 25 years old.

Phelps is a precious, playful puppy still looking for his people. Phelps is currently located in east Texas part of another unwanted litter of puppies. When you meet Phelps you will love him instantly, he is curious but cautious. He will run up to play out of curiosity. The way to his heart is through his stomach, this boy loves to eat and just a few treats, you'll be besties. Phelps is good with other dogs, loves running and exploring.

If Phelps' is anything like his mother, she has a glowing temperament, wonderful with all people, children, other dogs, and cats. She looks very much like a very petite shepherd or kelpie mix and weighs only 40ish lbs. This litter of puppies is also on the petite side, and we believe that they will most likely take after their mother and be similar to her medium stature. Every puppy from this litter that was lucky enough to score a foster home thus far has received raving complements from their fosters. Their fosters report to us that they are extremely smart puppies, with great dispositions. All in foster homes have picked up potty training quickly for their young age and are very much people pleasers. We know that Phelps will shine once in a home and that there is a family out there who will feel incredibly lucky for him to complete them.

Danica is an the adorable bundle of joy guaranteed to bring laughter and love into you life! Danica has a laid back, chill personality and sweetness that you can help but love her instantly. She is friendly but a little cautious at first as see feels you out. But she is eager to please and will make a wonderful family pet.

Her puppy antics are sure to bring a smile to your face. Danica loves to explore, play with her littermates and running around without a care in the world. You are sure to love her sweet nature. If you're ready to welcome a new member to the family, apply today, you'll love this gal!

Rose is a friendly young adult girl. She likes other dogs but a meet n greet is required. She is a silly and goofy dog. Housebroke. Enjoys walks.

IS YOUR HOME SADIE'S PERFECT FUREVER HOME? Sadie is a beautiful 5 year old purebred 40 lb. liver/white female Brittany. She is spayed, heartworm negative, up to date on vaccines and on heartworm and flea and tick preventatives. This sweet girl is also housetrained and crate trained. Sadie is highly active and loves to explore outside. Her foster mom has never witnessed her digging or trying to escape and Sadie has excellent recall. Sadie would love to have a big yard where she could run and explore. With proper training and supervision, Sadie's foster mom thinks Sadie would be a candidate for an invisible fence. In true Brittany fashion, Sadie is both intelligent and eager to please. Sadie does pull when walked on a leash and even though her foster mom and dad are working with her, she will need continued and consistent training. Although Sadie will tolerate other dogs, she is not extremely fond of their company. Sadie would love a home where she has no fursiblings. She has lived in a home where she was the only dog and that is what she is accustomed to. If you are looking for a beautiful smart middle-aged Brittany lady and you want an only dog, then Sadie could definitely be your gal! Her adoption fee is only $350 (to help cover vetting and to allow NBRAN to help rescue other furbabies like Sadie). Don't forget that NBRAN will transport adopted dogs up to 1400 miles, with the adopter only being responsible for the last approximate 100 miles. To learn more about Sadie, contact Suzanne Horsley ztasuzanne@gmail.com or Deb Tuthill agilitybrits@epbfi.com

Everyone meet Abby! She’s about 2 years old although she acts like a puppy.. she is very sweet, loves her balls and has been great with everyone. Did well on her dog test prior to coming but a bit too playful for my dogs. She is crate trained, working on housetraining and jumping. A bit mouthy like a puppy but redirect able.. she is available for adoption at www.mountainrottierescue.net Mountain Rottie Rescue

Gigi is a shy girl, learning that life is good. She adores other dogs and would do best with another confident housemate to show her the ropes. Gigi is extremely gentle and loving, not a mean bone in her body. We are working on house training and crates up perfectly when asked. With a little work this young girl will be a super star. She is thin at maybe 25 lbs and she’s tall- she will be a 60 plus pound dog. She is currently 5-6 months old. If you are interested please submit an application on our website www.mountainrottierescue.net

Super Heroes meet Midnight! This sweet girl and her sister came to us looking for a chance at a better life. Midnight is a year old so she still has a lot of puppy energy, and is still learning, but she is eager to learn! She is looking for someone to spend time with her and show her what it really means to be a dog, and what it means to be a part of a family. If you have been searching for a cuddle partner, you have to come meet Midnight! Stop by SHHS today, or give us a call to schedule a meet and greet!

OJ.. this guy really is something special. He is such love bug. Like most big dogs, he is oblivious to his size and will not hesitate to snuggle his way right into your lap. OJ is still a very young guy and his mannerisms are quite puppy-like. OJ didn't have the best start to things. When he first arrived he was in pretty poor shape. Since being at SHHS he has really blossomed. He has been learning how to play with toys and his overall confidence has drastically improved. He has also gained quite a bit of weight and is finally at a healthy size. OJ's desire to please is so strong it can be overwhelming at times. He wants so badly to bond with his handler that sometimes his excitement gets the better of him. What he is really looking for is security and stability in both his person and environment. OJ is housetrained and knows basic commands. He even walks quite well on a leash. 

OJ does not do well with other dogs, but may be fine with cats. 

To summarize OJ:

*Excitement level = Giant Puppy
*Must be an only animal
* Must be fed in a safe space
*11/10 Snuggler

Did we mention he's super duper handsome and the goodest boy?!

If you feel OJ may be a good fit for your family, contact SHHS today to come and meet him!

Hi! I'm Bear The German Shepherd. I may be older but that doesn't stop me from living an active lifestyle. I love to run around and play. I prefer to live with adults only. A quiet home with lots of space to run and explore would be ideal for me.

Hi! I'm Spud!
I'm a goofy lab with lots of energy! I am looking for a family who is patient and will teach me some new tricks. If you're looking for a pal that will love you unconditionally and make you laugh, then I'm your guy!

breeds_label: Pit Bull Terrier & English Coonhound Mix
description:
Hi! My name is Beauregard, Beau for short. I'm a young goofy boy with a lot of energy. I love attention from people and enjoy a good butt scratch. I can jump very high so a home with a tall fence would be ideal. I have some learning to do but with a good amount of treats I'm ready to pay attention. 
How could you say no this handsome face?

Hi! My name is Gigi. I am a sweet young girl looking for my forever home. Treats and butt scratches are the key to my heart! I would love to find a home where I can gain confidence and learn to experience life in a positive way. I enjoy the company of other dogs as long as they are larger than me. I am very particular about who I share a home with and must have a feline-free home. If you are a patient person who would love to add a playful, fun and spunky young pup to your life then I'm your gal!
